description:
This place has awesome pizza! A recent trip to the city found me here for dinner and my wife and I split a pie. It was a short walk from our hotel on top of Nob Hill. They have some fresh baked breads on the table for a starter and the thick focaccia style bread was sooooooo  good! It was light, herby, and fluffy in the middle and had a crunchy and slightly salty crust....

   The pizza was a style I like but haven't found many places that do it right. It's thin crust but a soggy thin crust you have to eat with a fork. Soggy and pizza are not usually a good thing but when it's done right it can be amazing. In Italy they don't slice pizza's but rather serve them on a plate to eat with a fork. That's what this reminded me of. 

   We got the Italian sausage pizza off the menu and added some anchovies. The crust was nice and chewy-gooey swimming in a simple tomato sauce and covered with just the right amount of cheese. The toppings were plentiful and added substance and texture to the soft crust. The anchovies took it to the next level with an awesome salty goodness that you can only get from that topping. All in all it was awesome, I wanted to order a second pie but splitting one plus the extra bread was plenty of food for my wife and I.

    Next time I'm in this area I'm going to come back for a repeat of perfection,  give'em a try!
author: Mark F.

description:
We came here on Fleet Week, out Uber driver said this place was good and he drop us off down at the main street and it was a HIKE to this cafe that was not close to the other restaurant we were thinking of going...

I would was the place was small, like a small mom & pop place where the loco's goes. The food was okay, nothing exciting and different. 

I got the Linguine & Clam and it was can clam with lots of lemon juice...
author: Christina H.

description:
The best local date spot in SF. Do yourself a favor and order the penne betolla (add sausage).

Non Hill cafe doesn't take reservations so be related for a wait. The good news is you can order a bottle of wine and sip it outside under their twinkle lights. 

Advice - get a waitlist management system so your guests don't have to wait outside if they don't want to.85: very cold and windy at the top of the hill.
author: Gianna D.

description: Charming local restaurant. The food and the service is exquisite! Love this place!
author: Connie M.

description:
Live in the neighborhood and came to grab a bowl of spaghetti carbonara to have my dreams crushed. 

1) watery 
2) burnt 
3) not real pancetta 
4) burnt 
5) serious lack of flavor 


I came here years ago before I moved and this spot was great but damn I wish I didn't come here tonight for dinner. I'm legit sad. 

Proper carbonara is supposed to have this golden yellow hue from the egg...this was a tan color thanks to the burnt bacon bits 

Even the bread basket had bread with cardamom in it which was weird for "Italian" but then again the menu of specials had a yellow curry pasta for heavens sake...

Stick to legitimate Italian people please
author: Nats S.

description:
I had such a lovely dinner experience at Nob Hill Cafe last week!

I was with a larger group for a small restaurant (six of us), and the hostess was so accommodating. She gave us frequent updates on the status of a table and then suggested we split into two groups so we could get seated faster. While this certainly isn't ideal for a group dinner, we really appreciated her being so attentive to us and ultimately decided to split up since we were starving!

My table shared the penne with vodka sauce, linguine with clams and the gnocchi with ragu. I thought the gnocchi was exceptional. They were light and airy and the sauce was so rich and flavorful. Definitely the standout. I also really enjoyed the vodka sauce, although it had a little more heat than I was expecting. The linguine itself was delicious and cooked perfectly, but I thought the sauce left something to be desired. Maybe some parsley or lemon, but it just fell a little flat. 

I'm looking forward to coming back to Nob Hill Cafe and exploring more of the menu. It's cute and quaint and they definitely know how to make a good bowl of pasta.
author: Sophie S.

description:
Amazing find!!!
Food: food was amazing!!!! You can pretty much add whatever you want to any dish. I love that this place is very flexible. Food is classic Italian, and well seasoned. 
Atmosphere: place is a little too small for my liking. We were sitting at the table for two next to the door, and it was extremely cold. I would recommend making reservations.Our waitress was amazing! I wish I could remember her name! She was full of life, had a big smile and good conversation!
Price: Reasonable not too pricey.
All in all I had an excellent experience.
author: Angelica N.

description: Came here on a Friday night and waited about an hour for a table for two.  The place is super homey, and the food is very straightforward.  We got the penne bettola with sausage and gnocchi bolognese.  The portion sizes were very big, and the taste was fine.  Might be a good place to go if you're looking for some Italian comfort food, but not the right spot for trying something interesting or new.
author: Simon L.

description:
I had a friend visiting from out of the states and her manager had raves about this place so we went there for lunch. We got here early before lunch so we didn't have to wait. We ordered the gnocchi bonoglese and the margherita pizza which were absolutely delicious. Our waiter was also very polite and courteous.

I absolutely recommend eating here for lunch or dinner!
author: Adaeze E.

description:
Blasted into this Nob Hill gem for the first time this evening. The gnocchi bolognese was simply delicious as was the pasta my wife ordered - spaghetti with whole tomatoes and herbs. 
Hostess was friendly as we waited a bit and service was outstanding. Lovely restaurant that will see us back for sure.
author: Harris T.

description: Came here late Monday morning before the lunch rush and had the Cragel Sando and I wanted more.  The cafe had a homey vibe and was very comfortable to eat here.
author: Patricia K.

description: I came here for a date night and it was absolutely the most adorable Italian restaurant. We tried the fettuccine and pesto tortellini. Both dishes that were very well prepared and the portions were just right. It's not an Italian restaurant where the portions are small and delicate, it's perfect.
author: Ricky A.

description:
Our Air B&B was located right near little Italy and China town. Not having a car and hiking all day, we wanted something close. We found this little gem. Our timing was perfect as we scored the last table. When we left there were 10 people waiting outside.

We weren't super hungry but needed something before we turned in for the evening. Eating and drinking your way through SF can take a lot out of you.

My wife ordered the carbonara which was ok. Problem is my wife makes killer carbonara that puts this one to shame. I ordered pesto.

Both were good but a bit on the bland side. Bread was kinda stale. But prices were good and the waitress was great.

Ordered the proseccco for us. It wasn't flat but I got the feeling it had been open for awhile. Or just really low quantity. 

With so much good food in the city I'd probably go somewhere else next time.

I did however eat my leftovers at about two am in my underwear. Actually tasted better than when I was in the restaurant!
author: Todd J.

description:
Nob Hill Cafe is your neighborhood hole in the wall. I live so close and I've been coming for year, I'm a regular but my first review.
Family setting you're always greeted warmly. My go-to favorite is the penne botola.
 All the staff are great! 
Shout out to the chef
I usually do it to go order saves standing in the line.
author: kim f.

description:
One of the best, if not the best Italian food in San Francisco. I have dinner here twice and had brunch once. The brunch was good but not at the level of he dinner dishes. We had bolognese gnocchi, it melts in your mouth. Their caesar salad is simple and delicious. 
The butternut squash ravioli is flavorful and cooked to perfection. The polenta was soft and with the parmesan cheese sprinkled on top it just gets better. 
Come early, there is no reservation and the wait can be up to an hour for dinner.
author: Marcia d.

description: Outstanding pocket Italian cafe in Nob Hill.  Try the spaghetti carbonara and start with the carpaccio.
author: Ryan T.

description:
Wow, did this place impress me!

I have lived in San Francisco my entire life and drive by here often. This whole time I though this was a normal cafe where you buy sandwiches for lunch and sit there with your laptop to get worked done..... WRONG! It is actually the complete opposite.

Me and my boyfriend came here for a cute intimate Italian dinner date. We had read all the reviews on Yelp and played with he menu hours before. It is definitely true that their is a wait time outside in the cold, but at least they let you order drinks while you wait and there are a few tables outside too. There are two sections of the restaurant that have two different vibes. One is more bright and has a bit more of a casual feel. The other room has dimmed lights, candles everywhere, and feels more date-like.

Everything on the menu sounded great. I had a hard time choosing, but an amazing honest waitress that gave us the rundown on everything!

Wr started off with bread and had continued to drink our bottle of wine that we began drinking during our wait. The bread was okay! We also ordered the carpaccio as our "antipasti" and it was so yummy. It was my first time trying it, and I was very impressed.
After hearing our waitress's opinion I decided to order the gnocchi bolognese. She told me the recipe for the gnocchi was a homemade restaurant recipe so that it would be unique to my dinner experience versus getting something that is good, but can also be found to be good somewhere else. I was sold, and absolutely in love with the dish. The gnocchi texture was perfect and so good. The pasta sauce was rick, and the sausage/beef was an amazing mix.

My boyfriend ordered something off of their special menu for the night. He ordered the seafood linguini that was mixed with calamari, muscles, shrimp, and a spicy tomato sauce. It was bomb! (Yes, I tried his dish because it looked way too good to not try it) The linguini was perfectly cooked, the sauce had a perfect spice too it. I don't eat spicy and could definitely handle the kick.

For dessert, we ordered their special menu snickerdoodle cheesecake, and a kahlua gelato on top of cheesecake and a heath bar on top. ORDER DESSERT IT IS SO GOOD!

I was truly impressed with this place and didn't think it was going to be as good as it was. Super happy I tried out this San Francisco neighborhood gem! I will definitely be back!
author: Kassie E.

description:
Today's cathartic, rainy day lunch for one marks my 4th visit to this quaint Nob Hill neighborhood jewel. My very first visit happened by chance. Years ago, before becoming a SF resident, my dining companions and myself wanted to have dinner & decided to "wing it." The place we intended to go had an incongruous wait time, so we trudged a few blocks over & stumbled upon Nob Hill Cafe, sat in the dining room to the right, in the cozy window booth. 

It's a small family-owned restaurant with a warm & homey feel, clad with a tasteful amount of white lights adorning the exterior, to twinkle at you while you sit & sip your Chardonnay while you wait on a busy night. There are two dining rooms- one (where the main entrance is) is all tables and shares the room with an open kitchen. The other dining room houses the bar and a couple window booths. I've dined on both sides & have found it to be pleasant, admittedly, I have a partiality for a quaint window seat booth. 

Recommendations: 
If you are a fan of garlic-pink-sauce-perfection, I highly recommend the PENNE BETTOLA, my absolute favorite dish here. It's served piping hot, throw some Parmesan and pepper on that bad boy and enjoy! The Tortellini Romana with Pesto sauce is also a good choice (the Pesto sauce is delish!). You can also request a side for your bread. Pizza is Tuscan style & nice if you're in the mood for that. They have daily specials written on the chalk board that have always proven to be worth checking out. 

As for dessert, but of course, there is the house made Tiramisu. If you are Tiramisu'd out, I really recommend the Gelato desserts (Gelato served as a slice of pie, essentially). The Strawberry White Chocolate & Spumoni  will hit the spot!  

Ironically, now I live in the neighborhood and one of the Perks (for my tastebuds, if nothing else) is having this lovely restaurant 3 blocks away. Prices are very reasonable and service is lovely. They get very busy for dinner, so if you are under time constraints, just know that there will be a wait. If you're an introvert seeking delectable pasta, try coming during lunch- it's much more mellow, no wait, and you may just score that cozy window seat. 

Mangia Bene!
author: Amanda A.

description:
My favorite Italian spot in the city.

Pasta is always fresh and just has the right amount of firmness. I've had numerous dishes here and they never disappoint. Their sauces are so dang good. There's a reason why the line is always out the door... and it's worth the wait. I would avoid big parties here as they don't take reservations and the restaurant is a bit small. Either avoid busy times or order take out.

Two bathrooms. Avoid going to the one next to the kitchen as it is just about the smallest restroom I've ever seen!
author: Michelle C.

description: I had the carbonara and it was the most blandest shit ever. I noticed tables around us had servers asking diners if they wanted cheese on top of their dish, but no one came and asked us. Nobody even bothered to check on us or refill our waters during our entire time there. At the end, when our server finally came to bring us our bill (after we flagged her down), I told her how disappointed we were with the food and the lack of service from her and her only response was, "ok that's fine." She clearly didn't care about her tip.
author: Kat E.

description:
So, I have to admit we have been coming to the NH Cafe for years and I'm just now reviewing....

We visit San Francisco as often as possible and most times we end up here to eat.  This visit my daughter had chosen a new place and to our disappointment the service was horrible so we reached out to Nob Hill and thankfully were told they were still open for lunch.  We quickly made our way - thrilled that once again we get to eat at one our all time favorite spots.  

As usual we were greeted and seated as quickly as possible (they don't take reservations and the space is small, so be patient.) The kitchen was still extremely busy and working like a well worn machine - the staff here has a great system that gets delicious food out fast.  

We each ordered something different: Tortellini, Lasagna, Spaghetti and the Gnocchi.  All came out super hot and full of authentic Italian flavors.  There wasn't a favorite because ALL were flipping amazing!  
Thanks once again for providing a fabulous eating experience in the San Francisco Area.  

Things to Keep in Mind when visiting - they do close between lunch and dinner and parking is difficult as it is anywhere in the city.
author: Kristie A.

description:
This place was busy on a Saturday night around 7:30 pm, so we ordered takeout. It's a 5 minute walk from the Fairmont and is just half a block from Grace Cathedral. The wait for a table looked about an hour long, but you can drink your wine outside while you wait.

The open kitchen is near the door and the aroma flows out to the street. The food is excellent, but it would be best to phone ahead of time.
author: Curtis T.

description: Wow! Great food, great service, and a hidden gem in san fran! We got there before the dinner rush and I understand why there's a bunch of people waiting to get in. Id wait here any day. It has charm and it's a packed restaurant but it felt great to be surrounded by happy people and being able to see the chefs cook up delicious food right next to us. The gnocchi, linguine, and lasagna were so soft and the red sauce was not like anything i've ever had. Even the bread was fluffy and it's crust was perfectly crunchy. An authentic italian meal plus wine to top it off. And the tiramisu was heaven-sent.
author: Brittany C.

description:
Where to begin? Saturday, early evening in the city, a friend decided to bring us to Nob Hill Cafe, a little (did I say little?) neighborhood jaunt. The wait for four, arriving before 6pm, no reservations allowed, we knew we were looking at a bit of a wait ... BUT, not over an hour! Sweet baby Jesus! The wait was ATROCIOUS! Tables of two were flying by us, looking at us, and actually a nice woman, as she walked by, said, "sending you good vibes!" And still we wait, long enough for two of us to finish an entire bottle of wine. Are you kidding me? 

And finally, we are seated, approximately 90 minutes later ... in the very back, right by the kitchen and bathroom. A very narrow pathway right behind me. As each wait person passes and politely says, "excuse me," I cringe wondering which will spill their full or empty plates down my back. Definitely not a good feeling or experience. I couldn't concentrate on the ambiance or food.

Thankfully the food was good. The lasagna, pork chop and spaghetti carbonara were very tasty and portioned well.

Owner/Manager ... if you want to keep your customers happy during the extensively long wait, hire a host that is attentive to all. Tisk tisk.
author: Cheryl T.

description: This is a real neighborhood joint, kind of sits all by itself in Nob Hill area. I got the gnocchi bolognese via takeout. Real nice folks, food was good, Nice hunk of bread to go with the bolognese. Seems like everyone is having a good time here, very homey.
author: Phil S.

description: Great spot for Saturday night dinner with friends.  AND don't go by the guy who works the door/wait list and brings out wine if you are sitting outside to wait for a table. He's a dick and mad with what he thinks is power.  Not sure if it is the same dick all the time, but the person we encountered when we were there was so horrible.  It's not like he's working the red rope at Studio 54 back in the 70's.  But the waitress was lovely and so patient.  She's a keeper for sure.  We started with salads and they were okay.  I was a little disappointed in presentation because they come in these big deep bowls and it makes it hard to eat a salad this way.  Plus, I swear I think the dressing on the Caesar was from a bottle.  It wasn't bad but I would rather have nice unchopped romaine leaves presented on a plate with cheese, dressing, anchovies and croutons.  The was all bunched together and not attractive and lacked some flavor. However, the pasta was outstanding.  We all had pasta either linguine with clams or the spaghetti carbonara and all was so fresh, great portion size and piping hot.  We were disappointed by dessert.  We ordered the flan and tiramisu and neither one was very good.  The taste was really off.  But it really was a great dinner and such a fun spot on a Saturday night.  I would go back but try to avoid the dick at the door.
author: Lauren A P.

description:
I know this place has been in the area for years and finally since we were headed to the masonic for the psychedelic furs, we decided to get a bite to eat.  Since there was quite a wait, we ordered a meal to go.  While waiting for our order, we sat outside and there were approximately four open tables with none of them cleaned.  There were quite a few people sitting at these tables waiting for their name to be called.  We then received our pizza at the table we were sitting and waiting.  After a few minutes, the person who took our order walked outside and in a very rude voice and tone said, "you need to leave! right! now!  you can't sit here and eat."  We sat there bewildered... this person was so mean and rude to us, berated us in front of about 15 people,... why is this person treating us like we've broken some law and scowled and scolded like a fricken baby of two years of age.
I have never been treated like this in a public setting in my whole life.  If there was some terrible problem with eating their food on a table which is not being used, along with others who are waiting for a table, sitting on these seats,... Nob Hill Cafe, you should list that in your menu or tell patrons upfront instead of what happened to us last night.  

I will never dine here.  I do not tolerate rude workers in establishments.
author: Miyoko N.

description:
If you don't get to the door by 4:50PM (opens at 5:00PM), you may have to wait to be seated for dinner.  There are no reservations.  This is a quiet, neighborhood Italian restaurant that is exceptional in food preparation, dessert choices, wine selection and service.  It is quite small, and you can eat outside if you wish.  You can review the many via the website if you wish.  The dessert ganache is to die for!  But there are many choices that will satisfy your palate.  Ask the server for suggestions and honesty will give the best choices.

This is a low key restaurant that caters to easy-going clientele.  Some don't come thinking you can make the chef create something new for everyone at your table.  Their menu choices are all excellent.  You won't be disappointed but instead you'll be relaxed and full at the end.
author: Chuck T.

description: Incredible Italian Trattoria. Food is delicious, world Class service and incredibly affordable. I once owned the Iron Horse on Maiden Lane. I compare this to it!
author: John K.

description: Stopped in on Sunday before our flight home.  Ordered pizza and the gnocchi bolognese.  The gnocchi was delicious!  Perfectly pillowy and the bolognese was excellent.  Casual and quick - I would definitely recommend it!
author: Maxine P.

description:
What a great neighborhood restaurant.  I always stop by here for lunch or dinner when I'm staying in Nob Hill. It's such a low-key place, with wonderful smells emanating from the kitchen. 

If you like pasta this place is well worth the stop. Unpretentious, just damned good pasta.  Job well done. Love them.
author: Justin W.

description: Went here with out of town friends at their recommendation. We ordered the antipasti, carpaccio and three different pastas- fettuccine with pesto, spaghetti with carbonara and linguine with clams. The antipasti was so bland. Zero flavor. It's as if the vegetables were boiled. One skimpy piece of prosciutto. Terrible. Same with the carpaccio. Zero flavor. ALL OF THE PASTAS WERE HORRIBLE. Bitter, no flavor. I would have been better off getting dry pasta at Safeway and heating up some heavy cream with salt and pepper. With all the amazing restaurants in this City, I seriously cannot believe this place is still in business and that there are people lined up!! Unbelievable. The Olive Garden would be a better bet than this place (and that speaks volumes).
author: Heather H.

description:
Ok so food 5 stars... 6+ if I could... the food is absolutely amazing, consistent, something for everyone at reasonable SF price points.

BUT This review is actually a 1 star review for the hostessing operations that i didn't feel should effect restaurants overall rating because otherwise food service & food is truly very good and I dont want a low star review to effect their rating. (Some
Yelpers are reasonable!)

It used to be that no seat in the house was ever empty... provided you have a host that knows how to work the crystal ball of seating... poor server in the casual room had half full patrons in a fully occupied room!

4 tops can seat 4,3... preferably not 2. Some
2 tops can be combined and some cannot.

No matter the order of guests... you should not put a 2 person at 4 people tables (when you have 4 tops waiting and a bunch of 2 tops coming available or 4 tops that can be split very soon).

Counted 14 empty seats for a whole sitting
While everyone else waited outside. Not good for the business owners and aggravating for people to see outside.

On the flip side, if a couple comes first and has no future in sight of getting a table, i get it... sacrifice a larger table to take care of them. In general, patrons understand how seating goes. Its a combination of inventory of seats AND who came first... but also its about looking into the crystal ball and making some smart judgement calls.

I do love you guys for the food. I hope this is a fair review and helps management with the front... ideally the cleaners next door should be bought out so you can expand lol.

Again the food is amazing. Its worth the wait. Just was an aggravating experience tonight watching hostess make some poor decisions that probably cost you a turn of tables as a whole seating equivalent gave up and left.
author: Roamei A.

description:
Terrible customer service. We waited for over an hour to be seated and they skipped us and gave our table to someone who came after us. 

We told them we were going to a play and we drove for an hour to eat here because we hear the food was good. I can't believe how rude they were
author: Lauren S.

description:
Anything less than a five star review in San Francisco is a disappointment. And so..
We wait for over an hour after being told a half hour. No reservations allowed. The food is basically fine but not stellar with some low points . The calamari salad featured small pieces of marinated calamari in an over vinegary dressing with white beans that were way too crunchy and not cooked enough.  
A special bouillabaisse was simply pasta with The aforementioned small calamari pieces and a few over cooked shrimp. Blah. Not great. The pasta with basil, tomato, garlic and sausage was tasty but not standout. They charged us $9 for $7 glasses of wine. Lasagna very nicely done. Our server was great and I love the Nob Hill neighborhood ambiance.
author: Moe B.

description: Ordered a traditional vodka penne and homemade tiramisu, both superbly authentic and delectable.
author: Brooke A.

description: Best neighborhood Italian place in the city but does get busy. There is no reservations so it's first come, first serve. I've been here like 7 times and the carbonara is the best. Even better than places in Italy as I went carbonara hunting in Rome. The lasagna is great and their basic spaghetti is great. They offer two kinds of bread too, the non-standard one is delicious. The place is small and does feel a little cramped but not unlike what it feels in Europe. Always a good meal and good value.
author: Young Y.

description: Came here with a group of seven- kids and adults. Service was great although space is a little tight for large groups. I called in advance and they had a table ready for us within five minutes. Pasta dishes and salad were great. Small but good wine selection.  Would definitely go back.
author: Suzanne B.

description: Authentic little place with limited seating. Worth the wait. They have amazing seasonal dishes and attentive staff.
author: Kelli S.

description:
This is a really cute little gem nestled in a residential Nob Hill neighborhood. Came here with my friend my first week as an SF resident and it couldn't have been more of a signature San Fransiscan establishment.

There was a bit of a wait but that's to be expected because the place is rather cramped inside. I ordered the gnocchi bolognese and tasted like little clouds of heaven! The sauce was also perfectly seasoned!

I'd come back here to try the pizza which I hear is also KILLER.
author: Connie M.

description: What a gem! We found this quaint little place thanks to Yelp and we were not disappointed! It is a small restaurant but for two old friends looking for a quiet place to catch up over a meal, it was perfect. We had an awesome little table looking out the front window and we so enjoyed people (and dog) watching as we gabbed. And then the food came...the food...THE FOOD! OH SO GOOD! My friend had a pizza and I had fettuccini pesto. Scrumptious! It was absolutely delicious and they were both pleasing to the eye as well as the palette! The service was also good! We were seated immediately and our server was fantastic! Not a single complaint about this place. Wonderful experience from beginning to end!
author: Nancy M.

description: Incredible service,  loved our waiter! AND THE FOOD...  I had the veal on the menu, it was perfection.  My friend had the lasagna,  delicious.  We shared the tiramisu,  very good. I will certainly return.
author: Kasandra V.

description: This place was recommended by the doorman at the hotel Im staying at. I was torn between the Carbonara and the Tortellini with pesto but my server suggested the Tortellini so I went with that.  I think the Tortellini needed a tad bit of salt and the pasta was just a tiny bit undercooked. Otherwise, I'd love to go back again and try something different, maybe that Carbonara!
author: Reginne B.

description:
Visited (fairly impromptu) on a Saturday evening. Wait time was about an hour so we put our names on the list and returned. 
To be honest, I don't know why you wouldn't take reservations. It seems insane and old fashioned to me. We were a party of four, and many parties of three were seated before us. 
All of that being said, it smelt delicious and the food didn't disappoint. The free bread (and butter) basket was great - particularly the tomato focaccia. 
Personally I ordered the pea soup (special), the linguine alla vongole and triple chocolate cheesecake (also a special). It was all really good - the linguine perhaps a little bitter - but the cheesecake was the standout. 
Others in my party ordered the beef carpaccio and caprese appetisers (both great) and the carbonara, a pizza and the penne bettola with chicken. I think if I were to return (I probably wouldn't, due to the wait) I'd opt for the gnocchi bolognese, pesto tortelloni or a pizza. The mains don't come with any veg so I think I'd order a side salad also.
author: Poppy C.

description:
Came here with a group of 7 people and got seated relatively quickly on a weekend. Service was terrific and the waitress was very courteous. I came here primarily for their carbonara so this is what the review will primarily be about.

Spagetti Carbonara - Delicious. Good portion size with the right amount of italian bacon and spaghetti. The only criticism I have is that they had an unequal proportion of sauce to spaghetti resulting in too much sauce that may have been overpowering. Something they can definitely work on. Overall, I would rank this my 3rd best carbonara place I've ever hand, best being Italy (of course) and 2nd being a small joint in Seattle, WA.

Margarita Pizza - DO NOT GET THIS. My fiancé got this and the pizza was very plain and my only guess is that it wasn't made with much pizza sauce so it came out very dry and essentially tasted like bread.

My recommendations, stick to what they know, get their pastas and stay away from their pizzas. 5 stars for carbonara, 2 stars i would say for their pizza. Still would go back for their carbonara though!
author: Alan C.

description:
This is a place I've wanted to visit for awhile but never got around to it since I'm rarely ever in the area. But we did a few Sundays ago for brunch. We opted to be seated outside since it was pleasant out and it was probably best in the event our infant daughter decides to shriek, cry, wail, yell etc etc. 

They offer the traditional brunch fare including their usual pasta dishes. I opted for the latter while the hubs opted brunch. Food overall was nothing out of the ordinary however if you're hungry, it's certainly above "good enough" for me, at least. I kept wondering what the Italian family a couple tables down thought about Americanized Italian food they ordered. They must have thought it was just fine as they all seemed to have liked it and finished it. It's always so interesting to me to see how tourists and visitors to the States view our take on certain cuisines and portions. 

I'm glad to have checked off another establishment that I've had bookmarked for what seems like forever. The most exciting culinary adventures might not be had here however come without the expectation and you should be fine.
author: Esther A.

description:
Absolutely amazing! I had one their many scrumptious specials for the night. It was a goat cheese gnocchi with a lamb bolognese. The gnocchi literally melts in your mouth. The ambiance was soft and lit by candle and the wait staff was very attentive! 

The bread was fresh and the wine was good too. I was too full to taste their desserts but I bet they were good as well 

I was there when they opened at 5 and they were packed when I left an hour later. When I visit again I will be back.
author: D D.

description: This place is so quaint and perfect for brunch. The portions are generous and the wine recommendations are on point. The vegetable soup is so tasty and savory and they serve you fresh grated Parmesan cheese upon request. Nothing special about the Cesar salad but it was still very good. No complaints about this place, I will come back and bring my friends next time. This place is a must try.
author: Karen R.

description:
I don't get it.

The staff isn't very friendly. You don't feel welcome at all.

The service...meh...if you need something you can get them to bring it...but they don't seem like they want to be there, and they don't seem to like the customers...

The food...I don't get it... I guess I have been trying a lot of really really wonderful places recently... I guess I'm more fortunate than most. I guess I'm just trying to find some reason why someone would like the food here...I'm trying to justify all of the 5 star reviews...but I really can't...

Here's the thing... I want to feel like someone's grandma is working in the back, and I want to taste the handmade love. The reality is mine tasted 100% like it was from the frozen section from Costco. Maybe that is why the staff treats the customers with contempt, because they probability don't understand why people want to eat the awful food either.

My advice. Go home. Light some candles. Turn off the lights. Microwave some Stouffer's and get yourself a glass of wine. You'd have a better time, have better food, and save some money. Unless your cat is a jerk; no one will treat you with contempt either.
author: Thomas F.

description:
Walked by and liked the look.  Had an omelet and salad and cleaned our plates.  Service was polite and professional.  

Would recommend highly
author: David P.

description:
This is always a staple go to restaurant when I'm in town, and always make sure to stay nearby. The place is cozy and tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city life, offering a warm, classic Italian meal on windy, cold nights.

The pasta dishes are the what you come here for; lasagna, gnocci, penne, linguini and tortellini. Each dish feels like classic home cooking, and will leave you stuffed and satisfied.

Because the restaurant is pretty tight, with limited tables, the wait can get long, but it's well worth it if you appreciate a good Italian meal with a feel of home cooking.
author: W V.

description:
20-30 minute wait on a Tuesday night. The place was packed. 

Nice, cozy, dimly-lit atmosphere at night. 

Their Focaccia bread is amazing, at least I think it was Focaccia? It was really soft and the crust was so flavorful. Earned a whole star for the damn bread lol 

I thought the Penne Bottola sauce was a little bit on the watery/bland side and not so much creamy and thick. But definitely super fresh ingredients. 

Excellent service and the food came fast. 

I would come here again to try some other stuff on the menu.
author: Kalli L.

description:
Had tickets for a nearby show and Nob HC was recommended for dinner. We got there before the opened, which was evidently the way to go. While waiting outside we were talking to a guy who lives next door and he said "make sure you try the focaccia... and the chicken parm is HUGE". He was spot on. The doors opened and the 4 of us got seated. The place is cute, tiny and warm. Within minutes it was full. Lots of people were trying to get a table but unless your whole party is there forget it.
Everything we had was good... not crazy awesome but darn good. We all loved the whole experience and will definitely go back when in the area.
author: Korva G.

description:
My husband and I came here on a Sunday night thinking we wouldn't have to wait long, but we were wrong. After 40 min in the cold, we were seated. The wait was worth it, the food was amazing. I had the penne bettola and I can't wait to go back and have it again. My husband had the tortellini with pesto sauce, but we both agreed the penne was the best thing. So good I wanted to come back the next day.

The only downside to this restaurant is the no reservation and the waiting in the cold. As we were leaving we heard another couple say they had waited in the cold for an hour. The waitress said that some people wait 2 hours. If you have a no reservation policy and people have to wait outside, it would be nice to have some outside heaters for typical SF nights.
author: Elzabeth G.

description: Definitely would comeback here for a close to real authentic italian food. They have an excellent customer service,and the pasta are really delicious. Side note: the pasta has many sauce, it may not be for people who don't like too much sauce. Also, their tiramisu is somewhat good, not really sweet. I prefer really sweet since I have a sweet tooth. Overall, the resto is a 5 star for me. Better than eating to Olive Garden lol!
author: Daniel Jayce C.

description: This place is awesome! We stumbled upon it on vacation and loved it.  As a rule, we never eat at the same place more than once. However, we had to eat here twice. It is a small neighborhood place that is cozy and has great service as well as excellent food. We highly recommend it!
author: Mark B.

description:
This was an excellent and quaint Italian restaurant tucked away on nob hill. Relatively small restaurant with an open kitchen and a line outside the door at 630 on a Friday... I knew this would be special.

As my friend and I had a 60 minute wait (quoted 30 minutes, just be cautious) we explored the menu and decided to split one of the special pizzas, the Hawaiian with prosciutto and gruyere/fontina, and the Penne with spicy tomato cream sauce (subbed fettuccine which was a good choice). Prices were incredibly  reasonable at pizza for $17 and pasta was $16-17. Bread basket came out with a few varieties including a warm focaccia. We couldn't get enough of it.

The pizza was the best I've EVER had, including that in Rome. The crust was light, airy and held up the heavy toppings of pineapple and layers of prosciutto! The prosciutto was quality and perfectly salty with Just the right amount of sweetness from the pineapple. Douse it with fontina and gruyere and good to the edge. 

The pasta was fresh and the sauce had just enough zip to not overwhelm the depth of flavor in the sauce. Huge bowl and we still licked it clean and killed the pie.

Good date place, good family restaurant (behaved kids who love pizza and pasta) and intimate for conversation. 

They don't take reservations though, so plan ahead or plan to enjoy some drinks outside !
author: Hillary G.

description: Good gnocchi, good pasta, great service can't say enough great things about it. A must stop for me when I am craving my pasta. I love coming here for lunch during the week after the rush. They are open until 3pm for lunch! Love it.
author: Claudia B.

description: Loved my waitress, Katrina! She was amazing with recommendations. She was personable. She was fantastic during conversation. The wine was good. The food was okay. The clam garlic pasta was bland and needed a little added flavor. The Grenache was TOO DIE for! Overall, my experience was fabulous. It was quaint, romantic, and a cozy little secret! Glad I went!
author: Kelsy H.

description: Nob Hill Cafe is a small and intimate place to dine, great for a weeknight dinner or weekend date. Since it is pretty small, I would definitely call in advance to get a reservation, and with that still expect a wait. The pasta is great, and the staff is friendly. They are also good for takeout, but they do get busy, so definitely call in advance.
author: Ross S.

description: Very quaint and wonderful neighborhood cafe. The caprese salad was fresh and tasteful. The rigatoni alla pollo had an amazing sauce and the gnocchi bolognas was the best that I have ever had. To finish - the tiramisu was truly the best in town. I would highly recommend.
author: April G.

description:
Nice restaurant with fresh and good pastas. Pizzas are solid choices too.
Service is nice but could be a little more friendly.
You can go there, you'll have a nice time.
author: Gaetan S.

description: We went here on a whim. It was a neighborhood cafe with amazing pasta and a romantic atmosphere. Also, food came out super quick and service was great. We are coming back!
author: Alex G.

description: Great neighborhood find. Pizza was very good. I called ahead and picked up, popular choice. Walking distance from my hotel.
author: Carrie B.

description:
The best carbonara! I always get it when I come here ;) They make their own sauces and the pasta is always perfectly cooked. Reminds you how much mediocre pasta is out there.
FYI for Parents/caretakers: Not totally kid friendly (they only had one high chair when we went tonight and it was taken, so I assume that means they only have one high chair period but could be wrong) but also accommodating to families with young children. There were plenty of kids there tonight. Just expect to leave your stroller outside, and no guarantee on a high chair.
author: Shirin M.

description:
I live in the hood. I order delivery from here only when I'm too hungry to wait for delivery from some of the best Italian restaurants on the west coast down in North Beach. 
Nothing in this joint is excellent. The clam linguine is my go to and not too bad. Caprese is sad. Caesar is sadder. 
The restaurant is small, full of tourists and tough to be comfortable in. 
Also, most of the 4 and 5 stars that are given here on Yelp are from folks from out of town. 
No SF local would give them anymore than 3. 
If you want solid Italian, head down the street to Cappos, Tony's, Betty Lou's or Sotto Mare. And they take reservations.
author: Angela M.

description: Ambiance is cafe casual, staff super friendly, and food quite amazing- I could have been in Italy saying how much this place is like a cafe in San Francisco... and here I am! What more could I want? I came here this evening with two Aussie mates who brought a bottle of wine all the way from South Australia for us to share that evening. I had the veal while the other guys had pasta based specials... all were superb. Best of all, our server Robin was a delight (and extremely accommodating due to my temporary dietary restriction). I look forward to a return... especially when my dietary restriction is all finished!
author: Randy D.

description:
Delicious food, best service and experience. 
Anytime I am in San Fransico I will be stopping by!
author: Cassandra P.

description: Save your money, go somewhere else. Service was horrable. They wouldn't seat paying customers at 5pm when they opened. We were starving and wanted to get drinks and starters going while our #3 walked a block to meet us. We had been waiting for them to open at 5pm for 25 min and they refused to seat us at a table. I asked for a manager and the server said they do not have one. Apparently they arent interested in making money or customers nor do they care about their reputation. I wonder what their kitchen looks like with service so incredibly lacking right in front of your eyes.
author: Johnny C.

description: We were at the Huntington Hotel and it was just a short walk away.  It was a Friday evening and we had to wait 45 minutes on a chilly evening, we're so glad we waited. I had a special, fusilli pasta with a cream curry sauce, chicken and fresh snap peas .... so so so good.  Hubby asked the waitress what was good and she recommended a combination of two meals (pasta from one and sauce from another). He said it was the best pasta he'd ever eaten.  The staff was really friendly and helpful.  We loved this place so much we came back two more times before we left. Highly recommended
author: Geri O.

description:
My boyfriend and I were in the area searching for a good place to relax and to eat after a long day when came across this gem. Although the place is small, but the food was delicious! 

We started with the carpaccio for appetizer then I ordered the spaghetti carbonara which was really good and flavorful (kinda oily on the bottom but overall a tasty entree). My boyfriend ordered the chicken parm which was okay (but I'm not a huge fan of chicken Parm in general). 

Our bill came out to be $60 (after tax and tip) but it's (good) Italian food so I'm not complaining. I had a great time. Service was good, food was good, place was cute, yeah I'd definitely come back when I'm in the area.
author: Teana H.

description:
Enjoyed a large portioned, tasty dinner.  Ordered that evening's special seafood risotto. Price just $20.  Bargain dinner for San Francisco.

Started with the Cesar salad.  Big helping in a deep glass bowl.  If you are a light eater this could be your meal. Price = $9.

Wine list has a 20 selections by the glass.  If you're unsure which wine would best accompany your food, ask.  Smart wine advice given.

Take into consideration:  No reservations taken.  This is a walk-in restaurant only.  It is EXTREMELY popular.  I came at 4:45 pm to get an immediate table.  At 5:40 when I left the 2 dining rooms were packed full and there were 25 people waiting outside in the rain.  If you want to eat at prime dinner hour be prepared to wait.

When I stay at a Nob hill hotel again, I'd happily return.
author: Tom S.

description: If you are staying in the Nob Hill area this little Italian bistro is a great choice for lunch or dinner. The food here is excellent. We had the calamari  and white bean salad, a linguini with clam sauce and a pasta with pesto sauce. All were delicious and expertly prepared with fresh ingredients. Service was fast and friendly and our waiter was very accommodating with special orders. San Francisco in general is known for superb Italian cuisine and Nob Hill Cafe does not disappoint. It also has the advantage of being on top of the hill so if you are not up for walking up and down the hill you can still enjoy a nice meal in a great restaurant. This place is popular and can get crowded at dinner time. Leave extra time to be seated and enjoy a drink while you wait. Highly recommend.
author: Jerry M.

description: Very cute Italian in the heart of nob Hill. Reminds me a lot of the north end Boston with the small homey feel. Great experience
author: Ashley K.

description: We've come to NHC in the past and loved the food. We were disappointed today when we showed up at at 9:37 and were turned away. I've worked as a waitress, and it's extremely unprofessional for any establishment to turn patrons away over 15 minutes before closing. We won't be back.
author: Erielle D.

description: Favorite spot! Romantic and perfect setting. If you're in Nob Hill this is a must! We ordered the eggplant which was amazing. Also try the marinara!
author: Helen F.

description: The gnocchi was to die for. Bit of a wait but was well worth it. Lovely ambiance and great service.
author: Orli F.

description:
Absolutely love it here. Every time I'm in the city I make sure to stop by. The waits can be long if you don't arrive right at opening, but hang in there because it is well worth it. The pasta is amazing, and the atmosphere is cozy and nice. 

The tortellini with pesto is my favorite dish on the menu and right up there with the favorite dish I've had anywhere!
author: Matt M.

description: Nice, cozy place with great service, and delicious Italian food. Though they don't have gluten free pasta, they can flex many items on the menu, like the chicken parmesan.
author: Laura N.

description: Food is great. Elena was our server and she's very nice. Jillian the hostess hates her job.
author: Mina G.

description: I had been here before a few years ago and this time it did not disappoint. Great service and excellent food. One of my favorite restaurants.
author: Doc M.

description: Please don't go to this place so I don't have to wait for a table!!!  Best linguini and clams and the carpaccio is outstanding. I make a stop there at least once a month.
author: Marco E.

description: Calzone was nothing but superb! Sauce on the side good fresh flavor, crust light and crispy not doughy at all. I would order this by the dozens! I added mushrooms and Italian Sausage. Too much for one person so taking half home for later.
author: Judith C.

description:
It was good not great. Was greeted by a friendly hostess who served me a glass of Chianti while I waited for a table. No reservations accepted instead it is first come first served. Waits typically do not exceed 45 minutes. For a Thursday night there was a bit of a crowd that got bigger as the night went. 

On to the food. I started with a mixed salad which was pretty good. Followed with linguine with white clam sauce. This was a bit bland and the clams were diced and out of he shell. Portion size was big. Again not bad but not great either. Service and decor were good.
author: Erin O.

description:
Very cute little authentic Italian place. When I say little, I mean it. We were there on Saturday night at 8pm and had to wait 20 minutes, a sure sight that this place is popular. Our waitress was wonderful, we ordered right away. The antipasti is delicious and authentic. I had the lasagna and hubby had the carbonara. Both delicious. And the chocolate gelato was to die for a well.
Spent about $60, had Sprite and Sparkling lemonade to drink
author: Justine W.

description:
Delicious food especially the gnocchi!!! surprisingly very mediocre wine list
Wait times can be long especially since they don't take reservations, but you can get a glass (or bottle) of wine and hang out outside (there are a few tables). The restaurant is absolutely adorable, very cute place for a date or a casual dinner with friends. Will return!
author: Yin H.

description: Small Italian cafe with indoor seating and a few outdoor tables. Great menu with daily specials. Closes at 3 but reopens at 5. Sat and Sun brunch.
author: K P.

description: We popped in after church and had a brunch.  The service was great and the food was wonderful.  Everything was fresh looking and tasting.  The kitchen worked with my food allergy too.
author: Mary W.

description:
Interesting situation with my visit. Bottom line, service was fantastic. Haven't tried the food yet. Here's why. Visiting on April 23rd, one of the most beautiful days in San Francisco, and I was the first and only patron sitting next to the chef station. Front door open, slight bay breeze flowing thru. 

A person then joins the same area and immediately requests for the door to close because of the coldness. 

Again, I am the first and at this time the only patron in this room. I asked if we could keep the door open, the staff complied but a complaint t by the patron behind me resulted in the door to be closed. At this point I have three tables commending my decision. To keep the local cafe door open. 

The patron behind me decided to tell me, the first person in the cafe, to just take my coat off. I explained to the server that it was not that easy since I carry a CWL and that if I took my top (jacket) off that I would be in violation of CWL.   

Regardless, the server caved to the person behind me, and I will never eat at this place again. The tables they have set up outside would be perfect for me but I was told there is no service out there at this time. 

Eat here. It's good. However, if you want to take a back seat to every PC argument in the land, then by all means eat here. If you love our land and respect our laws, then go to Fisherman's Warf. Founded by a true American. Former pilot, big visionary where he saw people from all walks of life celebrating time off and good conversation. 

To the person behind me tonight, respect my requests and you will always be respected. Push your way on me and we will fight until it's right. That's what our founding fathers taught us.  


What ever happened to first come first served and we all get along ?
author: M A.

description: Great service.  Margarita pizza rocked. Antipasto misto was good, but we could have used more cheese.
author: Mahesh N.

description: Went here twice in one day so that should tell you how much I liked this place.  Small traditional Italian atmosphere.  Went for lunch and just had the vegetable soup and anti pasta salad.  Both were excellent.  Went back for dinner and had the sole.   It was very good.   Wine list could use a few more additions. Others had pizza and pasta.  All were good.   Definitely worth trying if in the area.
author: Kevin K.

description: Food and service was great. Not great enough for the wait time that is always there. The place is super tiny which is nice but wait time is too long and no where to hang out, but outside. I got carbonara and loved it, it's one of their popular items. A great place to hang out eat and drink wine, felt pressured to be fast just because of the line outside!
author: Brielle W.

description:
This cafe is a neighborhood cafe with lots of charm and great food.  I really like this place and have eaten there on several occasions when meeting friends in SF.  There is almost always a 15-20 wait for a table as they do not take reservations.  On this particular visit, there was a 30 minute wait for a table and the customary offer of a complimentary glass of house wine while you wait has either ceased or was missed.  We stayed in the immediate area with a group of people who were also waiting.  We waited while one name after another was called.  After hearing a name called that I was positive arrived after we did, I went back inside to find the hostess to ask how much longer the wait would be since it was now over an hour since she had placed our name on the list.  The hostess looked at the list and said "I already called your name."  I was dumbfounded.  "No, you didn't we have been waiting the entire time."  She insisted that she had and that we had not responded.  I let her know that we had not gone anywhere and had been waiting the entire time and that she did not call our name.  She agreed to seat us next.  She then comes out about five minutes later and now looking right at me calls another name.  No one comes forward.  She looks at me again and I respond with the correct name so now we have an idea of what went wrong.  She insists she did not make that mistake earlier.

Suggestion - get a better system for tracking customers waiting.  A good hostess would have noticed we were still out there as the crowd was 
dwindling and confirmed where we were on the list.

Real problem - you made a mistake, it happens but own up to it, apologize and do what you can to make it right.  It's not the mistake that will keep me from returning, it's the attitude and complete lack of customer service experienced after the mistake had been made.
author: Amy P.

description:
I have heard only good things about this restaurant and I must say, the food exceeds expectations. The cozy ambiance is almost comparable to a cute dining room in northern Italy.

My only issue with this restaurant is that we waited 45 minutes to be seated (as most places in San Francisco) and when we finished our meals, were asked to leave while we were still drinking our wine! As we had only been seated at a table for an hour and fifteen minutes, the wait time should have out weighed the amount of time we were sitting there. 

I understand they are doing their best to get as many people in and out throughout the evening, but the customer service has to improve overall. If they could alert people prior to being seated about each time slot and high volume of customers, I would be more empathetic- I hope that this system improves in the future.
author: Kelly B.

description:
Takeaway: Don't go for the French Toast but try the omelettes!

Nob Hill Cafe was open on New Years' Day and hit the spot after a night out. We waited about 20 minutes because we had a party of five. It's a small place. We were seated next to the door (which was great because we got some sun), but our fifth person sat next to the door and was constantly having to close the door when people walked in. 

Food: 
We ordered from the brunch menu. I ordered the French Toast (with a side of potatoes and a cup of coffee. I also tried some of their prawn and avocado omelette (comes with a side of potatoes and cornbread). The French Toast was mediocre at best. There was no powdered sugar and it did not live up to my expectations. The omelette tasted great and I wish I ordered that. The potatoes tasted slightly bland. I really enjoyed the coffee. If I come again, I would go for an omelette (many choices) or try something on the lunch menu. 

Service: 
Service was the best thing about this place. Most places aren't open for brunch on New Years' Day so this was in a great location (we celebrated and stayed near Union Square). The wait was significantly shorter than we expected. The waitress was amazing. She greeted us warmly at the door and invited us in. She got us excited about the food and checked up on us without feeling overbearing. She made the experience.

Other Notes:
1. None of us ordered the lunch dishes, but the aroma of Italian food made us really hungry.
2. Our party of five was a bit big. Four people max.
author: David Y.

description: Service is a bit rude and they will not seat you unless your party is complete, which doesn't make sense if the restaurant is empty and there is only one person to wait for. We had brunch and everything was very good.
author: Lorely G.

description: This is one of our favorite go to places when in SF. It's small cozy and smells yummy as soon as you walk in.  Pizza, pesto pasta and lasagna were real good today.  Thanks to the cooks riquísimo!
author: Jorge M.

description:
This is the best pasta I've had in San Francisco.  That may be because whenever I eat Italian I'll generally choose pizza over pasta, but for the life of me, I can't remember the last time I was so happy ordering pasta.  The last couple of times I had pasta I regret it and I usually wish I had ordered pizza, but not here!  

I've been here twice and I got try the pesto linguini, the spaghetti carbonara and the lasagne by stealing bites from an unsuspecting boyfriend.  I want to go back to try different pasta options, but I know it's going to be hard because with all the options I've already tried, I just really want to eat them again.  

The place is really quaint, I like the small, family-owned atmosphere I get from it, but you wouldn't be able to realize the potential greatness of this place from the outside.  I think the deceptive nature of the name also contribute that confusion since I think many of us contribute "cafe" to coffee shops versus the amazing pasta shop this place really is.  So, it is a little easy to just walk past Nob Hill Cafe and not realize what you're missing out on, but really it's such a great dining experience, go in!  

*Edit, I gave it four stars in the beginning because I said it was a tad too expensive.  But it's so worth it, I love the pasta here.  So! I made the effort the edit this review to give this place five stars.  Go, go, go!
author: Cristina C.

description: This is a great neighborhood gem! I am new to SF and my daughter recommended I try this place. I've already been twice within two weeks! My first visit I had the pizza, which was delicious and more than enough for one person at a reasonable price. For my second visit, I had the carbonara, which was creamy and delicious! I almost hate to write this review, as it may become more crowded during the week than it already is (I visited around 1:00 both times and had a short wait). The staff is friendly--but very busy and can seem distracted...a small inconvenience for this new fave!
author: Sheila K.

description:
Very nice and pleasant Cafe.
Great food and amazing service.
Highly recommended. We will definitely come here again.
author: Guy P.

description: Seriously one of my fave restaurants on earth. Every time I'm in San Francisco I make a point of coming here. Warm, inviting, cozy, busy and delicious. Great price point and beyond fantastic food.
author: Lisa B.

description:
A Nob Hill gem.  
If delicious homemade pasta in a small neighborhood place is what you're after, then this is where you want to be.

The fresh & light insalata mista is the perfect beginning to a meal.  Perfectly dressed, fresh, crisp, & lemony.  

The fedelini (long pasta that is thinner than spaghetti) in a simple tomato garlic sauce is great, as is the pesto tortellini (tortellini romana).  But my favorite is the penne bettola, penne in a spicy red vodka cream sauce.  One of the best pasta dishes here.

The margherita pizza does not disappoint if you want to go the pizza route.  Perfectly crisp crust, tasty sauce, fresh aromatic basil.  Dreamy.

Whatever you do, you don't want to skip dessert.  NHC does dessert as well as they do pasta.  The tiramisu is outstanding.  Unfortunately, the zabaione is not on the menu anymore, but if they can do it for you, it's a must order.  

It's a small venue.  You can see the chef in the window doing his thing.  It does get completely packed, so if you don't want to do the small space & a bit cramped thing, you need to go really early, & on an early/mid weekday.  No reservations, so at peak times, it is a long wait.

It's a family restaurant.  The original owner's son (Mike) took over many years ago, & has managed to successfully maintain the magic.

A real gem.
4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: We came here on our first night in SF. Just a block away from Scarlet Huntington. Was there at 8:00 but still had to wait 40 mins. It was worth the wait. Excellent service,  we ordered the antipasti and lamb shank from the daily special and a salami pizza. Everything was good, especially the pizza :)
author: Maryann H.

description: Great spot for lunch and dinner. I bring all my visiting friends here. can not beat it!
author: Annabelle A.

description: Worth the wait! Bring a bottle or order a glass of wine to enjoy while you wait. The food is never less than amazing. Especially the gnocchi!
author: Amanda G.

description:
Bf and I were visiting from Ventura, Ca and were craving Italian. We were greeted by a friendly hostess who, although had a few 2-seat reservations listed, told us if they don't come soon she'll seat us. She suggested we enjoy a beverage outside while we wait. This made me happy since there is nothing more annoying (while
hungry) when you see open tables available. The food was absolutely delectable. All in all-- great experience!
author: Tamara G.

description:
Came here on a double date with my boyfriend and his classmates. We really wanted to try the tiki lounge but didn't realize it was reservation only (womp womp womp) and found this little gem since we were in the area. 

The wait was so long but it was a saturday night and we found good parking and were too hungry to drive around and wait else where. I was a little apprehensive about sticking around because italian food is italian food..... which I was eventually proven wrong. 

I got the Linguine Alla Vongole and Vong-holy moly. Clams baby. Clams everywhere. Every single spoon full. I was REALLY pleasantly surprised to find that I was not jipped. On another note, the lemon really complimented the clams and made it easier to consume as I'm not one for the creaminess of pastas (i know, shame on me). The portion was HUGE and I was unable to finish. My bf was happy I didn't though cos more for him

Bf got the tortellini romana, it was good but mine was better :P

Our friend got the pork chop special (I don't know if it was on the menu but it was written on the chalkboard). That was pretty good! He licked the plate clean.

Lastly we got the gnocchi bolognese which was really good! I love gnocchi...



I'm really happy that tiki lounge was packed because we got to try maybe the best italian places EVER! Oh and the waitress was very nice and helpful to choosing out dishes. Thank you!
author: Katherine L.

description: Stopped in here for lunch on a Sunday.  Several other Italian places were closed, or only serving brunch.  Had a prosciutto and mushroom pizza.  Perfect for two.  The Montepulciano went with it very well.  Would definitely return if I'm in San Francisco again.
author: Wade S.

description:
I wanted a cute Italian place and while this place appeared to have met all of my qualifications- my experience kind of sucked. 

First off, our waitress had an attitude from the get-go. She refused to sit us until our whole party got there, but we were unsure if they were even going to come and I was starving. She reluctantly sat us at a table of 5 (3 of us were there) and just had an unpleasant demeanor the entire time. Our 2 people didn't end up showing up and she just couldn't help herself but to say "this is why we don't seat people until the whole party is here." OKAY, WE GOT IT. It was just unnecessary. I was a server for many years and while I understand where she is coming from, it was not a big deal. It wasn't busy. Large parties were not beating down the door to come in. And while I do understand the reason, she did not need to reiterate it as we were about to leave. 

Food: the garlic bread was anti climactic but my linguine was pretty darn good.
author: Jenna H.

description: My most cherished restaurant in San Francisco. I've been coming here for years and years - when both sets of twins would dine here (very regularly & not TOO long ago). Oh how things have changed! What hasn't changed is: their fantastic menu favorites, excellent service, and charm. Nob Hill Cafe was my first San Francisco neighborhood restaurant. Despite being a hop, skip, and jump away now, I still consider it so.
author: Matthew H.

description:
Nice, classic Italian offerings. Great bread basket, homemade gnocchi w/ bolognese, and chicken Parmesan. The chicken was baked instead of fried, which was initially disappointing, but it was seasoned and prepared very well. The cheesecake was pretty good, the cappuccino was very bitter. 

The place is warm and cozy, and was perfect for our first night in San Fran. The service was no-nonsense and professional, and I felt it was just a bit overpriced, but I also get that it's in Nob Hill.
author: Erica A.

description:
The food was to good
 The service and the Waiter Eamo and the hostest Allison  was very helpful.
author: David F.

description: Loved this place. The food was excellent and I especially recommend the Gnocchi. I recommend you give it a try.
author: Bo R.

description: Food and service were great; nice to sit outside and enjoy the view and sunshine while dining.
author: Cody H.

description: Awful customer service.  Told me it would be 45 minutes for a table for 6, they left me standing in the cold for an hour before they told me they couldn't sit 6 together. Very rude and not understanding at all.
author: Jennie P.

description:
Very small. If there are only two of you, expect to wait for a 2 top to open. Had the calamari and it was very chewy.Other dishes were ok.
 Hostess and waiter- not warm and welcoming. I would not recommend this place at all. .
author: Ronnie H.

description: Tiny little lovely bistro in Nob Hill. Fresh cooked pastas and pizzas. Freshly baked breads - delicious.
author: Alisa I.

description: This was the best Italian food I've had in so far in San Francisco. Quaint and cozy place on Nob Hill, we had the antipasti which was unlike any I've ever had. The roasted vegetables were delicious. We also split a margharita pizza and pesto fettichini, both of which were excellent.
author: John M.

description:
We absolutely loved Nob Hill Cafe. If we lived in the area, this would be our regular Italian place. The Italian herb bread was great.

Spinach salad special - fresh strawberries, good dressing, right amount of onions & mushrooms 

Tortellini with creamy pesto - amazing. The best I've ever had. 

Pizza with sausage - very good. Cooked well, good dough

I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.
author: Melissa G.

description:
This a quaint little place tucked around the corner from the fairmont. Either get there right when they open or be ready to wait a bit due to the lack of seating.

I had the spaghetti alla carbonara. The dish was simple but oh so satisfying with the perfect balance of salty and creamy goodness. The pancetta wasn't over cooked and there was a good amount in the dish(both being issues I've had with similar dishes at other establishments). If I had any criticism for the dish it would be to add some mushrooms and or some peas for visual contrast.

My girlfriend had one of the specials, rigatoni with andoullie sausage, snap peas, and a cream sauce. Sadly it fell short. The dish pretty much just tasted like smokey pasta. In hindsight we should've known better than to go with a non-Italian sausage at an Italian restaurant lol.

The staff was friendly and fast while not making us feel rushed. We were the last ones in at the end of that opening rush and we're out of there in 45mins while taking our time.

I would definitely go back to this place.
author: Anthony C.

description: Everything was fantastic. My favorite was the pistachio gelato and I'm usually not a dessert person! The service was excellent. We're not as familiar with Italian wines as we are with California and French wines so when asking for a recommendation from our server (after describing what we like) she recommended the perfect bottle of wine to go with our wonderful meal.
author: Theresa F.

description:
This is a neighborhood restaurant with 6 or so tables in the front room and 10 or so tables in the other room.  We were seated in the front room where we could watch the hardworking chefs.  We split the Pasta - tortellini with pesto and topped with pine nuts and then split the Secondi and had the Vitello Piccata sautéed in butter, white wine and capers served with sweet peas and alfredo pasta. YUM!   For Dolci we had Tiramisu which was very good and Spumoni with Pistachio ice cream served on a Cheesecake crust. WHAT A SURPRISE!

Nice SF Café!
author: Wendy C.

description: This is our favorite place to eat when coming to San Francisco. The restaurant is small so get there early! We always arrive before they open and by the time they open there is a huge crowd waiting to get in. The food is fantastic. Robin, the waitress, gives the best service! We haven't had a meal yet that we didn't like!
author: Cathy W.

description: This place is good, and considering that there aren't many sit down restaurants in the area, I can see why it's so popular. But for the price point ($15-$20 a dish), I just expect it to be a little bit better. Case in point - the Italian Homemade Company less than a mile over - that place is bomb. I also don't understand why they only have one menu for lunch and dinner. Lunch specials would totally make sense here.
author: Alicia H.

description: This was the first restaurant I ever ate in in SF. Coming from NYC, this Italian food is first-rate. The service and the wine are also fantastic. Highly recommend!
author: Christine B.

description: My husband and I were visiting from LA. Place was recommended by a friend who lives in SF. We are so glad we came. Food and service were excellent! There is minimal seating but the food is so good!
author: Cecilia m.

description:
First off, not only am I completely in love with carbonara since my first encounter in Italy, but I'm super picky as to what I consider carbonara to be "good." The carbonara at Nob Hill Cafe was so freaking delicious. I floored when I took my first bite! -- imagine that scene in "eat, pray, love." I've been to so many different restaurants and have tried so many takes on their version of "carbonara" but nothing could ever compare to my first experience in Italy. It was like love at first bite again at this place! 

So basically, I HIGHLY recommend the Carbonara. Not overly creamy, not too salty, not too fatty considering there's a generous amount of pancetta haha, and the spaghetti was al dente. Definitely going to be dreaming about this place!
author: Shela D.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in Nob Hill. We live down the street and still can't get enough. The bolognese gnocchi, lasagne, and clam linguine are must haves!! Plus the setting is so romantic and cozy and the wine selection hits the spot
author: Joy M.

description:
Very delicious, charming and tucked away dinner spot. The bruschetta was very fresh. The pesto fettuccini was to die for! So creamy. 

The wait took quite some time even at 9:15pm but it was worth the wait.
author: Erin E.

description: Went on Christmas Eve right as it opened. We made it barely for the first seating. Service was efficient and friendly. The chicken parmigiana was excellent! Had enough leftover for lunch the next day. Just a five minute walk from the fairmont hotel. You know it's good when people will wait outside for an hour to get in!
author: Mike A.

description: Order a pizza and take both cheeses off, but GET NO SUBSTITUTIONS FOR REMOVING THEM. I cry FOUL on that. You charge $1.50 for every veggie add on, but no credit at all for cheese which is more expensive than any of the veggies. Menu is NOT very vegan friendly.
author: Larry H.

description: Really cute spot. The food came out super hot -- which I love. Fresh ingredients and generous portions. Get the penne bettola!
author: Hayley M.

description:
Yummy yummy nommy pasta. The linguine alla vongole and tortellini with pesto are amazing. Always cooked perfectly al dente. Skip the appetizers - none are outstanding.

Decent wine list as well, by the glass and bottle. 

Can't wait to try the pizzas next time I visit, they've smelled amazingly!
author: Martina M.

description: Small cozy place to grab some amazing Italian food! Haven't had a bad dish yet! Could literally eat here every night! We go at least once a week. Usually takes 5-20 minutes to get a table for 2 but it's SO worth it if the wait ends up being longer :)
author: Jessica M.

description: Quaint little Italian place on a quiet street in Nob Hill. Carbonara was creamy, but could've used a bit more flavor.
author: Ryo I.

description:
Best carbonara I have ever had so far ! 
Just wished the bread they serve was warm, it would make it even better 
Great first experience though:)
author: Laura V.

description: The food here was delicious and the service was great too. I had the Pasta Carbonara. Also tried the pizza and had a salad. Everything was fantastic. This place is legit!
author: Eric E.

description: The NHC is our favorite restaurant in SF.   Yes, the wait can be long, but the food and service are so worth it.  The staff is amazing.  It's simply the best place in town.  Enjoy!
author: Bill Q.

description:
This is our favorite neighborhood spot! They don't take reservations, but it's a great place to go and wait for your table with a bottle of wine. Pastas are phenomenal!!! Great casual wine selections. Love love love!!!!!

The only thing they could work on is having more attentive and less stressed hosts. They tend to get bombarded and don't have a great system to help them succeed.
author: Amanda F.

description:
The food all around is delicious! My personal favorite is the lasagna! Not saying I know much about Italian cuisine, but this is THE BEST lasagna I have ever had. Every time I order something else, I definitely enjoy it. BUT I always wish that I ordered the lasagna. Therefore, lasagna is my go-to item at Nob hill Cafe. Their house wines are also pretty good bang for their buck. My personal choice is the house cabernet.

They really shine with their service! Special mention has to go to the servers MacKenzie and Robin (apologies if I misspelled the names), who are super nice people. Whenever I eat here, I go out of my way to make sure I sit in their section. Still, everyone else is wonderful, from the kitchen, to the host and other wait staff. It's just that I truly look forward to seeing MacKenzie and Robin when I visit Nob Hill Cafe. I would highly recommend dining here whenever one is in the area.
author: Peter C.

description: The food was excellent! Started with insalata Misto to start and had the gnocchi bolognese and margherita pizza and added artichokes. Shared between 2 people it was perfect! Pasta portion was fairly big and gnocchi tasted very fresh. Dessert we had the gelato strawberry and white chocolate cheesecake. No complaints our waitress was divine and funny! Definitely Anticipate a wait because it is rather small inside. We went at 8:00pm but a server came out and offered wine while we waited for our table roughly 45 mins. Love this place would come again.
author: Melanie V.

description: Ate here for the first time tonight after passing by many times.  We love the look and ambience of this beautiful neighborhood cafe, and the staff is wonderful!  Our dinner was very good ~ the polenta bruschetta was an excellent gluten-free choice.  Only wish they had some gluten-free bread and/or pasta to expand their gluten-free offerings.
author: Matt and Rita C.

description: Great service by Robin, with excellent food served timely and with a great relaxed but intimate atmosphere. The Caprese was a great starter, the gnocchi was delicious, and the other dishes I saw go by looked equally as appetizing. The tiramisu was delicious and light, and not overly latte portion. It's a relatively small place without reservations, so expect to get there early for a table or weather a bit of a wait. It's worth a wait!
author: Dave S.

description:
This place is ok, food not really worth the wait, but it's a really cute dining experience. 

This place is always packed! After two years of living in the neighborhood, I've only eaten here twice, while I've tried to eat here at least 5 times and found the wait too long. It has an old world charm all around - being close to the Grace Cathedral and Huntington park. Sitting at the window looking outside will make you feel like you're in Europe. 

Of the two times we visited, we ordered:
- calamari and beans salad: Salad was standard, but too acidic. 
- margherita pizza: standard, not impressive
- penne bettola: spicy tomato cream sauce. also just standard, wasn't bad, wasn't great. 
- Trancia di Calamari - calamari steak. it was a bit too breaded. Standard European way of cooking it with capers and white wine. The pasta that came with it was quite bad, though. 

Overall, I think the food is fine, nothing special. It feels like the American taste of Europe in the 80s, where people liked the creamy sauces and buttery dishes. I think this place is going to stay popular and I'm happy to see that happen.
