But as the city has higher and higher standard for food, they might have to start upgrading their food to satisfy people's changing palate.
author: Wendy K.

description: Came here specifically for the spaghetti carbonara, which is mentioned on several different sites as being excellent, only to discover that it's made with cream! Real carbonara is made with eggs and NO cream. Left as soon as we saw that on the menu. Avoid.
author: Erin M.

description: Don't order the French Toast. Don't expect any sense of service. Over rated.  Only thing that isn't is the location. Still not worth it.
author: Jay L.

description:
Really disappointed that this place fell so short of expectations. Sure, it's cute and the staff is friendly enough that our carry-out experience was pleasant but the salad was a study in wither and salt; sad and greasy enough that we gave up after a fork's worth each. The pizza was okay, a forgettable but basically decent margherita. 

In hindsight, I wouldn't have hiked the few blocks up Taylor to dine here when other well-reviewed options were closer.
author: KMP G.

description:
Had an amazing dinner! 

Walked up, Put my name down, waited outside with a glass of wine, got a table, ordered the Melanzane Alla Parmigiana (It was like a eggplant lasagna, YUM!), table bread was delicious, and the staff was friendly!
author: Joe R.

description:
Another trip to San Francisco just to try different types of food. It's different to compare LA food with SF food. I'm a big fan of pasta and I saw this on Yelp and it was close to the hotel I was staying at, so I decided to give it a try. 

The restaurant is smaller than I expected, but this place was actually really cute and quiet. I got here at 6:30 and there wasn't a wait at all. We were seated to a small table for two. It was pretty dim inside, but they had a lil candle on the table for a bit of light. It's a bit fancy. They give you some bread with butter while you wait for your meal. I'm not sure what kind of bread it was but one of them tasted it. It seems like a muffin like bread. 

I ordered a Spaghetti Alla Carbonara. It was really delicious. It cost $12.75, but then I think it was worth it. It was really good. The pasta wasn't hard which I prefer soft speghetti and the sauce was good with the little bits of bacon I believe or some kind of meat. My boyfriend got Trancia Di Calamari. It's a calamari steak and it cost $17.95, which we think wasn't reallt worth it. He didn't really like the steak because the sauce they had for it was really sour which made it taste a bit weird. Other than the sauce being sour, the calamari wasn't that bad. It also came with some pasta and pea. When they serve you the meal. they ask if you want cheese or pepper. 

The service here is really great. They would come around giving us water and asking if everything is okay. The server was very friendly and attentive. 

I would definitely come back here when I come visit San Francisco.
author: Winnie H.

description:
Food and waiter service was average and definitely not worth the wait. We had the lasagne, calzone, and pasta with the Romano cream sauce. 

Unfortunately the host who we checked in was rather curt and not helpful. When we put our names he told us an hour, maybe a little less. We had little ones with us, so we left for a bit to a playground right around the corner. We came back though within 30 min to make sure we were well within the time he had given us. He said he called our names 5 min earlier and that we would have to wait again. We ended up waiting closer to an hour and a half. When I asked to at least look at a menu I had to ask more than once. He seemed more interested in helping everyone else. 

When I complained he told me seating is not an exact science. I do understand that but there's a big difference between 25 min and 1 hour. He was nicer towards the end. 

We would have eaten somewhere else except the friends we met had a toddler/did not drive and there were not many other restaurants within walking distance.
author: Raenelle T.

description:
We showed up at 5:40 pm on a Friday to beat the crowd and get to a show at the Masonic. I had found this restaurant via Yelp, and I was excited: a little Italian restaurant with homemade pasta that's around the corner from the venue! Crazy! Alas, yes, it's a little restaurant, but everything else in my experience just did not square with the positive reviews.

We were seated by the only path to the bathroom/kitchen. I realized that we'd have constant foot traffic over us as staff moved back and forth from the kitchen, so my husband asked that we be moved. This was met with some attitude, as if we should have known not to be seated there from the beginning. Come on! You stuffed the tables in that corner out of pure greed in the first place. Nobody wants to sit there; everyone is enduring those two tables. Since I am about to spend a bunch of cash at your restaurant, perhaps I should have a small chance to actually enjoy being there?

We weren't given the focaccia bread everyone describes. We were given cold stale white bread. The caprese salad clearly had store-bought mozzarella and rather terrible tomatoes as the base. To hide the presentation, wilted greens were thrown over the top, and the whole thing was soaked in balsamic vinegar. Unpitted olives dotted the plate, as well as red onion. What's Italian about this? I also had the salad with roasted eggplant, and it was mainly comprised of wilted greens soaked in balsamic. I had more balsamic in my antipasti at this restaurant than I consume over the course of a full year. 

My gnocchi was the worst gnocchi I think I have ever had. Some pieces were just straight up lumps of potato, and a couple were just weird runny messes with lumps of potato inside. The bolognese sauce tasted like some beef was thrown into some tomato sauce at the last minute. There was no richness to the sauce. 

My husband's lasagna was terrible as well: the thing looked like a collapsed haphazard combination of ingredients that were never actually combined properly or cooked long enough.

Tiramisu is my favorite dessert. By the time we were offered the dessert menu, based on the gnocchi and the lasagna, I didn't want to find out what a screwed-up tiramisu tastes like.

This dinner was a waste of my money and time.
author: Sasha H.

description: Absolutely delicious food; wine selection left something to be desired. I'm a sucker for pesto, and the fettuccini al pesto was amazing. The penne bettola was garlicky and oh-so-tasty! The focaccia bread they bring around before your meal was scrumptious as well.
author: Hannah K.

description: Very nice little neighborhood spot. Visited from out of town based upon the reviews. It met my expectations. Food was very good and the service was good as well. All of the food was very well seasoned; however, the portions are a bit on the small side. That being said, I found the menu to be very reasonably priced and would recommend if you're looking for great Italian food in a cozy environment.
author: Joseph P.

description:
Nice cozy cafe in one of SF's best neighborhoods. We came in for a Sunday afternoon brunch and were seated within 10 minutes.

We ordered the gnocchi bolognese and the lime-tequila chicken omelette. The gnocchi totally live up to the hype - the sauce was meaty and savory, and the gnocchi were soft and melted in your mouth. The omelette was also excellent, with juicy chicken, fresh avocado and a great side of roast potatoes.

For dessert, we had the spumoni with pistachio gelato try-it. This was a well-balanced dessert, with the pistachio, mocha, and gelato layers blending together to create a delicious flavor profile.

Overall, I'd highly recommend this place, and since I live pretty close by, I'll definitely be back soon.
author: Ananya M.

description: Very friendly and cozy atmosphere. Ample portions with quality ingredients. Gnocchi bolognaise was a bit soft, zuppa crime' artichoke was excellent, but should not use seasoned croutons, the polenta was devoured before my eyes. Definitely will return for some chianti next time !
author: David B.

description: 4 stars instead of 5 based on orders.  The first time I ate here I dined in the restaurant - great small neighborhood place with great lighting and music.  For such a small space it didn't feel overly crowded.  I wish I could remember what I ordered, but I was extremely underwhelmed and was a little confused about the hype.  The next time, I ordered food to be picked up and chose to try the carbonara after reading through other Yelp reviews.  WOW. So so so good. I'm happy to have found something there that I love and now totally get the hype.  Every time I've been there has been a fairly long wait, so just be prepared to wait a little bit - they do serve wine while you wait outside.
author: Maggie A.

description:
In our world today, when everything new is cool and awesome: shiny new pair of wheels, new boyfriend or brand new outift that give you the next high -- it's EXCITING.

Then you come back down to earth and realize you need something familiar ... something reliable. I've got a prescription for you. (no, it's not Prozac)

Bowl of clam pasta at Nob Hill cafe x 1. Take as needed.

Generous with their clams, lots of creamy garlic white wine sauce, just the right amount of al dente in their linguine. Mama mia! Their gnocchi Bolognese has soft potato dumplings with Italian fennel sausgae and ground beef. So hearty and filling. The chicken parmigiana is how I imagine any real Italian mama would make it and it's so delicious.  Got a dessert craving? the awesome tiramisu is every bit as delectable as you expected it to be.

A cozy neighborhood restaurant with authentic homemade Italian food that doesn't break the budget? That's what I'm excited about.
author: Janice C.

description: We drove in from LA, and I had eaten here once before-years ago, and remembered how great, small and charming it was.  It didn't disappoint.  We ate early since we were meeting friends later, and the food was delicious, the service attentive, and only a block from our hotel.  Couldn't have been better:)   Definitely will be back!
author: Tim S.

description: Just a couple blocks from the lovely labyrinths of Grace Cathedral. We enjoyed every bite of the meal, and they had hands down the best mocha cheesecake I have ever eaten. Place is small and so seating is crowded. There is a wait at peak times. It's on my 'eat there when in SF' list.
author: Laura S.

description:
Ambiance: Cute, quaint little restaurant. We didn't wait long to be seated, but we did come earlier in the evening, closer to 6. If you have a group larger than 4 I'd definitely call first. This place has a decent amount of small tables but not a lot of space to push them together for a large group.

Service: Service was good. They were quick and attentive.

Food:
-Antipasti Mistoa: assortment of vegetables, prosciutto & fresh mozzarella. A great start to the meal that seemed relatively healthy and filling. This appetizer is for 2 people and served cold.
-Tortellini Romana: I didn't hate this dish, but I'm looking forward to trying another in the future. I heaped on the cheese and added some salt which helped. 

Overall, I thought the dining experience was nice but the food didn't blow me away. I'd like to go back to try some other dishes.
author: Susan G.

description: So  I "found" (walked past after a day of conference sessions) this neighborhood cafe. The atmosphere was very welcoming for the single conference goer and the food satisfied the palette. The server was incredibly hospitable. It was the perfect end to a day of networking. For the lone traveler and Italian food lover this is the place to have dinner.
author: Randy S.

description: Quaint small restaurant with friendly service a good food. The cost vs value is great.  The cost is middle of the road and the food is really good for the price.  Pros:  atmosphere (small, intimate, candle lit neighborhood style), courteous, well trained staff and good food with a good selection of dishes. Cons:  small with no reservations, so prepare for a wait (even on a Monday night, which is when I came).  Overall, nice restaurant - it lived up to the reviews I had seen.
author: Megan J.

description: This tiny 'cafe' is amazing. I had a chicken linguine with artichoke hearts special that was extremely tasty. The service was great. I would definitely go back.
author: Rebecca E.

description: One of my favorite pasta joints in San Francisco. Every dish is great but my favorite is the pesto. I like how the noodles are cooked - not too al dente. The prices are reasonable and the portion sizes are perfect.
author: Kate S.

description: We went on Valentine's Day!! It was packed, as it apparently always is! Staff was so skilled and not phased by the craziness. Had the eggplant parmigiana which was excellent. Veal was loved by two others in my party. We got a bottle of wine suggested by the server, but did not care for it. She very quickly brought us one we liked better. The focaccia perfection and dessert was amazing topping off a Memorable evening.
author: Molly H.

description:
Nob Hill Cafe is a pretty small cafe that fills its seats up pretty darn fast. I'm convinced that it's pretty popular. The guests may have been regulars, tourists, or even just people like us in the area looking for some great food to chow down on. We sat in front of the restaurant for about 10-15 minutes because the restaurant wasn't ready to seat us. We had some issues with the wait staff, so all in all, the service would be the reason why I can't give it a five star review.

Once we were seated, everything on the menu looked interesting and appetizing. I ordered the tortellini romana and my friend ordered the chicken parmesan, lasagne, and potato goulash. I tasted them all and everything was great. I was just satisfied that I got a taste of the other dishes so that I know what to order the next time I come back.

Overall, the food was delicious. I have pictures of my tortellini and I remember how good it tasted and my friends who also tasted it reminisce of how wonderful it tasted. If you aren't a patient person when it comes to customer service, might want to take a pass. I would recommend Nob Hill Cafe to anybody that enjoys great Italian food with decent portion sizes.
author: Steve N.

description:
I am just writing a review because this place deserves a 5 star review. 
They have great service, a beautiful, quirky SF kinda place, and the food was fantastic!
The Carbonara was heavenly! They even bring out portions of this sweet bread that is sucha filler because you just want to keep eating it. Go here outside the hustle and bustle of North Beach. There will be a wait, however their service is great and quick. Wine selection was enough and it is definitely cafe-esq.
author: Manu M.

description:
This place is the definition of a tourist trap. If you don't want your water refilled and like very bland spaghetti carbonara then you're definitely right here.

We had the carpaccio, carbonara, lasagna and gnocchi. Gnocchi and lasagna were ok. The seasoning on the carpaccio was way to strong and didn't let me taste the meat. Will not go here again.
author: Freddy E.

description:
Yes, it *does* take forever to get into Nob Hill Cafe. The restaurant is TINY and the poor hostess appears to be constantly busy - getting drinks, taking names, placing take-out orders. But the wait is worth it. 

I currently live/work in the Washington DC-Metro area and there are several restaurants that require a 1+ hour wait, so this wasn't new to me and I didn't really mind. Many people ordered drinks while they waited and didn't seem to have a problem. When we finally made it inside, the tables were a little packed together for my taste, but not to the point where I was really uncomfortable. It didn't even feel very loud with everyone so close together. 

The menu has a ton of variety with different pizzas and pastas. I opted for the Fettuccine Pesto  with grilled chicken. The portion size is GINORMOUS! I could have made 2 whole meals out of it. You can definitely tell that the noodles are made fresh. The pesto was so creamy and flavorful, reminding me of my Italy trip a few months ago. The chicken was tender and generously portioned. The chicken parmesan also looked fantastic. 

Service wasn't too bad either. They are definitely very busy so understandable that the waiters aren't always the most attentive.

Delicious and homey. Worth a stop by if you're looking for authentic Italian!
author: Margaret Z.

description:
Be prepared to wait. Food was good but not anything spectacular. We were crammed into a small corner with my daughter in danger of being hit by the front door anytime anyone entered the restaurant. We had pizza, lasagne, tortellini with white sauce(best option) and spicy penne pasta.
Server and hostess were very nice. IMO if you want to eat here I would get food to go.
author: Cathy D.

description: Ambience was excellent! Very cute, intimate setting. Reminded my husband and of our trip to Italy. Staff was friendly. Wait was about 30-40 minutes at 9pm on Friday night; no reservations taken ahead of time.
author: Elle T.

description:
Wonderful casual neighborhood Italian cafe. Nice people work here. And they make delicious food. What's not to love?

Highly recommend the gnocchi bolognese.

Family of four, including wine: $120.
author: Dan B.

description: LOVE this place, and go here frequently. The cutest little old school Italian restaurant. Very reasonably priced. Around $15 for a pasta. The carpaccio is amazing so is the brown focaccia bread. There really isn't a bad thing on the menu from my experience.
author: Brittany C.

description:
We waited much longer than estimated for a table.  That may not be the fault of the restaurant, but it is definitely their fault that once seated, we were ignored.  No water, no bread, no one took our order or came to our table for more than ten minutes.  That was a long time to be sitting and waiting after waiting outside for a long time.  

The gnocchi is $17.00, not $14.75 as listed here on yelp.  Dinner for two people was $70, including tax and tip.  We had one pasta entree each.  I drank tap water.  My friend had one glass of wine.  (No salad, appetizer, or dessert.)  The food was OK, but it was not worth the wait or the price.

They don't take reservations and they are the only restaurant in the immediate area, so if you get there and they are busy you can't just go next door or across the street.
author: Bay G.

description: Stopped in for lunch - I had the Linquine Vongole and it was chopped up canned clams; my wife had a Risotto which was warmed up rice. The service was friendly and prompt but the food so-so. I don't get the four and five star reviews - not even close.
author: joe n.

description: I'm not sure what the fuss is about.  We waited for about an hour and finally got a table.  The food took forever to come out.  I got the clam linguine.  I liked that it isn't served with a bunch of shells like usual, but it was a bit bland.  We also got garlic bread which was just some crostini with pesto and parmesan on it.  Not bad but not worth the wait and price tag.
author: Soo Jin M.

description: Robin was a fantastic server and guided me (an out of towner) toward a great meal. The chianti and the fennel seed sausage lasagna paired amazingly and the gonache at the end was to die for.
author: Madison E.

description:
This place is amazing!!! 
Cons: you might have to wait a while to get seated
Pros: the food is delicious, every single thing we ordered we loved! And the service was great! 
I would 100% come here again.
author: Melissa P.

description: So wonderful!  Have been hunting for a neighborhood Italian spot for the past 3 years and finally found it!  Super cute restaurant in Nob Hill, we got here at 5 in case there was a wait and walked right in.  By the time we left around 6:30 it was full (on a Monday night).  We had the carbonara which my husband said was some of the best he has ever had, the margarita pizza which was really good and the fedelini Alla cecca which was super basic and wonderful.  Service was great and the wine list is super reasonable.  Can't wait to go back and try more!
author: Erin D.

description:
When your best friend from home comes to visit for a rare Sunday night dinner date and you have major catching up to do over wine and amazing food.. come to Nob Hill cafe!!

So glad I found this cute little gem as I was searching for the perfect dinner place. We were craving Italian and since we had both been due for a good cheat meal we decided to indulge. We went on a Sunday evening around 7pm and there was about a 45 minute wait. We ordered a bottle of Merlot and sat out on one of the tables outside and chatted away. The wait went by fast and we were seated before we knew it. 

Deciding on a dish was tough bc they ALL sounded fabulous. I went with a special- linguine with a roasted red bellpepper sauce. My friend got the Carbonara and added chicken. We had bread with EVOO while we waited and enjoyed some more wine. Our pasta came out in huge white bowls filled high with deliciousness! We both only got through less than half of our dishes!

The service was fabulous and the interior is so cute and cozy! Perfect date night spot!!

Nob Hill Cafe will def be my number 1 spot for carb loading before any big run! Speaking of which I am running a half this coming Sunday so I will prob be making a visit soon =)
author: Hetal P.

description:
This is a great spot for Italian!

We went on a busy Sunday evening and unfortunately had to wait a bit on a windy night outside. The restaurant is small, so there is not a lot of waiting room, and there are tables at the entrance, making it difficult to provide some shelter. 

The hostess seemed very nice, and we were projected to be seated in 30-45 minutes. Luckily, didn't have to wait that long because if you're WHOLE party is not there, they move on. Two of us - makes it easy.

We started off with the Crostini di Polenta. Unfortunately, there was much more to be desired. Though sounds fancy, the sauce didn't taste much more than marinara... from a can. The polenta was nicely cooked, and there was melted parmigiano cheese on top, definitely a nice addition. The cheese easily feel off, so it was difficult to get some with each bite. 

Pasta! Now this is where they shine, and why I think it deserves 4 stars. We had the Spaghetti alla Carbonara and Tortellini Romana with pesto.

Carbonara - probably the best in the city I've had thus far. Very creamy and obtains that thick, smoky eggy taste that carbonara should have. Definitely not runny like a lot places. Not quite Italy level, but probably need to go there for that!

Pesto tortellini - excellent. On point. Was a bit salty at some points, but added to the overall flavor and richness of a pesto dish. 

We finished with the tiramisu. We would not get it again.

Why 4 stars? Well, I'll be honest. When I go seek italian, I'm looking for great pasta. This place has it. Service though nice, can be spotty. Small place, can be long wait. All can be made up for some great Italian pasta, and this surely does it.
author: Edward L.

description:
My wife and I were visiting San Francisco for a long weekend and wanted to find some good Italian food near our hotel.  We discovered this little spot quite by accident.  It was only a few blocks from our hotel in a residential section of Nob Hill...

The place was small and cozy while the food was delicious and authentic.  My wife is first generation Italian, so that is saying something.   We started with the Insalata Caprese which was fresh and delicious.  My wife had the Linguine Alla Vongole.  The baby clams we tender with the white wine, garlic and lemon sauce adding a perfect flavor.  I had the Gnocchi Bolognese, which was hearty and flavorful.  I loved the italian sausage with fennel seed.

This place is a gem...if you are in San Francisco and love good Italian food, it is worth a stop.
author: Doug L.

description: This is a great neighborhood Italian restaurant.  The food is fantastic.  I'm not sure who the large, older, waiter is (who has apparently worked there for 15 years) but he's rude, rough, and off-putting.  My father and I nearly left because of his discourteous manner.  He's a bit of a bull in a china shop, how he's lasted 15 years I do not know.  Still, the food is terrific so we shrugged him off as insignificant and didn't let him ruin our opera night.
author: Jay N.

description:
Great neighborhood restaurant.  Come early because it gets real crowded at dinner.

My friend had the linguine alla vongole and I had the gnocchi bolognese.  My dish was much better than his. His was rather plain and I felt we could've had it anywhere else.    I did feel my dish was small and left a bit hungry.

I'd definitely give this place another try and order pizza.
author: Angelica C.

description: I came for dinner based on the reviews and I love Italian food. It's a small nice size place with dim lighting. I am not a big fan of the bread they serve but that is just personal preference. Other than that service was great. They were friendly and took care of me. I ordered the lasagna and it was delicious. It tasted so fresh and light at the same time. If your a fan of lasagna I totally recommend it.
author: Jesse V.

description: Quaint Italian place in a beautiful location with delicious food. It made for the most perfect date night with my lover!
author: Nikkie V.

description: Terrible customer service. Would never go back. Heard it was great and wanted to like it. Good food, but not worth rudeness. We waited over an hour for a table. One person in our party was a block away and they wouldn't seat us and gave away our table.
author: Janet P.

description: Great Italian food. Easy walk in Nob Hill. Waitress was very friendly and helpful with menu advice.
author: Adam R.

description: OMG!!  This used to be my favorite place in San Fran.  Of course today we show up with an overwhelmed and could not handle the people. It was going to be an hour wait which is OK but when I asked if I can make my order To go the hostess ignored me for phone calls and even took a person's to go order while ignoring me. Get your shit together.
author: Jason H.

description:
This place is really delicious Italian food for a great price! The staff is very nice and hard working! The place is small and fills up very quickly. It's one of our favorite spots to eat as it is a few blocks from our apartment. Highly recommend it! 

My husband orders the chicken parm all the time. He loves it. 
I get a pizza it's delicious crust has good crunch.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Thanks to the woman who left the crappy review of this unpretentious little cafe we knew how to approach our dinner out with friends without reservations. Our friends put our names on the list while we found parking. They took a table outside and had beverages until we joined them. Our party was seated within 10 minutes. 
This was a wonderful spot for us to meet. The service was attentive and sweet. The food was excellent, the prices extremely reasonable and the portions, happily were generous. I chose this spot after realizing that it was our best alternative for dinner before seeing Jeff Beck athe the Masonic. I hadn't been there in 20 years but it was as good it was back in the 90s. Only bigger!
Go. Know how to get on the list and enjoy yourselves.
author: Marisa E.

description: Neighborhood favorite that never disappoints -- excellent pasta and specials daily. This place is popular and gets busy and doesn't take reservations, but they let you have a glass of wine outside while you're waiting for your table.  Try the carbonara !!
author: Darryl N.

description:
SO. GOOD.  Both the food AND the service was great.  Probably the best lasagna I've ever had.  We ordered tiramisu for dessert even though I'm not a big fan of tiramisu, but I LOVED it here.  

We got there around 9 and the wait was estimated to be about an hour, but they were actually able to seat us in about 30 min.  The hostess was very friendly and helpful, even though she was dealing with some hangry customers who were sick of waiting.
author: Carla M.

description: Too good for words. Great Nob Hill neighborhood restaurant. The pasta was delicious and the service was great. Good ambiance.
author: Larry K.

description:
Everything delicious
Get there early quiet a wait but sooooo worth it
Pasta dishes delicious 
Bolognese sauce really good
The standard tomato sauce equally heavenly 
Bruschetta real good and Caesar salad delicious  
Staff terrific friendly !
Run don't walk it's sure to please
author: Linda R.

description:
I am updating my previous review due to a HORRIBLE experience last night.  I haven't been to this restaurant for awhile but I have fond memories of coming for years - I used to work a block away and always had nothing but memorable experiences, even at times for special occasions, like several of my birthdays!

My sister arrived before me - the "hostess" - if you can even call her that - asked how many in our party, my sister said 2.  Never once did she mention that we had to sign our names on a list.  Ok, so I show up.  My sister again goes back to speak to her to see how long the wait will now be as there are several people waiting outside and it's beginning to get very crowded.  The hostess then says to my sister - did you put your name on the list?  Ah no, because you asked us how many, she said 2 and assumed you had some sort of system going.  She then says it's 45 minutes to an hour wait, keep in mind by this time we were already waiting a good 20 minutes or so.  

She doesn't apologize, she doesn't even have the decency to address people with a proper - "Please sign your name on our wait list, and it will be such and such time before there is an open table".  Just a BLANK STARE.  

So we give this person our name, see her write it on the list and decide to wait anyway, even though at this point I am extremely pissed.  It gets better.  So keeping tabs on who was waiting before us, who came after, etc etc - she proceeds to seat SEVERAL parties before the people that were waiting longer.  One gentleman catches wind of this and goes inside to ask her what the *** is going on.  She plays dumb.  He is very upset as well.  But - he and his party are all drinking wine outside and I guess decide to stay a little bit longer for a table. 

We finally get seated by this moron.  

Our server, who is at least friendly and smiling comes to greet us and ask if we'd like to start with some wine.  We say yes, she gives us our menus, etc.  

She then seats 3 OTHER tables and proceeds to take their orders ahead of US!  We had to continually ask the person that brings bread for things that we needed, and more wine.  We finally get our food and try to at least salvage what's left of this really lame evening.  All the while people are standing inches away from us waiting for a table (there is literally nowhere to wait in the restaurant save two small chairs directly in the flow of traffic - so people were leaning up against walls just watching and waiting for a table. I'm not a person that drags out their meal because I am sensitive to others that are waiting, however this was very uncomfortable.

The owner/s really need to take heed of the people they are hiring and need to put some effort into training.  This is still a customer service oriented environment, or should be.  There is NO SYSTEM!!

I was hoping to get seated in another area where the long time server works.  She at least is competent, friendly and nice to be around.

After giving this restaurant a lot of my business and referring it to many hotel guests/friends/family etc. I am hard pressed to ever come here again.  NOT OK.
author: Danielle K.

description:
tried to order to go and despite long line the waiter was too slow and wouldnt take our order
even though she took phone orders
 very dissappointed in such a service. either hire someone who can multitask or hire more people
author: Victoria G.

description: Friends of ours found this little neighborhood Italian restaurant on knob hill.   They don't take reservations so by 5:30 pm there was a line of people waiting for tables.    Always a good sign.    We had arrived right before 5:30pm and got the last 4 person table.   Again I had the prosciutto appetizer and the veal piccata.    Delicious meal at a reasonable price for SFO.
author: John M.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. The spaghetti carbonara is to die for, the best I've ever had. The pizza is also very good. Great service and reasonable prices.
author: Nikki H.

description:
About a month ago, my step-sister, her daughter and parents met there for dinner.

First off, with high quality offerings from Costco, food quality or portion size is not an issue.

The waitress was horrendous! Irregardless of the price of the food.

Unlike the following review of Nob Hill, the waitress represented everything negative of older and new San Francisco, NIMBY & not working well to deserve your wages and then some.
http://sf.curbed.com/2016/10/27/13302472/nob-hill-neighborhood-guide-sf

But as long as the majority of the clientele don't mind her ill mannered sycophantic White Exceptionalist attitude and probably the fire violation of the restaurant. This is just my experience.
author: S L.

description: Cozy spot for a nice Italian dinner with colleagues.  Caprese and Carpaccio were first courses to wet our appetite.  I ended up with the clams linguini.  It's light and lemony, unfortunately it lacked depth from garlic and parsley.  I had to add salt to make it more palatable.  I immensely enjoyed the complimentary focaccia that came in the bread basket.  It was hot, soft, and flavorful.
author: Patricia N.

description: My husband has been working in SF for the last three weeks, and many of his meals have been at this place.  I checked their pictures and they looked amazing.  I decided to come visit him this week for a few days, so I grabbed my fat jeans and headed to enjoy a carb fueled mini vacation.  The place is small and there is always a wait, but it is so worth it.  While we waited, you can enjoy a glass of wine on the outside tables.  There is no food service outside, but you can have drinks.  Once we got our table I ordered the Fettuccine al pesto, I have been dreaming about it.  I also told my husband that he wanted the gnocchi bolognese, hint, hint.  That was my other choice so I wanted to taste it.  Both dishes were amazing, the pesto was creamy and garlicky but delicious and the gnocchi were like little fluffy delicious pillows with a scrumptious bolognese sauce.  We ended the night with a shared tiramisu.  This place is worth the trip. I ended up going two nights in a row.  My second night, I had the tortellini with pesto and my husband had the Melanzana alla Parmigiana, plus chocolate ganache dessert, so delicious!
author: Marisa S.

description: Nice ambiance restaurant with good food and service! :) We'll definitely come back here again.
author: Hong L.

description: Charming little Italian cafe in the Nob Hill area. Fantastic lasagna & Margherita pizza!! The Caesar salad was ok...but no thing memorable or special!! The bread served with dinner, comes out fresh and warm with the scent of rosemary oozing into the air!! This place does not disappoint if you are craving authentic tasting Italian cuisine!!!
author: Cynthia R.

description: We came to this cafe because it was closest place to our office and amazed by the food! It was delicious. The serving lady tried her best. I liked this  cafe and will come back again!
author: Elnura A.

description: We were referred to this establishment by a local who shared with us this was her favorite restaurant in San Francisco. We were not disappointed. This restaurant was tiny and we had to squeeze through all of the people on a Wednesday night as it was completely full with a wait. I had the linguine and clams and my husband the calamari steak. The food was DELICIOUS! The staff was charming and the ambience was like you stepped off the sidewalk and were transported to Italy. This was a delightful experience!
author: Louise Y.

description: Wow, Nob Hill Cafe is a gem. It's in a great location, quiet neighborhood. The place is fairly small, but there's a nice area outside the restaurant where you can order drinks while waiting for the table. The best part are all the smells. Whether you're inside or outside, the aromas are amazing! I highly recommend getting the pasta over the pizza. The gnocchi is the BEST!
author: E C.

description:
Nob Hill sophistication with an excellent flare for one of SF'a best food. I had the Lasagne al Forno as a main course started with the Crostini di Polenta and a very refreshing Insalata Mista. Any chance I get I make a point to dine here.

Checked it off the SF bucket list.
author: Steve H.

description:
Great food, great prices, great atmosphere. This place is awesome. 
Only thing is the wait because everyone wants some. Suggest going early.

Got the gnocchi and the Bianca pizza special. 
Both were really good.

Would definitely re order the pizza.
And would want to try another pasta.

A must try if you are in the area.
author: Bryant C.

description: Went there for lunch, and was amazed at the level of service (only had one hour lunch, and the two dishes came to our table within 10 minutes of our order!). Despite small, it was cozy and with the rain outside it looked like we were in Europe. Gnocchi with pesto sauce: deliciously smooth and comes apart in your mouth! Linguini agli olio was also delicious, perfectly al dente.
author: Mason G.

description:
A statement to the mom & pop Italian restaurant in San Fran.  There are tons of Italian restaurants but not many that have that rare combination of good selection at reasonable prices and stellar dessert offerings.

Nob Hill Cafe fires on all cylinders and does a nice job of pacing the dishes without making you feel rushed.  We had the calamari steak, the petrale alla mugnaia and the lobster ravioli.  Desserts included the tiramisu, choc. ganache and the creme caramel- all were spot on. Add a glass of wine, a cup of coffe and ice tea for just under $100 before tip,  you have the makings of a great meal that does not break the bank.

We will definitely be back!
author: Ric C.

description: Nice little place in Nob hill.  I didn't know it was a breakfast place around lunch time- I was excited for gnocchi, buuuuut then I went for the salmon omelette.  They have adjacent spaces, I like this place.  Now I have to go back for the Italian food
author: Charles C.

description: Best tasting pastas on planet earth oh my. I always have a great dining experience here. Great service and food is delish! I been here for dinner mostly but their breakfasts are great too. I do recommend how ever going here on a weekday early evening , unless you want to be lining up MY the door for a 20-35 min wait.
author: Sophia H.

description:
We went to this Restuarant two times in our one weekend in SF. Robyn was the sweetest waitress and we got amazing food. Try the pistachio gelato dessert (trust me.) 

It was affordable, sweet and the atmosphere led to easy and fun conversation. 

Recommend.
author: Melissa M.

description: The food was delicious and the ambiance was very nice. My only complaints was the extremely long wait (which I knew about ahead of time) and the service was only ok. I came alone on a Thursday night and it was packed. There was a 25 minute wait and the only place wait is outside. The hostess was doing her best to accommodate everyone and there were some pretty finicky people waiting. When I sat down it took about another 10 minutes for my waitress to come over and ask for my drink order, I had the menu this entire time so I already knew what I wanted, I decided to skip the drink and just order because I wasn't sure when she was going to come back. To be fair I think there was only 2 servers in the whole restaurant, one on each side, probably 6 to 8 tables each. I wasn't upset or anything, I wasn't in any rush (which you probably shouldn't be if you come here). I ordered the chicken fettuccine with pesto sauce and pine nuts. Before the entree comes out they serve bread which was absolutely delicious. The main course was to die for. I would definitely recommend it. Overall, Food: 5 stars Service: 3 stars Cost: 4 stars. I would definitely come here again if I was in the bay area again.
author: Rachel M.

description:
To start off, I'd like to say that I gave this place 4 stars and not 5 because of the hostess' treatment to us. She was polite, but blatantly lied to us. We had been waiting for 1.5 hours right in front of the restaurant and we were seeing families that had arrived and put their name down on the list later than us already getting their tables. We were confused and talked to the hostess who told us that she had already called our name. This was a lie, seeing that we had been right in front of the entrance for over an hour. That was frustrating because we waited about 30 minutes more. This was not for nothing. When we were seated, we received amazing treatment. The complimentary bread was amazing, as was the rest of the food. I ordered the Ricotta Tortellini, and I was extremely
pleased. Amazing with the Romana sauce. Also, oder the garlic bread. You won't regret it. One of the best Italian restaurants i've ever visited. Give it a visit if you can.
author: Ricky O.

description:
Really good food.  Saturday afternoon 12:30PM.  I was surprised at the snarky service.  Been here a few times.  Just wasn't pleased with the man or lady who flitted by a couple times.   My tea ran out with no refill.   The lady made some comment about me eating everything but a scrap of bread and sauce.   

Just found the experience a little insulting considering I spent $20 for a bowl of penne and indifferent service.
author: Joe B.

description: Rude staff. I live in the Bay Area, and my sister, brother in law, and niece were in town visiting. We thought the food looked good, so we thought we would try it out. However, we never even sat down because the woman who showed us our table was so rude we left.
author: Render T.

description: SFO has a competitive restaurant scene with a lot of great choices and this really doesn't hit the mark. Decent Italian in a sub-par atmosphere. The staff was not welcoming, friendly or attentive. There was a little wait for a table on a week night and there is no where to sit/stand so you're stuck on the sidewalk - bring a jacket if it is cool in the evening.
author: John H.

description: Great food and service. It's a quaint little place. We ordered the pizza and a lasagna. Both were very good. We will go back next time we are in town.
author: Brent S.

description: I stopped here with my boyfriend for brunch before heading back to our hometown. I really liked how interesting their menu was and mimosas are always a plus. The food itself was pretty good, I enjoyed the fact that they took some usually heavier meals and turned them into something lighter. I had a salmon scramble, my boyfriend had the chicken omelette (or scramble, I can't remember) and we shared french toast. The wait staff was nice, however one really stood out and was super nice and accommodating. My boyfriend asked if they had any hot sauce besides Tapatio and she kindly said no but returned with a specially made hot sauce from the kitchen. Would definitely come back to this place!
author: Taylor D.

description: My boyfriend and I like to get take out from this place all the time! The food is delicious and I absolutely love their cream sauce! The environment is great! I love the service, except they often don't give you extra bread when you do take out! But other than that the food is amazing for the price it is and the pesto and cream sauce are musts!
author: Amy Y.

description: Such a cute little Italian restaurant! The wait was a little long but only because there was so many people wanting to eat here! It was delicious! Definitely going back :)
author: Alejandra H.

description: Great spot for a reasonably priced, delicious meal on Nob Hill,  only other options are the Hopkins, Fairmont and Huntington, all very nice but very pricey.    Nob Hill Cafe only a 3 minute walk from Grace Cathedral.   Only downside is that they do not take reservations so need to get there early before the evening dinner rush, if you have limited time for dinner.  Four of us had wine/beer, shared two apps, 2 sole entrees, 2 pasta, shared 2 desserts with coffee, $200 including gratuity....great deal.
author: Mr Kitty K.

description:
Great ambiance and service
Perfect spot in nob hill for a taste of Italy
I had the primavera pizza and it was excellent
author: Lou V.

description:
i wish i could give this place 3.5 stars because it's not really worthy of a good 4 or a low 3. the place is small but has two rooms. the bathroom is extremely tiny, but pretty much has everything needed for a good bathroom i guess... 

i ordered the tortellini ricotta, which looked really good. it tasted good but the pasta was swimming in sauce which i don't really like because i usually get a stomach ache. it wasn't a bad dish though.

i tried the lime tequila chicken omelette which was really good, along with the potatoes and corn muffin. 

anyways, the food was good and the place was nice. i liked it.
author: Leah Z.

description: I was pleasantly surprised! Nob hill cafe is a small and delicious Italian restaurant. We sat right by the kitchen, the front door and hostess area. At first I thought it was going to be annoying because of the location of our table, but it ended up being fine. It was awesome watching the guys make the dishes! Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Andrea H.

description:
This was one of the worst meals I have ever had.  The website and menu looked fantastic so I was looking forward to my meal.  I chose a Caesar salad and sole piccata.  The Caesar was so heavy on the anchovy (and I like anchovy) that I literally could not swallow it.  The salad was mostly hard romaine centers.  The leafy parts were mushy.  It made me nauseous. 

The sole was inedible.  It was so salty and had far too much lemon.  I ate about 3 bites and had to stop. 

The plusses were the bread and the prosecco.  Highly disappointed.
author: Dee L.

description:
I eat here two times a week.  Great service and the BEST Caprese Salad.

Neighborhood Gem
author: Jeff S.

description: We were staying in a hotel at the top of Nob Hill and wanted a local place for dinner that wasn't exorbitant. This was the place. Good menu with reasonable prices and friendly staff. We only had to wait for a table for about 30 minutes and then had a great table in the window. My linguine vongole was lovely and the pizza was great. The special of cod and zucchini risotto was OK but a bit boring.  The portions were good so none of us had room for dessert. Would definitely come here again.
author: Elaine S.

description: I've been here for a couple times. Lasagne and pasta were pretty good :) And lady who served me was so sweet! I enjoyed their cute and warm atmosphere. Good for couples to spend the sweet time.
author: Moe N.

description: Huge tasty breakfast burrito! Such a cute little neighborhood restaurant. I had the chorizo egg potato special.  Loved the wall decor of all the Corazones (hearts)!
author: Tonya C.

description: Noah our waiter was amazing. Food was 5 stars plus. Homemade pasta! Mussels, linguine, lobster cream sauce.Everything was delicious. Atmosphere cozy and relaxing.
author: Suzie B.

description: Here's an awesome plan for how to do Nob Hill Cafe right: https://livday.app.link/NobHillCafeDateNightPlan
author: Sarah P.

description:
Quaint, lovely location tucked in a residential area right next to Grace Cathedral. Parking might take a bit and be difficult, but it's hard to find such a lovely cafe in the middle of what seems like a residential area!

Haven't had much here, but came here on a recommendation and tried the penne bettola and loved it! Simple tomato pasta with pasta cooked right! First time was a bit too chewy, but the second time it was perfection.

Also highly recommend the omelette's here. My mother loved them and the eggs seem like they are almost baked. 

Solid food. Great service. Usually not much of a wait. Really unlike most of the yuppie filled (including myself I suppose ...), reservation needing, line waiting restaurants that come close. 

Come check it out to escape for a friendly family oriented cozy restaurant that won't break the bank. Cheers!
author: Joseph L.

description: Came here at 9:40 on a Sunday night for a quick dinner (they close at 10). I came outside to grab my friend and the server changed the sign on the door to closed when it was clearly open and the restaurant was half full still. Came back in to see if they could seat us, the server said yes let me get something set up, rudely shook his head at the cooks who rolled their eyes and pushed some glasses. I've never been so offended and treated rude. Don't come here-- trust me.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Im unsure how this place has an avg 4 star review. Worst Italian restaurant I've ever been to that I can recall. Ordered the chicken parm. First, the lighting situation is terrible. The restaurant has two halves, one that is brighter and more lively, and the other that is dimmer and more formal. This is perfectly fine. But, in the dimmer one, where we sat, some tables were sitting in almost complete darkness where you couldn't even see the food, let alone read the menu. Folks started taking iPhone flashlights out to read the menu (because they had to), blinding the rest of folks in the room. Second, the bread came, which was cold and hard. It was served with individually wrapped to-go butter. Never seen that in a restaurant serving $20 plates. Third, the chicken parm cheese was low quality and burnt. The chicken was completely dried out and stringy. The sauce was mediocre at best.

This place makes the Olive Garden look like ultra gourmet, and that's not even being fair to Olive Garden, which has pretty decent food. A better comparison is a discount brand frozen food TV dinner from Walmart.

Food is inedible, but the server was nice though!
author: S S.

description:
Quaint little cafe in an area that is primarily upscale residential.  Set off the beaten path of Union Square, Nob Hill cafe truly was a hidden gem.  I had the opportunity to enjoy a lovely lunch here and thankfully were able to do so without a wait.  It was really busy that afternoon and our waitress was swamped, but that didn't take away from enjoying our meal in a very cozy and quaint dining space.  It really made me feel like I was dining in someones home.  I enjoyed the smells and the hustle and bustle of the lunch crowd.  

I ordered the Linguine Aglio Olio with fresh garlic & extra virgin olive oil and a side of grilled chicken breast.  The pasta was so fresh and light.  It was really delicious for a deceptively simple dish.  I literally ate every last bite of my meal.  It is what good pasta should be.  Clean, simple flavors. No bells and whistles needed.  I would definitely suggest that anyone staying near Union Square make the trek up the hill for a great, reasonably priced and unassuming meal at Nob Hill Cafe.
author: Antaash U.

description:
Ate here during a weekend getaway to San Francisco and we were not disappointed! Try to make reservations, it's a small establishment and if you're stuck waiting to be seated you're only option is to wait outside on the sidewalk which isn't the funnest experience on a cold evening. We were lucky as our wait was only a few minutes.

Ordered the carbonara and a custom pizza with prosciutto and mushrooms. Simply writing this review is making my mouth water. While we waited for our food they served an assortment of fresh warm breads with butter. Delicious! Would've ate it all of I wasn't concerned with ruining my appetite. Overall the food was simply delicious and I'd definitely recommend it to others!
author: Radney S.

description: Food good quality and a four. Although skip the chicken parm. It is small and intimate, perfect for date night. Service is clearly hit or miss. If I was rating on service I would give a two to our server only. I saw other servers that were great. I just don't want to bring the overall rating down cause of one waitress. But seriously the special board is small already.  You need to go up and read it. The server when asked what are the specials snooty said its on the board. We were tucked away from the board and couldn't see it. No mention of the special verbally etc. I had to get up go over and read the board menu. Guess what I forgot by the time I got back. Horrible snotty service but food, garlic bread and my friends pasta were amazing. If I go back and get the same horrible service I am giving this place a two.
author: Kim H.

description: Delicious food, friendly and cozy atmosphere.  My husband and I grab lunch or dinner here every time we are in town.  The Fedellini Alla Cecca is a particular favorite of ours-simple and delicious.  Great Italian food and good portion size as well!
author: Jenene M.

description:
Pasta was amazing and the outdoor seating was great. Bruschetta could have been improved however.

Great overall menu and service along with solid portion sizes. Excellent location in Nob Hill central to almost everywhere.
author: J P.

description: Their focaccia bread...OUT OF THIS WORLD. Warm, slightly sweet and melt in your mouth soft. We all ordered the bolognese and pesto raviolis and they were both PHENOMENAL. Great service, wonderful ambience, definitely coming back!
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Shoutout to Santos and Carlos - the friendliest wait staff at both Venticello and Nob Hill Cafe - these brothers always make your experience amazing.  
Great food at good prices and love that u can do take out. Our perfect neighborhood spot :)
author: Jasmine G.

description: This place is amazing!  The food is Italian, absolutely delicious - I highly suggest (everything).  Also, the service is incredible - our server Robin was very pleasant, accommodating and friendly :). Will definitely come back!
author: Meghan R.

description: We loved this place.   Excellent pasta and Dover Sole.  Very close to the Fairmont Hotel.  We had excellent service and our meal was served quickly.  The wait was less than they quoted.  We were seated within 20 minutes without a reservation.  The prices were very reasonable for the quality of the food.  The service was outstanding.
author: Tim D.

description: Stumbled on this place while staying at Fairmont.  Excellent old fashioned lasagna and garlic bread.  Highly recommend.  Small joint, but worth the wait.
author: Kimberly G.

description: I love coming here for their pasta and eggplant Parmesan. As a vegetarian there's enough options to be satisfied. The wait is normally an hour but is worth it if you have the time.
author: Chandni D.

description: I rarely actually review restaurants. But this was so yummy it was worth a post. We came here for dinner at 6:30 on a Tuesday and there was already a line. We waited for about 30 minutes and it was worth it. Once we sat down service was fairly fast. You get a yummy mix of sourdough bread and rosemary focaccia, both delicious. Then for our meals we had tortellini with pesto sauce and lasagna. The tortellini, wow. It was soooo delicious and a really large portion. The lasagna was good, with a bechemel sauce, but not quite at the same level as the tortellini.  The restaurant is small and you will probably have to wait but it is worth it.
author: Mary Kate D.

description:
Came here on a Friday night at 8pm but was not seated until an hour later since this restaurant is pretty small. The restaurant itself had a nice little ambience to it and the smell was delicious.

Parking: I spent an hour trying to find parking and my friend had to wait for me to finish finding parking before we could be seated because they would not seat us unless our whole party had arrived. It was pretty frustrating so i suggest ubering or lyfting here if you can. 

Food: I had the gnocchi which was really delicious but it was kind of too much on the cheesy side. My friend had the linguini with clams which was pretty tasty because it had a hint of lime taste to it.

Service: The lady who took our order was very polite, but every time we tried to get her attention, she wouldn't notice until after a few times of us trying to flag her down. She also rushed away after we put our cards down and didn't even get a chance to ask if we wanted to split the bill or not. She had to walk back and ask us.
author: Priscilla S.

description: First time to eat here, recommended by our hotel- the Mark Hopkins and it was TASTY! Walked down this past Sunday night- 7:30pm and put our names in for an hour to hour and 20 minute wait! YIKES! Back to the hotel to watch some Warriors b-ball! Seated about 8:40pm, the smells and aromas had us SO hungry! Great bread to help the hunger pains, nice wine list, good specials on the board too. I had the Gnocchi Bolognese, amazing tastes and texture- PERFECT and filling! My wife had the Pasta Primavera special- so tasty and wonderful too! Good wines then dessert was the dolci- gelato, perfect to finish with! I'll  be back even with the place so busy it was a GREAT experience! Find something to do while you wait!
author: M S.

description:
Came on New Years Day for dinner at 6 pm and fortunately there was no wait. It is a charming Italian restaurant in Nob Hill with very reasonable prices. The service was quick and friendly. 

We started with the free rosemary bread and butter which was so good. I ordered the Linguine Alla Vongole ($12.75) that came in a huge bowl with a lot of clams and my boyfriend ordered Pollo Alla Parmigiana ($15.75). Both were really delicious dishes and they gave us generous portions. 

I would definitely recommend trying this place.
author: Linda X.

description:
Admittedly, I was not expecting much since I got this recommendation from a friend whose taste I don't always agree with.  Maybe my expectations were not super high, but I was pretty blown away with what I got.  Food was very, very good.  Service was very good.  Wine was good, wait, actually for the price it was very good.  I really have nothing to complain about, I even thought the price was fair for what we got (1 app, 4 meals, 1 bottle of wine, and 1 dessert was about $160 with tip).  Definitely a great place to put in my rotation, but SF is so loaded with gems like this it's kind of hard to give it 5 stars.  I reserve the right to add a star for when I go back.

If you go, the tortellini is great (I got the cream sauce) and my friend said the eggplant was terrific.  The waitress recommended the caprese salad and we all liked it. Might not be the fanciest place on the planet, but I don't eat decorations (unless the service is really way too slow...) and it's not like there is anything wrong with what they have set up.

Oh, if you have a chance they do have sidewalk dining.  It was full when we got there, but it looked very pleasant.
author: Jared J.

description:
Great the first time I went. Food tastes really good. 5 stars for that. Servers were warm and helped with recommendations.
Second time, all good but very slow service. Asked for spoon, didnt get. Asked for pepper didnt get. Took ages for the waitress to come around to us. Maybe they were understaffed but that's what it was. So, 3 stars for that.
Avg = 4 stars

First time i ordered the egg scramble breakfast yum!
Second time i asked for non-carb vegetarian options and the waitress was nice enough to customise a dish for me, putting roasted eggplant and cheese on a bed of spinach instead of penne. That attitude and change was really nice for me, as this is the point where some waiters start getting a look on their face.
author: Malvika B.

description: Loved this place. Came around 7 pm on a Monday and had a half hour wait. But they have seats outside and will serve you drinks while you wait. Cute place even though plenty big, it feels cozy because it's split in two sections. Had a lovely vibe and legit pasta! The gnocchi and  carbonara were the hits among our group. We also got bruschetta and an intense ganache for dessert. Intense in a good way! Great for a date or a group of up to four.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Got food to go and the hostess didn't give me all my change. If you guys don't have change then give your customer more. Don't round up and think the money is for you.

Dined in for brunch and ordered pick up two other times. 

1. Brunch - Def enjoyed the andouille sausage dish
2. Gnocchi was delicious (my first time trying it)
3. Wasn't to pleased with the other dishes but maybe I'm just really picky about my Italian dishes
4. Good service and pretty quick. There's usually always a line so be prepared to wait!
author: Anjoleen S.

description:
Eh. It was Friday night at 6pm. They were a bit busy but we did sit down right away, in the kitchen room.

The food felt thrown together. THe eggplant parm was big chunks of unpeeled eggplant with bitter-tasting skin, bland watery marinara, and rubbery cheese baked over pasta. 

I remember a completely different egglplant parm in the past, but I haven't been here for a few years. The pizza looked ok, and my other dining companion had pasta with pesto, which she enjoyed.

Nice pour on the wine - service prompt and utilitarian. Sure it was busy, but this place has lost something.
author: Roxmarie M.

description: I LOVE Nob Hill Cafe. This is my favorite place in the city to get pasta - it's SO good. Must haves: Crostini di Polenta, Lasagne al Forno, Gnocchi Bolognese, make sure to ask for their focaccia bread.
author: Jenny K.

description: Carbonara ALL DAY LONG. The Caesar was so so. A little room temperature. Definitely go early.
author: Kim W.

description:
Absolutely awesome cafe in Nob Hill!
I'm not big on Italian food, but we wanted to try it out anyways after it was recommended by two people to us. I've been here a few times and have never been disappointed. 
Service was perfect. Food came out timely and was all so good. The bruschetta is so good here, definitely a must. 
Get here early! By the time we left at 6:45, there were more people waiting outside than there were seats in the restaurant. 

Overall, would absolutely recommend.
author: Carly G.

description: Came here for a birthday dinner around 7pm on a Sunday.  They don't take reservations, and were busy so it was about an hour long wait.  I wish they would start taking reservations (hence only 4 stars).  Service and food was spectacular.  Once seated we were attended to promptly.  We ordered a lot of food for the table and everything was excellent.  They also service bread at the table which was a nice plus.
author: Travis B.

description: Loved it!  Quaint neighborhood restaurant. Both the food and the service are great. My favorite was the amazing bread that I REALLY wish they would ship to Texas!
author: B R.

description: Local and cozy Italian cafe. Good Lasagna. Very good spinach, avocado, goat cheese and vinaigrette dressing salad. Reasonable prices. 15-20$
author: Whitney B.

description:
Nice little place.  Had to wait about 30 minutes for a table on a rainy, blustery Monday evening so this says something about its popularity.

I had the gnocchi and my girlfriend had the seafood linguine special.  Mine was good.  Her's was really good.
author: Steve F.

description:
Best. Gnocchi. Ever!!!

BF and I were visiting SF and wanted a cute, quiet spot for some Italian and Yelp led us to Nob Hill Cafe, exactly what we were looking for. The place was surprisingly packed at 9 pm on a Sunday evening. We took this to be a good sign and endured the 30 minute wait which was SO worth it!

We started with the insalata caprese and my BF (the self proclaimed mozzarella expert) said it wasn't the best mozz he's had in his life but wasn't terrible (I enjoyed it!). 

On to our entrees... I got the gnocchi in the spicy tomato cream sauce and he got the linguine aglio olio. My gnocchi was perfect - the filling was soft and flavorful and the pasta melted in your mouth. I had switched out the sauce from what it normally comes with and was worried that my baby taste buds wouldn't be able to handle the spicyness of the sauce but it was delicious! Packed with flavor from the garlic and vodka, and not spicy at all. I had a bite of his linguine which was light and creamy at the same time. Both dishes dusted with some freshly grated parmasean cheese was delicious! 

Our server was also very friendly, attentive, and gave great recommendations on our dishes and substitutions! Can't wait to come back to Nob Hill Cafe next time I'm in SF!
author: Kamola P.

description:
The wait was a solid hour and a half, which was ridiculous for a table of four. Seems like the restaurant is made for tables of 2. But if you take a short walk around & grab a drink to wait it makes it worth it. Their food is great! We were a table of four -- I had the linguine and clams (this was good, but not the best I've had), others had the lasagna (the red sauce is weird), meat linguine, and a tortellini cream pesto sauce. The tortellini was by far the best of our dishes - it was actually amazing.

I don't think I'll come back anytime soon, the wait was too much to handle, BUT the food was good, the service was great, and the focaccia bread was the best I've ever had!
author: Michelle N.

description: I came here with a couple friends while I was in town on business. We started with a charcuterie plat, which was very tasty and generously proportioned. I followed this up with their pizza special which was delicious. My friends and I split a bottle of red wine and our bill came out to $40 a person which I was surprised by given it was near all the hotels and is in SF. A sign of how good the place is was that there was a line around the block when we exited the restaurant.
author: John B.

description: Not sure for such fantastic reviews, I eat throughout SF and I wasn't impressed with the food here. It was ok at the most. Maybe I have great food and restaurants to compare it to, or I'm just use to exceptionally great Italian food, since I'm from there. But 3 star is all they get in my book.
author: Azizi A.

description: Finally found our favorite "go to" Italian Restaurant when in San Francisco.  Nob Hill Cafe in the the middle of Nob Hill neighborhood.  We loved the delicious food, the warm customer service and the friendly customers too! The restaurant is very intimate and has an open kitchen so you feel like you are in a relative's home, eating wonderful italian comfort food with your friends and family.  This is a must try for anyone wanting a special experience in San Francisco.
author: Jodi F.

description: we figured a 45 minute wait meant that the food would be awesome - wrong. We were admittedly one of the lasy groups seated but when you arrive at 8 and wait until 845 you dont expect the staff to start breaking down at 950 - especially when there is still a line. What really got us was the chicken parm which was just chicken breast topped with a little sauce and some cheese. Quite disapointing.
author: Mike M.

description: This is our new favorite Italian spot in the city.  It's a small neighborhood joint in Nob Hill ~ we've gone during lunch; we tried on a Friday evening and it was packed (unfortunately, they don't take reservations).  Their polenta cakes are oh so delicious! The two times we've come, I've only ordered Spaghetti a la carbonara because I am so in love with the way they make it ~ the sauce is mild and the bits of pancetta add a bit of saltiness to the dish.  The wait staff is so friendly ~ they know all the regulars who come in.  Even if you're not a regular, they treat you as if you ARE one.  Love, love love this place for the food, ambiance, and the staff.
author: Joy H.

description:
Meh bc I'm not a fan of salty foods, esp my meat. My friend, who loves salty anything, loved it. 

Price: reasonable, 4/5
Service: great, 5/5
Food: 3.5/5
Cook w/ the perfect mullet: PRICELESS
**may come back JUST to see it again.
author: Noey A.

description: The service was bad .  We waited 35min at 9:30pm .  There was only 2 of us .  They seated a table of 4  and a table of 2 which they didn't have to wait at all .  I asked if they take reservations and she said no .  I asked her why  she seated the other people before us .   Her comment was if there's more than two they are supposed to seat them before us even though we have waited 35 minutes.  When we finally got seated we ordered pizza and wine. And the waitress question us if that was it and we said yes because we don't want to eat too late .  she was not happy with this comment  and she gave us minimal service.  The pizza was not that great either.
author: Norm G.

description: Carbonara to die for. Pizza too. They don't take reservations so show up at least 30 min before you would like to eat. It's a hole in the wall with a liquor store next-door, great place to grab a small wine and stand on the sidewalk to sip as you wait for the other diners to finish. Plus side, the hostess can even bring you a beverage as you wait. If you've never dined here before, go for the carbonara. You can't miss it. It's the closest I can get to tasting like real pasta. The kind I stuffed myself with while I traveled Italy. Service is always stellar. I always get the sweetest young woman with brown hair. And the hostess is the nicest thing as well. I've waited over and hour for this pasta before. It's worth it. This place is a true SF gem.
author: Sierra B.

description: The restaurant is in a residential (ish) area in San Francisco and is a typical cute hole-in-the-wall. Our wait for 2 people for dinner was around 20 minutes but the place was packed. The food was amazing, and the seating was very cozy and romantic. I have no complaints :)
author: Angella G.

description:
This place seems very authentic. They make their own cheesy focaccia bread in house, and it's delicious. I went for the gnocchi bolognese and both the gnocchi and the sauce were also very savory and filling (albeit not a very large dish). The chicken parm is also very good, oven baked in the dish and scorching hot and made just like momma did it. 

It is a busy spot and a tight fit in some tables, but if you work yourself up into a fit of hunger early enough and drop by soon after they open, you can certainly get in with little or no wait. Plus, if you do happen to wait, you can enjoy the seating out front at a table until you're up.
author: Patrick N.

description:
A small, quaint neighbourhood restaurant in the middle of Nob Hill that serves surprisingly good Italian food. My friend and I tried the Gnocchi Bolognese and the Fettuccine alla Vongole. I absolutely loved the fettuccine, the taste of white wine was strong, while there was an ample amount of clams. 

The gnocchi bolognese was also quite good and I liked the meat sauce. I wish they would give bread during lunch though, as the sauce would go so well with it. I did feel that the pasta did not stand out against the many many Italian restaurants in town, but this place offers relatively good value and serving size for the price. 

The brunch menu looks pretty delicious too, and I'm excited to go back and try!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Excellent breakfast brunch the only negative is they don't open until 11am

 We were there for brunch several omelet & egg choices potatoes et all done to perfection

Apparently for lunch & dinner they are all about pasta and pizza...if the brunch menu is any indication I bet they have the "Italian" thing figured out 

I would definitely go back
author: Mike M.

description: this place is a delicious gem off the beaten path that is surprisingly popular. We stumbled upon it a couple minutes after opening for dinner and it was almost full. We shard a delicious pizza on the "specials" menu and had great service and delicious wine.
author: Valerie B.

description:
We had lunch today because we were in the area and Yelp's rating showed 4 stars but based on my personal experience it should not be more than 3 max.

We had risotto and pasta with sausage. The pasta with sausage was tasteful, very low quantity for $19.00 but ok. Nothing extraordinary.

The risotto with pancetta and peas had very little pancetta, more peas and was flavorless, a little soupy for risotto. Also, $19.00 

For lunch, quality, presentation, quantity, really not worth it.
author: Olga B.

description:
I love this place. Tucked away just past the top of Nob Hill, this friendly, local restaurant truly deserves all of these glittering reviews. 

Yes, you'll probably have to wait a bit for a table, but once inside, you'll be enveloped in the cozy vibe this small restaurant provides. Even at max capacity, you'll find that the noise level in the restaurant still allows for intimate dinner conversation.

The bread is fresh (and yes, "cake-like"!), the portions are generous, and the service is friendly and helpful.

I plan to make regular trips to this place, and hope this restaurant continues to be a Nob Hill staple for years to come.
author: Jen O.

description:
I loved it here! The food is simply delicious and the atmosphere is cozy and romantic.

You have to go prepared to wait a little before sitting though, but the wait is definitely worth it. And you can always enjoy some wine while you wait.

I'm a fan!
author: Javiera C.

description:
I was carbo-loading, without a race to run, jog or even walk.  I was there to cheer my friends on as they nourished their bodies and souls before the SF Rock N' Roll half marathon the next day.  I was just hungry and craving pizza and pasta.

When we approached the restaurant we saw a few parties waiting ahead of us.  A relatively short wait led to a table where we were soon presented with two different types of bread.  A quick glance at Yelp reviews and a survey of the dining room told us the gnocchi and Spaghetti Carbonara were the recommended dishes.  One friend ordered the Gnocchi Bolognese, another ordered the pasta with fresh tomatoes and basil and I ordered the linguine with clams.  We decided to split a Margherita pizza to start the meal.  

This is an old school Italian restaurant and the food and style of preparation reflected that.  Good, fresh ingredients, prepared simply and served in BIG portions.  What's not to like?  Service was spot on, with the food arriving in a reasonable time and our waitress keeping our water glasses filled.  Although the space is small, we never felt squeezed or squished.  Prices were very reasonable (i.e. downright cheap) for this neighborhood gem.  If this restaurant were in my neighborhood I would probably need to find races to run every week to justify eating there so often.
author: Melissa L.

description: Wow, wow, wow! The menu is small but as the waiter said "everyone can find a favorite". The food here is phenomenal and at a fair price. Seating is limited but we made if just before the dinner crowd. Wife had Spaghetti Carbonara, I opted for the veal oso bucco. We also had s Caesar salad. I am usually not one for salads with light dressing but the salad was extremely fresh and Delian. We shared entrees, The Carbonara was rich and delightful (I almost made myself sick trying to finish it).  The veal was VERY tender! Noodles were fresh and the sauce was very balanced. Wait staff was a please and very attentive. I highly recommend it!
author: Justin T.

description:
Not entirely sure how this place gets such good ratings. I would describe it as a diner that serves American Italian food.... and that not tasty but rather plain and boring. Generally perceived all dishes as very greasy. 

This place was also not cheap... So you're getting not much of a value overall.
author: Mike S.

description:
nob hill cafe, i reallly reallyy reeeaaaallly wanted to love you... there have been countless nights where i have walked past you, asked how much the wait time was for 2 or 3 or 4, and just were too hungry to wait for a table.

so since my parents are in town, and they love simple italian food, we just decided to wait for a table on a saturday night - but the wait for 3 wasn't bad at all!! about 20 minuutes later, we were offered the first table to the right (which is not ideal because it's is LITERALLY next to the vent in the kitchen...), but..at least i was finallllly gonna try you, nob hill cafe! and your CARBONARA, which i have flipped through at least a 1000 times in yelp photos.

we got: veal piccata, the seafood risotto special, and of course, the carbonara; and some chianti to pair with the food. the bread basket, with its herby spongy bread, is delicious. i myself had 4 slices.

there is one lady seating people, two ladies waitressing, one bus boy, and four men in the kitchen. theyre SUPER effficient, and super friendly...!

but my review is based on the food, and it was juust...okkkkaaaayyy. the carbonara was def my favorite, something that i will try to replicate (probably unsuccessfully) again and again, the veal was quite overcooked (though my parents do like well done meats), and the risotto was just a bit bland, and the rice was not exactly risotto-y. SIGHH! major major sigh!

i will probably come back again, because it is such a cute neighborhood spot, and the prices are so reasonable. dinner for 3 under $100?! unbelievable! buutttt, my search for a sollid italian spot in the city continues...
author: Christina L.

description: YUMMMY my girl Sasha and I came here when we needed a filling breakfast after a LONG weekend. Wow let me tell you, the breakfast pizza was on point. I've also had soup and pasta here for dinner but breakfast was really good. Try it, you'll like it.
author: Lauren D.

description: What a wonderful neighborhood gem. Delicious Italian food. Salads are gourmet and large enough to share. Pizza and pasta are both great.
author: Vicki S.

description:
I came here yesterday with my boyfriend for dinner.  It was conveniently located near the Fairmont where we stayed over night.  The place is quite small, but we were lucky to have  gotten a table within 5 minutes.

I had the carbonara and caesar salad. They were on par with most Italian restaurant that I've visited, though like many of them, the carbonara was a little dry.  A bit more of the egg yolk would have helped.  Also, instead of thin slice bacon, I wish they served it with pancetta. Overall, it was okay.

The service though could have been faster.  We waited for bit to place our order and when it came time to pay, it took awhile for the our bill to arrive.
author: Yuki I.

description:
Came here on a date with someone. He enjoys stuff in his area so he wanted to come here and get some pasta. We ordered some glasses of wine and then some pasta. 

The bread - pretty good.  I ended up ordering the Gnocchi Bolognese. The gnocchi was soft and delicious. The sauce was great as well. I enjoyed the dish and really wished that I split it into two meals. 

Really cute cafe type place.  Good food. 

Protip: get some amazing food and enjoy the location. Really close to the top of Nob Hill.
author: Nina Y.
