Place is small if you eat in but they let you order drinks while you wait for a table and the restaurant setup feels very urban and authentic but also chic.
author: Audrey S.

description: Trying to make a lunch arrangement for a large group. They have a clear policy that they won't take reservations, but when I called to ask how long the wait typically is for a larger group at lunchtime, I was told to try another restaurant... Then I asked the simple question again, and was told it could be anything from 0 to 30 minutes, and that they did not want to make a statement about wait times.  It seems far too hard to get a simple answer to a simple question here.
author: s j.

description: The Tiramisu was like eating flavored whipped cream.  Ate there with some friends I hadn't seen in a long time and was basically ushered out the door after we ate.  The waitress too had an attitude when I ordered the dessert menu. Not interested in returning.
author: Russell L.

description: I came here based only and solely on the Yelp reviews. I had the linguine and baby clams. It was so worth the wait and effort. The bread was fresh and complimented my wine well. My waitress was courteous and had one good recommendation: try the tiramisu. The location and layout commands a place to have a romantic date. Really enjoyed this place.
author: Tim F.

description:
Best Italian in this city.
Food is consistently delicious.
Really big portions.

Really cute restauraunt, but no real atmosphere... i.e., no lighting, music, its cramped, and you are right net to your neighbor.

I don't like the wait, so I usually do take-out to avoid the line.
author: Ash R.

description: This is one of our neighborhood restaurants and I've been here many times and the service and food has always been spot on.  My fiance and I went here about two weeks ago, it was actually our first night out after having our baby girl,,, so we were kind of excited to get out! :)  Anywho,,,, you can't make reservations but we had a really short wait of only 10 minutes and the hostess was great!  We were seated at our table and that's when things started going downhill.  Our waitress barley acknowledged us and we had to wait a fairly long time for her to come to our table.  It's a very small restaurant and she seemed super friendly to the table next to us, telling them what she liked best on the menu and being super friendly and going on and on.  She did this to all the tables she was working then when she came to us, she was very rude and short with us,, it was the most bizarre thing ever. :(  We are pretty easily pleased so for us to complain takes a lot.  The food was great and we love that the restaurant is in our neighborhood but the service we received was horrible. Didn't quite catch her name but she had long blonde hair.  Even at the end of our dinner, she didn't even ask us if we wanted dessert or how the food was or even thank us for coming in.  We tried for this experience to not spoil our night but it definitely put a damper on things.
author: Tina T.

description:
Don't understand why this place has SUCH a high score. We come here a lot because it's the closest place for food in the area. I have to say, this place is very quaint (cute decorations, nice seating) but the food is TERRIBLE.

First, way too oily. They drench their pastas in oil/butter and the food is really bland. I had the bacon-laden pasta once (let it get a bit cold because we were preparing to go out after) and it was just pieces of grease everywhere.

Second, price is not very reasonable. $20 for a tiny entree that's tastes just like Safeway pesto & $1 pasta? No thanks.
author: Jennifer J.

description: I really enjoy Nob Hill Cafe. I always like the ambience, the staff is pretty friendly, and the food is really tasty. It's a great neighborhood restaurant that works well for friends and dates. Definitely love having this place nearby!
author: Jinja R.

description:
Was in town for one night with the BF and decided to come here based on reco's from Chowhound and the reviews here on yelp.  It was walking distance from our hotel.  We got there at about 9 on Friday night and the wait wasn't bad at all, about 20 minutes.  Weather was great so sitting outside so waiting was not an issue at all.  

We were seated in one of the cute little tables in the very front small bay windows.  Very private and romantical... I loved it because I hadn't seen my boyfriend in a month (don't get me started on how much LDRs suck) and this was the first night of our weekend together.  The table made it very easy to talk and flirt and enjoy each other :)

Anyway, we had a bottle of Montepulciano, and I ordered the mixed greens salad, BF had the artichoke soup that was on special to start with.  Both were delicious although the portions were HUGE for starters.  For main course I had the penne in cream sauce, he had the tortellini in pesto.  Neither were anything fancy or groundbreaking, but solid, and good good good.  Huge portions again.  Could have easily just eaten half and taken the rest but I was a giant pig and ate almost the whole thing, so did the BF.  And no, nothing we ate (aside from maybe my starter salad) was remotely healthy here. 

We skipped dessert since we were such giant pigs from the rest of dinner.  It was getting late and the restaurant was emptying out pretty quickly, but we never once felt rushed to leave.  Oh, our server was great, it was an Irish guy who is from Dublin originally.  I only found out the Dublin part because I had had lots of wine and was pretty chatty towards the end of dinner :)

I did not find the prices to be too high at all, especially compared to what I found at other restaurants in this neighborhood when researching where to go, I think our bill, with the wine, was around $75.

Overall a great spot and I will definitely come again whenever I find myself in the neighborhood again.
author: Julie C.

description: I've wanted to try this restaurant for years, but have been discouraged by the line. Finally, there was no wait yesterday and we were seated right away. The space is limited and pretty crammed, but it added to the charm of the restaurant. The waitresses were attentive and my water cup was always filled. My boyfriend and I started with the caprese salad, which was delicious and perfectly dressed. I got the linguini alla vongole, which had a strong lemon flavor but I enjoyed it. I wish the pasta was homemade and that the clams were less chopped up, but the dish was still delicious nevertheless. My boyfriend got pollo alla parmigiana and was very happy with his dish. I would definitely return- I'm dying to try the gnocchi bolognese!!
author: Peggy L.

description:
LONG lines, even on a week night; possibly because there're not a lot of options at the top of the hill 
My vongole was ok; it definitely wasn't the best I've had but it was a huge bowl and i was starving after the 45 min wait. 
The restaurant smelt great, so maybe i just got the 'wrong' dish (vongoles are my fave)

Will drop by to try something else in the future since it's right by my apt
author: Jocelyn L.

description: nice neighborhood Italian restaurant up on Nob Hill.  Short easy walk from the Fairmont or Hopkins.  Tried the carbanara and the pizza; both were good.
author: Curt C.

description:
Love this place. So cozy and intimate! The food is great and it's a wonderful place for a date or dinner with girlfriends. I don't go to dinner alone, but if I did, this would be the place to do it. 

I usually get the gnocchi bolognese which I love, but recently got the carbonara and fell in love. Very rich and delicious. 

I wouldn't recommend the pizza, pasta or bust. The soft bread is also very good too. 

There is usually a wait but they serve wine to those waiting outside which is really quite pleasant.
author: Case S.

description: Short and sweet from a SF native ... Possibly the best pasta ever. Wife had the Fedelini Alla Cecca and I devoured the Linguine Alla Vongole all excellent and to die for fresh. Service was fast and courteous. Love this place.
author: John R.

description: Love this place! Very small but great service and food. Definitely try the Spaghetti Carbonara. We will go back on our next trip.
author: Courtney S.

description:
We were staying at the Fairmont Hotel and we were lucky enough to find the Nob Hill Cafe around the corner.  This was by far the best dining experience on our entire trip to San Francisco.  In fact, we are still dreaming about it.  

We called the cafe in advance and they did not take reservations.  There was quite a wait on a Saturday night, but we enjoyed the ambience of this authentic little Italian cafe while we waited.  All of the food looked and smelled amazing and we chatted with some Swiss tourists before we were seated.

We (somewhat accidentally) ordered the Calzone and asked for added vegetables.  We were beyond pleasantly surprized!!  The Calzone was out of this world incredible, filled with soft, sweet, glorious garlic.  We have not stopped raving about it.  And this is coming from someone who normally does not care for or orders garlic dishes at all.  The service was fantastic as well and we literally felt like VIPs from the moment we arrived.  

This family-friendly establishment was truly the highlight of our visit to SFO.
author: Kate Y.

description: Great food! Just tried a pasta dish and it was amazing. The customer service was good as well. A MUST GO! :-)
author: Anthony T.

description: My husband and I had dinner here tonight.  Service was prompt and the food was nothing less than amazing!!  I had the tortellini and he had the clans linguini.  We both shared the Tirimisu for dessert and agreed it was the best we had in a very long time!  I highly recommend!!
author: Karri T.

description: I'm having their Penne Bettola, and a glass of wine. Boy are we living it up. The Bettola penne was excellent and quite spicy. Very good mixture of flavors, garlic and vodka great combination.
author: Victor J.

description: Came on a Monday night at 6 pm. Waited approx 1/2 hr. No room to wait inside so sat outside and enjoyed a glass of wine while we waited. Place is small, cramped an loud., but the food was good and reasonably priced. My husband had the gnocchi and raved about it. My daughter had the lasagna and it was ok. I don't remember the name of my pasta but it had a creamy red sauce and was very good but not over the top. The focaccia bread they bring to the table was warm and so delicious. I was disappointed in the wine list as there were no wine offerings from the Napa or Sonoma county. The wine was also slightly on the warm side. This cafe is out of the tourist area in a quiet, nice area. We were staying in union square and it was an easy walk. It took us about 15-20 minutes to get there. Looked like more of a local hang out. I would definitely come back and try it again.
author: T A.

description:
I don't care...I'm going to say it: NHC is my absolute FAVORITE Italian resto in SF. There you go, it's all there in black and white. I can hear the choruses of all of you judgemental foodies crying out "Wait! Don't pigeonhole yourself! Really, you're FAVORITE Italian Resto in ALL OF SF???" Yes, bitches, that's what I said. It's simply the best. I've tried so many in my almost 10 years living in the city (am I dating myself?) and this is the chupacabra. 

My dinner goes something like this: Start with a piece of their delicious bread, share a calamari insalata, or maybe the caprese, then artfully eat only half my portion of (red chili flake covered) liguine vongole, while washing everything down with a glass of the Santa Cristina Sangiovese. If we're feeling extra naughty, for dessert we'll order the granache (unreal...it's like an orgasm in your mouth...the good kind). THEN...the next morning, after being unable to stop thinking about that amazing meal, I'll have my leftovers for bfast and let me tell you...there are seldom happier mornings in my life than when I eagerly dive into my vongole leftovers with my favorite chopsticks and happiness in my heart. Where, I implore you, where else does that happen?? 

I just love the ambiance, the reasonable prices (I'm Asian...you knew that was coming), the wonderful wait staff, and the FOOD. God this place is amazing. Even though I don't live in the area anymore (though not terribly far away), my husband and I continue to make the trek here because God damnit, it is worth the trek and the wait. And that's all I have to say about that.
author: Sadia J.

description: This place is such a hidden delight!  I discovered this place  on yelp actually, when I was vacationing at the Fairmont...not a far walk!  its very cute, small, with a European cafe-like atmosphere.  Solid authentic Italian food and very affordable!  Veal piccata was excellent!  I continue to visit this little gem every time i visit SF!
author: Emily M.

description: Cute and quaint Italian restaurant. We ordered wine (cab and port), an appetizer (polenta), an entree (gnocchi), and dessert (flan). Overall, good food and service.
author: Romita J.

description: Stay away... I have never been treated worse in my life. The owner and staff are extremely rude. They were completely empty and myself, my 85 year old grandma and mom stopped in. We were waiting for our fourth and were going to order for her. They would not seat us at any of the open tables and forces my 85 year old grandmother to walk out. I will never be going back.
author: Steve J.

description:
Always a safe bet.  Always tasty.  Always busy.  Always fresh.

The only problem is that it's almost always unhealthy.  This place uses more heavy cream than any restaurant I've ever seen.

Avoid the heavy cream and build your own calzone!  And then split it with a friend, or have half of it for the next day's lunch.
author: Droo G.

description:
I grew up about a block away from Nob Hill Cafe, and every time I walked by, I was amazed at how it managed to get packed during dinner time.  It wasn't until I left home and came back during visits did I actually eat here.  Since my first foray into Nob Hill Cafe nearly a decade ago, I have never had a bad experience here.  The food is consistently delicious and deserves its praise.  Their pasta and other dishes always satisfies my Italian cravings.  My mouth is watering as I write this.

The service staff are pleasant and the vibe mellow despite the somewhat cramped spaces.  Be prepared to wait up to 45 minutes during peak times though!
author: Davy C.

description:
Of all the Italian places I've tried in SF, this has to be my favorite. It's small, crowded almost always, you will most likely have to wait for a table, but the food is top notch.

My favorites, a simple cheese tortellini with pesto sauce.  Their pesto is hands down one of the best I've ever had, and with the fresh pasta topped with some pine nuts. Mmmmmm!

Most of their pastas are simple, and not over the top. Like their clams and white wine pasta. Fresh tender clams, with a hint of lemon and a sprinkle of Parmesan on top.

Their specials are almost always amazing. If you love mushrooms, and they happen to have their triple mushroom raviolis GET THEME!

Their specialty pizzas are very good most of the time. They do a pear, porchetta and Gorgonzola pizza on occasion that's delectable.

If you are there on a Sunday morning, and want something for a brunch. Try their breakfast pizza. With scrambled eegs, applewood sausage, cheese and a light tomato sauce.

Their dessert gelato is unlike any I've had.  It's served as a cake slice on a light crust that varies with the flavor. Well worth trying if you are up for a dessert.

If you don't like crowded small tables, and want more of an upscale dinning experience, then go do the street to their other restaurant. But if you just want really good food go here.
author: Kenji K.

description: Yes, this little café lived up to the name of nice, great food, great service.  I had the Lasagna and it was perfect.  I highly recommend this to all locals and tourists
author: Curt T.

description:
Loved it! This was just right for two reasons.  First, let me say that we tried to go there a few nights ago and when they were full and on a wait they kindly suggested a place down the street (Venticello Ristorante).  This place was pretty expensive and their portions were rather small (although still delicious).  So tonight we returned to Nob Hill Cafe for two reasons: portion size and price.  For $13 each we got nice big bowls of flavor packed pasta.  It wasn't overly fancy with exotic vegetables and cheeses and waiters in bowties, but was extremely flavorful and delicious.  We also got lots of fresh parm on top.

So it depends what you want.  Some really good pasta at a great price in a nice atmosphere, or something that's built up to be a lot fancier and classier and is much more expensive.  Both places we're delicious, just a matter of what you're in the mood for.  I'd go to NHC 10 more times before retrying the other place, but that's just me.
author: Vince P.

description:
My friend suggested Nob Hill Cafe just a couple blocks from her apartment for dinner because she's a lazy bum and didn't want to drive out to meet us. Luckily, she also has good taste and Nob Hill turned out to be a great choice.

The restaurant is small and there was a wait despite the fact that it was already 8PM on a Monday night. We settled down in one of the empty outdoor tables with a bottle of Sangiovese as we waited, and soon enough we were seated. Nothing like passing time with wine!
 
For my entrée I had...
GNOCCHI BOLOGNESE (with fennel seed sausage, ground beef, and pomodoro) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNMCITEPGh6cgqd6VDfQOg?select=7yPc_HQx2jEQeRAzFUBH6w Nob Hill's homemade gnocchi is so plump and fluffy and the ratio of meat to gnocchi was perfect. If you like gnocchi, I highly recommend this dish.

My friends had..
SPAGHETTI ALLA CARBONARA (with roman cream sauce, pancetta, egg, and garlic) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNMCITEPGh6cgqd6VDfQOg?select=llujorLfLno6828zkr2MHQ This was my second favorite dish of the night, after the gnocchi. The pancetta gave the whole dish a lovely smokiness.
LINGUINE ALLA VONGOLE (with baby clams, white wine, lemon and garlic) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNMCITEPGh6cgqd6VDfQOg?select=C9fkSwfvm8modH7Ef4KMfg I originally wanted to order this because linguine alla vongole is my favorite pasta dish but my friend warned me against it saying that it's really sour and she's sent it back before. But since another friend ended up ordering it, I got to try it anyway. I can see why I was warned against this dish. The lemon flavor in the dish is really overpowering and I've never had linguine alla vongole like it. If you're normally a fan of linguine alla vongole, don't get it at Nob Hill Cafe. It won't be what you're expecting.
TORTELLINI ROMANA (with creamy pesto and toasted pine nuts) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNMCITEPGh6cgqd6VDfQOg?select=sytMvRhWXrMkCbFNUC_NHQ Another solid dish, though not as memorable as the gnocchi and carbonara. 

For dessert we shared the PUMPKIN & GRAND MARNIER GELATO http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNMCITEPGh6cgqd6VDfQOg?select=H0grzrWq3LW9il6zMukUHw and CHOCOLATE CHOCOLATE CHIP GELATO http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yNMCITEPGh6cgqd6VDfQOg?select=9P6ZaIKN_pLWsxB1e5og2w. Nob Hill's gelato comes in the form of ice cream cake with a thin layer of cheesecake at the bottom. Genius. Both were really good, though I liked the chocolate better because I tend to prefer chocolate desserts. Nob Hill has a wide variety of gelato flavors and I dare say that as long as you pick a flavor you like, you will definitely like what you get.

Service was really friendly and prompt and dinner was surprising inexpensive; the pasta entrées were no more than $15 each. Though I probably wouldn't drive an hour just to dine here again, I definitely would go again if I happened to already be in the area. Nob Hill Cafe is a great little neighborhood gem that I wish was in my own neighborhood.
author: Amy S.

description: While waiting outside for a table, you can't help but smell the garlic bread from inside and wish you had a piece in front of you at that moment.  Unfortunately, the garlic bread was not worth the wait.  I didn't enjoy it at all.  But, on the other hand, everything else our party of 7 ordered was delicious, from the linguine with clams to the gnocci to the penne with spicy vodka sauce.  It is very loud inside, but as a group of 7 we didn't mind at all considering we were increasing the volume level ourselves.  Service is great, pizza was tasty, and the wine was flowing so really not too many negatives to say.  I really just wish the garlic bread tasted as it smelled... Still bummed about it :(
author: Jessica M.

description:
Nob Hill Cafe is well known for their home-made pasta. 

*** Gnocchi Bolognese MELT in your mouth! ***

It's in a peaceful neighborhood, a 5 minute walk from the grace cathedral and the fairmont hotel. If you're in a small party (2-4 people), likely you'll sit by the open kitchen.


I had a FANTASTIC experience at nob hill cafe - cozy, comfy atmosphere, decent pricing, good location (I took a cable car here!), DELICIOUS food, and fast, friendly service. 

Definitely my go-to italian place in SF.
author: Eunice M.

description:
This place is constantly packed during the week, so we thought it must be awesome! They seated us within a few minutes despite being busy, which was cool. Atmosphere 

Wine was well-priced at around 2x retail, so we had a nice bottle without breaking the bank, by SF standards.

The food was only OK, with doughy pizza and average pasta. We were hoping for awesome family Italian food, but it fell short.
author: John A.

description:
My husband and I were visiting San Francisco from east coast staying at nearby Fairmont.  On this Thursday evening, we originally planned to go out for crab somewhere, but we instead opted for a 5-minute walk to this small romantic Italian restaurant tucked into this cool Nob Hill neighborhood.  To no surprise, we waited about 40 minutes for a table, each sipping a nice glass of red wine at one of the outside tables.

Once we were seated for dinner inside, our server immediately came by to offer new glasses of wine, making sure we had menus, and reviewed the nightly specials.  We both commented what a cozy and relaxing atmosphere they had.

What we ordered:

I had the Insulata Caprese for appetizer, and it very easily exceeded my expectations.  It was absolutely delicious, with the perfect amount of balsamic and olive oil over the fresh tomato, mozzarella, and basil.  For main dish, I ordered Tortellini Ricotta with Romano sauce.  Both the pasta and sauce were light with the perfect amount of flavor and portion.  Once again, they hit a homerun with my order!

For my husband's meal, he went with the Beef Carpaccio for an appetizer.  He had only tried it once previously, and this was very out of the box for his normally conservative tastes.  He loved it and left nothing behind with this delicious appetizer.  For main dish, he ordered the Gnocchi with Bolognese.  We had read this was a popular dish, and it certainly did not disappoint.  Gnocchi can sometimes be very heavy but this was light - similar to pasta and not potato, and was a delicious success.

In summary, with each of us ordering two glasses of wine, our own appetizer and main dish, we had no problem paying $100 (tip included) for a wonderful meal and romantic dinner experience.  We would both happily recommend this Italian restaurant to anyone.
author: Bonnie M.

description: Was told wait would be 30-45 minutes and it was over an hour, and then wasn't that thrilled with dinner (the long wait didn't help). Bruchetta was cold cut up tomatoes on toasted bread with big pieces of fresh basil. Didn't care for it much. Eggplant salad was too vinegary. Veal picatta was good. Server was very nice. First time here and won't be going back.
author: elise k.

description: This had to be my last meal on our trip to SF/Napa. We arrived 2 minutes before the doors opened for dinner at 5. We had a flight to catch at 8:30, but I had to fit it in! I waited a whole year to eat the spaghetti carbonara!! It was amazing, yet again. It's such a simple and satisfying bowl of goodness. The best I've ever had. They rushed our order, as requested. Our waitress was very sweet and accommodating. We were out in 40 minutes and our bill was only $33 (+tip)!! I hope to celebrate our third anniversary here next year.
author: Christy C.

description:
The first  thing I noticed when I enter a restaurant is the smell. it was not particularly inviting here.. Musty, slight mold. a bit of plumbing perhaps.
They tried to put us close to the door, and we had to ask to be moved to a more comfortable, warmer place.  The next thing we noticed was the quality of the Italian bread on the table. No crust, average talian.  We had  to ask for olive oil.
My vegetable soup was over salty, and the Parmasan chicken was average, the chicken tasting like it could have been frozen.
Perhaps the pizza and pasta dishes are better.

No plans to go back.
author: David A.

description: Wandered into a foreign part of the city and decided to drop in. Considering it was Halloween, it was a pretty short wait of 20 min. A close walk to the Grace Cathedral was a nice way to pass the time. We ordered the Linguine Alla Vongole and Gnocchi Bolognese and they were both delicious! I am usually wary about Italian food being too heavy, but they did these dishes very well.
author: Michelle C.

description: I was craving some good pasta for the longest time. The first Italian place I went to in my first week of arriving in San Francisco was pretty horrible. Who'd thought an Italian restaurant in Russian Hill would suck but it really did. This place on the contrary was pretty awesome! I ordered fettuccine al pesto and my husband ordered Prosciutto E Melone. Both were to die for. The price was very reasonable - most of the main pasta dishes were around $12 - $15. I'll go back again very very soon.
author: Ah M.

description: Food is delicious and very reasonable - about the best deal you can find in the city. However, I would recommend doing take out or coming for lunch/brunch. Dinner is always extremely crowded  and there are not many seats in the dining room.
author: Eric S.

description:
This is a really small and cute italian place hidden on nob hill! I think its the closest restaurant to my apartment, so I will probably end up coming here pretty often!
The menu is nothing too surprising. Standard italian selection of pastas and pizzas. I think their gnocchi is their signature dish.. will try it out the next time I come here.
Ate some vodka-sauce pasta with garlic bread.. pretty good.. no complaints.
They take good care of you making sure you like everything.. Nice place to come with a bunch of friends (or a date!).. Not expensive but with a classy feel.
author: Aditya M.

description: My girl friend took me here for dinner on my birthday, the food and service are so amazing ... I h
author: Love L.

description: Nice cafe to stop by after visiting the cathedral or the park. They can customize any of their items to fit your dietary needs. I had spaghetti with tomato, garlic and basil and it was very flavorful. They also have a few booster seats and a highchair.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Lasagna was excellent but my wife won with the carbonara pasta. 
Great service and atmosphere.  Bottle of Masi 2007 Vendemmia.
author: Michael C.

description:
DISGRACEFUL SERVICE!!! SNOBBY AND RUDE!!!

My family where over visiting me and staying in a hotel in the area. I rang in advance to book a table for 7 people in the nob hill cafe. I was told they do not take bookings. I asked would it busy, is there point in walking from union square (where I live) up to the restaurant as we really wanted to try this place out. The lady on the phone said they would not be busy and that they would be able to seat my group but there may be a little bit of a wait. Taking her word for it, we walked up and put our names down on the waiting list with the hostess. We were told there would be a wait of 45minutes so we asked would it be ok to have a drink in a hotel nearby as it was a cold day and sitting outside would be uncomfortable we were reassured that would be fine to wander off as there would be at least a 40 minute wait before they sat anyone. 30 minutes later and starving, my group of 7 and I arrived back at the restaurant to be told we would not be seated and that we had missed our place in line??!!! I then saw that the RUDE hostess had seated almost 8/9 people after telling my group there would be nothing available for at least 45mintues and wrongfully telling us that we could have a drink and wait? The hostess had a very rotten attitude. We were then stranded with a group of 7 and no reservation. By this time it was almost 9.30 pm! I would highly advise people not go here. If a restaurant doesn't care about how they treat potential customers, I feel it is a place worth forgetting.....my parents and my group were very disappointed and this hiccup ruined what could have been a perfect reunion dinner!!!
author: Lynne B.

description:
I was craving pasta more than ever so I yelped a place in nob hill that would satisfy my needs. I went on a Monday at around 2:30 PM, right before lunch closes (at 3). I ordered this penne pasta with a vodka sauce, with a little hint of spiciness to it. I highly recommend it! 

The waiter was so helpful when I was stuck between choosing 2 items. He told me to choose the penne without a doubt, and what a great choice that was.

The prices are really reasonable. For the portion size that can be 2 meals for an average person, the total came to about $13 which included bread before the meal was served and immediate water refills.

This is a cute date place or just a place to go out with some friends. I will definitely be back! 

(They also take AmEx which makes me really happy)
author: Kailey O.

description:
I walk by this place all the time as I live in the neighborhood and the scents of garlic  finally pulled us in to the restaurant a few months ago after several years of living in the area.

We had gotten take out a few years ago (night of the Obama election) and it was seriously sub par. If I remember correct, they got the order wrong and the food wasn't particularly warm or flavorful. 

Fast-forward to 2011...
You should expect to wait at this place. Fortunately they have an OK system where they'll let you hang out outside and serve you wine. Unfortunately for us, though, they completely mis-judged how long it'd be before our table was ready and we waited much longer than we were told.

The bread was fine but came with a giant pile of pre-wrapped butter pats. Didn't seem to fit with how the restaurant tries to present itself, but ok...

My husband got a special: the sweet potato gnocchi. After eating store bough gnocchi, this tasted pretty good, but we've had better elsewhere. And, it didn't taste at all like sweet potato!

I was seriously in need of vegetables so I doubled up on salad and got both the Insalata Mista and Melanzane. The mista was nothing special (are they ever?) and mostly just lettuce. The Melanzane, however, was AWESOME. That alone might get 5 stars.

I don't remember anything particularly great or sub-par about the service.
author: Sydney L.

description: Cute place, super tiny. Don't bring more than 4 people or you will never fit in here. Food is amazing, we had the clam pasta and gnocci. Our waitress was hilarious and joked with us all night. Be prepared to wait outside for a table as there isn't enough room inside.
author: Mila G.

description:
Disclaimer: I was raised in new york where great italian food is everywhere. 

Cute little neighborhood place. The food is decent and well priced, but I expected better based on the reviews. I had the carpaccio and the chicken parm. The carpaccio was tasty but lacked arugula, and the chicken parmesan was a chicken parmesan and not a parmigiano, it had a low quality cheese and the chicken was overdone. Sauce was ok. Sangiovese was average.  The excellent service almost bumps it up to 4, but not quite. If I had one sentence to describe this place, it would Olive Garden food with a Nob Hill ambiance. I would come back based on the price and the service.
author: Ken W.

description:
Went last night because we were in the area.

great little place to eat with a classic Italian feel to it.

Had the gnocchi and enjoyed it.

My date had the vodka sauce pasta which she has had before and still enjoys.

Can't remember the wine but both glasses were good.

We'll definitely be back for the service, the atmosphere, and the location.

No reservations, but I don't care we didn't have to wait too long on a Tuesday night.
author: Nathan D.

description: Wonderful meal is a cozy neighborhood restaurant...the seasonal special butternut squash soup and especially the gnocchi were wonderful...neither too heavy! The gelato layered chocolate dessert is the best.
author: Laura C.

description: Hesitant to give 5 stars, as that might add to the popularity. The only bad thing is that the place is popular and doesn't take reservations. Excellent food and service.
author: A C.

description: This place is the best, hands down. Gnocchi bolognese, pesto pasta, great wines, extra wonderful warm bread, and the nicest friendliest servers and chef you could ask for. Go here. You will love everything about this neighborhood spot, off the beaten path.
author: Ed H.

description:
I've heard great things (and read great reviews) about Nob Hill Café. There is always a line of patrons waiting for a table (no reservations-yikes). Since the BF and I were staying at the Huntington Hotel, we walked over to the Nob Hill Café around 7pm for dinner. The wait was about 15 mins which went by fast since the hostess offers you a drink while you wait. Awesome. Inside there are 2 dining rooms but still a small area. We were seated at a super small table. We shared the brushetta and a salad. Both were so-so. Not the best and not the worst. I chose to have the Linguine Vongole while the BF had the pistavchio encrusted mahi mahi special. My lingine was a bit too "lemon-y". They must have overdid it with the lemon juice or something because that was all I tasted. The BF's dish was a lot better. Tasted more healthy and fresh. The mahi mahi came with a side of rice with asparagus tossed in. I should have gotten that instead because it was yummy. The service is a bit strange here. Not that he didn't pay attention to us but it seemed like there was only 1 waiter for the entire joint. I also felt like we were rushed. Everything was given super quickly. But I guess with that line outside, they need to get you in and out. 

Not sure if the wait was worth it but maybe I'll have to try it again to really tell whether I like it or not.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Before I dig into Nob Hill Café, my rating has nothing to do with their food, because they didn't give me a chance to taste it.   One of my friends recommended me to Nob Hill Café for my birthday so we drove from Palo Alto , looked for parking for 30 mins, and finally made it. Well, they have outdoor seating BUT DONT SERVE FOOD OUTSIDE.  ARE YOU KIDDING? They serve alcohol, but NOT food. A "café" that has outdoor seating but doesn't serve food outside, in San Francisco, is ABSURD. 

I had my dog with me and 5 of my family members and they would not make an exception for us. We left and will never ever try Nob Hill Café again. They were extremely rude to us about the whole situation and lost out on about $500.00. 

The cherry on top? I called the day before to ask about outdoor seating, and they said yes, but never mentioned they don't serve food outside. 

FAIL.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Caveat: I haven't actually had a meal AT Nob Hill Cafe in years, but the take out? Boy is that something. 

My uncles live a few blocks from Nob Hill Cafe, and when we're pressed for time, take out is always the best option. Here's what I recommend splitting:

Caesar Salad - One of the best caesars I've had, though you may want to ask for a little extra parmesan. Super fresh lettuce chopped to the right size, divine dressing, and freshly grilled boneless skinless chicken breast. These salads are big, and can either constitute an entire meal or should be split between a few people.

Carbonara, with penne instead of spaghetti - This isn't exactly a real carbonara because it's laden with cream, but it's got the perfect amount of porcini and it's just too good to resist. I'd recommend sharing this as well as it's a LOT of cream for one person. Yum yum yum
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Had a lovely romantic date with my other half here. We are in San Fran on vacation and were craving good Italian, saw this place on Yelp (a few blocks from our hotel) and went to check it out. The place was packed (on a Monday!) but we only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated. The bread they served us was great - we asked for olive oil with it and were rewarded with very good EVOO. 

We shared the insalata caprese appetizer - the buffalo mozzerella was incredible, super creamy and just perfect. This salad didn't need the balsamic and raw onions they threw on top of it, a dash of good extra virgin would have been so much better. 

My date had the sole which came with buttery pasta and green beans, a HUGE plate even for dinner. I wanted to try the homemade gnocchi so I asked our server for her opinion on sauces, and she recommended the pesto, which was a great call... SO decadent. The gnocchi was perfect, pillowy and melt in your mouth smooth, my goodness. 

The portions were huge; I took home a box of my pasta that will suffice for lunch and more. This place was just what we were looking for!
author: Danielle S.

description: They don't take reservations but the wait was well worth it.  We order the pesto gnocchi special and gnocchi Bolognese.  Warm bread was served while we waited for our entrees. the wait seemed a bit long but the waitress apologized for the wait as she delivered the lovely gnocchi and grated fresh cheese.  To our surprise she came back a minute later and topped off our wines, gratis, and apologized again for the wait.
author: Cathy C.

description: Cute place with good food -- very honey ambiance with quality comfort food.  We tried the braised short ribs with broccolini and garlic mash and their burger. Both were fresh and delicious!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
What a cute little place for you and a special friend.  Very comfortable with friendly service and really fresh and tasty food.

One of the few places I would frequent.  I think it's going to become one of our favorites.
author: Mikal B.

description:
My spouse and I have eaten here several times (we used to live within walking distance). I usually order the same thing. Tortellini Alfredo. It is delicious.

Pros. Ambiance. Tortellini. Chocolate ganache. Very excellent wait staff, and table service. The sidewalk waiting area is big enough to practice a short tai chi form.

Cons. Depending on what time you come, the place is completely packed, with long to very long wait times. The place is small when it's empty. When fully seated, it's very cramped. 

Space is clearly at a premium here, but they probably need the money from maximizing seating space. If you are waiting outside, the wind will rip down Taylor Street after sunset. I've seen a lot of women and sometimes men dressed very thinly, suffering during their wait. Bring a scarf.

Pro-Con. If you order drinks and side dishes, your bill can get pricey, quickly. The price does mean that mostly only reasonably well-off people can afford it. This means dinner is usually pleasant. People are polite, even when the place is packed. I've never seen anyone's kids act-up here.
author: Jane A.

description:
Kudos for getting a large group in RIGHT before closing.

Kudos for getting our orders in and served all around the same time.

Kudos for the pesto garlic bread.  That was delicious!

Minus points for the lack of flavor on the creamy pesto pasta.  I was very, very disappointed.

Minus for the overly lemony clam linguini.  All I tasted was lemon.  I didn't taste garlic, salt or even clams... just...lemon.  It wasn't bad but it wasn't what I was looking for when ordering that dish.

Minus points for not paying attention to when it came down to processing our bill.

We were at 2 different tables so we asked the server to charge us per table (seems reasonable)

They did just that.  I paid an amount with a card, we laid down some cash and wrote "remaining balance" for the other card.  

Now, because we came in as a large group, we were charged 20% gratuity... which means... tip was already added.

Not sure where the mix up was but the server took the cash, charged my card the amount I requested and then charged the rest of the amount onto the other card without subtracting the cash that was laid out.  I'm assuming she thought it was an 'extra' tip.   

No... bueno... 

We got it taken care of but if there was some confusion, then asking questions is appropriate.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
As an Italian food enthusiast, I so wanted to be blown away by this place, as I've heard such great things.  I'm wondering if we went on an off night.  Most dishes were VERY heavy--dripping in cream and butter.

I had the eggplant with roasted tomatoes and feta salad--very good, but nothing special.  The linguine vongole (my favorite pasta meal) was disappointing.  No fresh clams in the shell to add to the presentation, making me question whether the clams or fresh or canned.  The flavor of the sauce was strangely sour and it was creamy vs. white wine based that seems more traditional.  The sauce was not my favorite and the clams and noodles seemed a tad overcooked.  

My friend had the baked polenta and it didn't taste as flavorful and it looked.  The texture was harder than other polenta I've had.  She had the carbonara pasta and it was delicious!  So flavorful.  Very rich though (as expected).  My other friend had the sole and asked them to not use the butter sauce, but her meal came out swimming in butter and/or cream. 

I may try this place again just because so many rave about it and the prices are reasonable.  Hoping it was just an off night ...
author: Caitlin T.

description:
I visited this restuarant for lunch on Sunday.  They had both a brunch and a separate lunch menu.  I chose the lunch menu and ordered chicken parmigiana.  The food was good, definitely above average.  The service was very good and there are many good things I could say about my waiter; unfortunately, friendly is not one of them.  
I will probably return as there are a few item on there menu that I would still like to try.
author: Richard L.

description:
Really nice, cozy atmosphere. Not at all crowded on a cloudy Monday afternoon. I had the angel hair with garlic, tomato and basil, and it was mild and delicious. Wasn't too hot to eat when I got it so I dug in, and the portion size was really reasonable and not overhelming (I have a small stomach)

The service was speedy enough and mostly polite. My waitress put my napkin on my lap for me--I'm not sure if that was rude or charming, so I'll just go with charming :)
author: Arman D.

description:
Pros: cute ambiance. The gnocchi bolognese was good, but rich. Pesto tortellini was good too. Wine was good also. Friendly staff.

Cons: small restaurant, we were seated by the loud kitchen. The bruschetta was kind of bland.

Overall, I'd definately go back.
author: Kay K.

description: Red wine.pizza.Goes crunch after cheese situation resolved.dissolves in mouth.dream like state occurs after. yum.
author: Kirsten V.

description:
Though the food continues not to disappoint, the service, the attitude, the atmosphere they then create is pushing me not to go back.  

Tried a couple of the pasta dishes on the chalk board last night, great sauces, perfectly seasoned, fun specials!

It's in the neighborhood, the meals are tasty, but I think I'll only go there with people who have already been; it's embarrassing bringing new friends here and then when the grumpy waiter and the frazzled hostess are snippy, explain to them that yeah, that's actually to be expected.
author: Janelle C.

description:
Have been wanting to try this place for a while.  I live 3 blocks from here & passed it when going to services at Grace Cathedral.  

Came here with my family & was seated quickly.  No table seating until your party is complete!

We were greeted quickly.  We ordered a salad that was fresh with a light lemon dressing.  Really nice!

For entrees - seafood pasta (special) was good.  Not great.  Gnocchi was good.  Linguine Alla Vongole, canned clams used, but still very good.  Sauce was light with garlic & lemon juice.  Bit of butter.  

Food came fast.  Service was great.  Can't wait to come back!!  Nice dining experience.
author: Kendall R.

description: This is a 3 star restaurant at 4 star prices; probably because the location is so favorable.  I ordered some dish reportedly to have lobster in it... but tasted nor saw lobster... maybe it crawled out... I don' t know.  It was served in a bowl that normally I'd expect to eat boiled oats meal from.  A nice bowl - but not really what I had in mind when I ordered this $19 dish.  When I was done, I wasn't craving more.  I won't be returning to this place.  Life is too short and SF has so many great places to eat.  (I'm always on the hunt.)
author: Steve S.

description:
Definitely a cute, little restaurant. The delicious smells hit you as soon as you enter the restaurant. While the food was ok, the aromas seemed to be way better (although, who knows, maybe we ordered the wrong items).

Overall the food and wine left you wondering where some of the flavor had gone.
author: Rachel R.

description:
I called in an order from here last Saturday night (10/22) for my girlfriend

- Pesto Gnocchi 
- Antipasto Salad 
- Vegetable soup 

It was pretty busy when I arrived so I tried to get in and out as quickly as possible

After walking the mile to her house, I started emptying the contents of the bag, SURPRISE! Gnocchi Bolognese! 

When I called the restaurant back to tell them about it, the hostess sounded like she didn't give a shit, can't blame her but come on... I just paid 40$ for a wrong order. At least pretend that I'll get a credit some day. I know it will never materialize, but its nice to offer as a form of apology. Nope. Then she goes on to tell me that I have to ASK for an itemized receipt? That sounds like some bullshit to me. You shouldn't have to ask for an itemized receipt when forking over forty bucks for takeout. 

 The food wasn't that good. The gnocchi was spongy and slimy, the sauce tasted like Prego. The salad was alright, not amazing. The soup was a couple notches above a can of Progresso. 

So lets recap 

   - overpriced 
   - rude hostess (whoever works Sat nights)  
   - subpar food

Sad Face, save your cash
author: Carson L.

description: Sweet cafe for brunch, lunch, or dinner. The brunch menu is great! We started with the polenta appetizer last time we were there and loved it. It can be a little touristy but still really nice with great service.
author: Olivia M.

description:
I love this place!  It is quaint and cozy!  The food is delicious and fairly reasonably priced. Portion are pretty big. Very consistent food and a warm, casual atmosphere make this a wonderful Nob Hill staple.

I like sitting in the green room vs. the room in the front since it is more spacious.  The service is good to.  If you have to wait for a table, they let you drink wine outside while you wait.  The only negative thing I have to say....they don't take reservations!  But the wait is worth it for this delicious food!
author: Anthony V.

description:
This. Place. Is. Delicious. 

Came here with a few friends, and they were very accommodating to seat us all together despite the restaurant being a bit small.

The best Italian food I've had in San Francisco, hands down.
author: Lauren F.

description: Updating my review as I've had 2 negative experiences in the past week. I live 5 mins from nob hill cafe so I go often. The food is really good, I've only had one disappointing meal which as the French toast. My family are visiting for the holidays and I wanted to bring them here for brunch. They held on for a late breakfast because I knew it didn't open until 11am, we got there at 10.50 and waited outside, no problem. My dad walked up to the park whilst we were waiting. Just after 11, they opened the doors to let us in, great. Party of 5 the lady said, we said there's one more just at the park coming now. The response was, we can't seat you until everyone is here, you'll have to wait back outside. The place was empty, not one sinner, we went somewhere else out of principle and I won't be back or recommending to friends/visitors!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Overall this place was great. It was a Saturday night and our wait was estimated to be 30 minutes. It didn't turn out to be 45 minutes. Just before we got sat we could see a couple inside ask to be moved from a two top right at the door (def the worst table in the place) and we got sat there. Since the host is then working right over your shoulder we asked to be moved which took a few extra mins. Once we did get seated it was perfect. The Pinot noir by the glass was great and so was the bread. We ordered the gnocchi and penne...both were delicious. Great portions and location. Hopefully they could work something out with that table because it's obvious to most it's drawbacks.  Get there early.
author: Anthony R.

description: This is a great little restaurant at the top of Nob Hill.  I had the spaghetti carbonara at the suggestion of my waitress.  The pasta was more al dente than in most American restaurants but certainly not like Europe.  The sourdough bread was also great.  My friends had pizzas and they loved them.  It was nice to go to a restaurant on Nob Hill where I did not have to walk up the steep Hill!  The staff had very good attention to detail.  It is nice to see a little local restaurant and not one of the chains or franchises.
author: Thomas W.

description: Great little place, but there was  Fantastic parking, horrible food and terrible service...Just kidding. Just the opposite of course. Get there early to minimize the wait, although, they create the  food very promptly and have about a 45 minute table turn over. We had Caprese, vegetable soup, pizza, and veal picatta. Nice wine list and very friendly service.Very reasonable prices. Only problem was that the service was so quick as to make the  tempo a bit rushed. We were hardly done with appetizers when our entries came out. We got there at 5:20 and had immediate seating. By 5:45 the place was full and people were waiting outside. Let's just say that as we left, the waiting people were happy.
author: Mo B.

description: Portions are quite large and I would definitely consider splitting a main with someone next time.  Be sure to order the gelato, as it is served atop a thin layer of cheesecake.  Overall a nice neighborhood spot, but nothing stellar.
author: Clara H.

description:
The best part about this visit to Nob Hill Cafe was a sighting of the San Francisco Twins...

Everything else turned out to be kind of a flop. Which is unfortunately considering how quaint and cute the place is as well as how close it is to my abode. I ordered the clam linguine and was really not impressed by the quality. It pretty much tasted like every other clam linguine I had ever had and there was this lingering fishy/lemony taste after every bite that made me cringe.

My friends ordered a prosciutto pizza which was pretty good - the cheese was flavorful and the crust had a really good balance of smokey taste.
If you come here I would recommend you try the pizza - it seems like there's a good amount of goodies that you can pile on to add layer and layers of sophisticated flavors. 

Also, you might want to consider elsewhere if it's a rainy night. Waiting outside with rain water dripping into your drink is not the best way to start of a night.
author: Christina L.

description: Yummmm!  Just ordered salads and split a pizza for lunch. Great flavor sauce and nice crust. Will be back for dinner
author: Kristyn D.

description: I'm all about customer service and when it comes to the Nob Hill Cafe, I was certainly not pleased. We came here for a Father's Day brunch. There were plenty of open tables and it wasn't busy at all. It was about 15 minutes before someone acknowledged us. We were seated inside then when some seating opened up outside, we asked if we could move. The man rudely sighed and said, "well if you must." Already I was pretty upset. Then it took 10 minutes for them to give us our menus. Once we finally ordered, we waited about 45 minutes for our food. Then another 15 minutes for our check. The food is definitely not worth this kind of wait and I'm not at all happy about our experience here. My advice to the waiters and waitresses, SMILE
author: Sophia L.

description: Cute old school spot that serves the tastiest carbonara. Went twice in a week it was so stellar.
author: Daanesh C.

description: Cozy restaurant, friendly staff, and good food. The waiting staff was very attentive, even on a very busy night. The pizza was flavorful, except for the soggy crust. The lasagna was on point. The gnocchi was pretty tasty.
author: Tuan N.

description: OMG!  The lasagna was OUTSTANDING!  I have even searching for a gem like this place since we moved to San Francisco from Chicago (where great Italian is plentiful). This little restaurant off the beaten path is well worth the trip and the wait!  Allison was a fantastic server and the whole experience was fab. Highly recommend!
author: Marcos L.

description: I got the pasta with spicy cream tomato  sauce and added sausage. SO GOOD!   My friend got gnocchi, amazing. The service was great. Katrina* was so sweet and great with checking in on us. Very small and intimate setting.
author: Cara C.

description:
We walked up as a table for two on a Friday night. We got put on the list, and the hostess was great. She sat us outside to wait, got us some drinks, and was super friendly and personable. After about 20 minutes, we had a small table in a comically tiny nook near the kitchen. Good thing I love sitting really close to the table. 

I ordered the chicken parmesan, which was good, really. BUT, my boyfriend ordered the special: farfalle with shrimp, salmon, and calamari in a lobster bisque sauce. After tasting his dish, I spent the rest of my meal looking disappointedly at my plate while stealing as much off his plate as possible. After that, I was so stuffed that I couldn't possibly eat another bite, except half of an awesome tiramisu. 

My only complaint? Our waiter was off-puttingly brusque. I waited tables for many years, and there's an art to being busy but not making your tables feel like they're bothering you. He didn't have it down, and we barely saw him. However, the service was still good as the bussers kept our table clear and our waters filled, and the kitchen did everything right. You should go here.
author: Kristin D.

description: My wife and I ate here for lunch this past  Thursday after picking up our marriage license from city hall. We decided to share, as we often do. After all sharing means caring. We ordered the special pesto spinach gnocchi with this amazing lemon sauce over it, and the carbonara.....AMAZING!!!!! I loved the lemon sauce and the carbonara was awesome! Very happy. Love that you can sit outside.Our server was great, she was a rad irish woman who knew how to "irish pour" my wifes wine. This will for sure be our go to place next time we are craving a nice italian lunch in the city.
author: JackieandAngel H.

description:
I definitely need to try more dishes here but from my experience it's just okay.

very small cramped and crowded.

laaarge portions, but you pay for that as well $$$
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday September 28, 2008 @ 12pm
Company:  Michael & Jack
Crowd:  Well-Heeled "Snob Hill" Peeps of All Ages- The Older Set in   Hermes & Wilkes Bashford, The Younger Set in Tory Burch & Brooks Brothers & The Young Children in BonPoint
Vibe:  Low-Key
Decor:  Hunter-Green Mirrored Walls.  Dark Wood Tables for Deux & Quatre.  Outdoor Green Marbled Tables where the Server Lays Out White Table Cloths for Deux & Trois
Service:  Snails Pace
Imbibe:  Wine
Devour:  Andouille Sausage
Skip:  Salmon Scramble & French Toast(Hard as A Rock).  Brunch Menu Consisted of All Omelettes & Scrambles:0
Total:  $33.75
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Some clients of mine were in SF from out of town and were staying at the Fairmont and so we decided to give this place a try.  When you see all the locals waiting for a seat you know this has to be good.  Sure enough, 1.5 hours later, we got seated.  FANTASTIC!  The service once we were seated was great, and even thought they were slammed everything went really fast and our food came piping hot. Recommend, carbonera, pesto, gnocchi. Wow. Great wine selection, too.
author: Dario L.

description:
I came  here for lunch today around 3pm, just on a whim because I was in the neighbourhood. The cafe is really small and quaint, which is okay, but I can't imagine this would be much fun during the busy hours. 

One side of the cafe was completely packed and the other side had two people in it. I was seated immediately. 

The waiter/host that seated me was polite but very curt. I have a feeling that it may have something to do with my appearance (I ride a scooter and tend to layer up, so I can look kinda like a hobo sometimes). Despite my smile and friendly demeanor, I received the least amount of hospitality deemed necessary without being outright rude. 

I ordered the Angus Beef Carpaccio and a soy latte. The prices are reasonable, and the food presentation was favorably executed. The latte was one of the better ones that I have had in recent memory. 

The decor was pleasant, although I felt cramped. I felt that they were trying to capitalize by cramming as many tables into their tiny little space as legally acceptable (yet I still would NOT want to be in there if a fire should break out). 

The food at this place was very good, my only issue was with the service. Not once did anyone ask how the food was or see if I needed anything. There were so many staff members walking past that I only had but to reach out and ask one if I needed anything, but I kind of feel that someone should at LEAST check on a patron ONCE during the course of the meal, even if it's just a little meal and not a HUGE ticket. 

By the time I got my ticket, I don't think the waiter was even capable of smiling, even when I smiled and said thank you. I wouldn't mind eating here again, just to try something different on their scaled-down menu, but I don't think I'll be going out of my way to go here any time soon.
author: Eyva Kid C.

description: This sweet little cafe is just wonderful! The atmosphere is excellent and the food was delicious. My husband and I had ceasar salads, a calzone to split, and the dessert- tiramisu and the gelato cheesecake. Killer food- good friendly service.
author: Steph P.

description:
Just blocks from my homeshed, it's difficult not to like this place. Came here for lunch and split the Caesar salad, polenta appetizer (a bit over-salted) and penne special featuring chicken and crimini, porcini and shitake mushrooms. They made it easy for us to share the dishes by dividing both the salad and the pasta into separate bowls. 

While the food was not earth-shatteringly good, it was solid. Service was attentive and friendly - plenty of fresh cheese and ground pepper at the ready!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Long story short, we had to wait a REALLY long time outside and a REALLY long time to get our food, despite telling them we were in a hurry and that they said they could accommodate our rushed schedule without a problem.

We met friends who were going to a show at 9:30. We arrived at 7:30 and were told the wait was 30 minutes which we thought was no problem (we knew the place didn't take reservations).  We ended up waiting outside for 1 hr 15 mins to sit at 8:45.  We sit and immediately order, explaining that our friends need to leave by 9:20.  They said, no problem, they could easily get our food to us with time for them to leave by then.  At 9:20 our food hadn't come yet, so we had to get theirs to go... and they didn't even apologize -- they said, "Oh, you guys got stuck behind a to-go order."  

Funny thing was we saw the people ordering to-go, and it came in AFTER we sat down and ordered -- it was totally their fault for putting the order ahead of us, ESPECIALLY when we explained we were in a hurry because of THEIR poor estimation of the wait for us to be seated.  The whole problem would have been solved if they just told us in advance that the wait was going to be over an hour, then we could have gone elsewhere.  On top of that, we were parked in a parking garage, so we had to pay for an extra hour of parking!  Grr

Food was average italian food, with large portions.
author: J R.

description:
I found this place via Foursquare recommendation after some time at the nearby Grace Cathedral.  I was along at the time and didn't have reading material, but made a note to return next time I was in the city.

I wish I had had dinner that night, though, even if I just sat there with nothing to do but eat..

Finally visited with a friend a month after first finding this place and had a meal.  Service was excellent and friendly.  The cafe is family owned and they do a great job of welcoming their guests not just to their cafe, but to a place they've built as much as any home.  The hostess and waiters all spent time conversing with us despite a very busy evening.

The establishment isn't huge, so if there's a crowd, it can feel like there's a crowd there.  However, it didn't feel packed.  Rather it felt like a number of like-minded people just out for a good meal that happened to end up at the same place.

The food was also excellent.  Well-prepared, good presentation, and delicious.  Can you ask for anything more?  Maybe, but in my book, this is more than enough.
author: Robert Y.

description:
Got here around 7PM and there was a 30 minute wait.  The food smelt so good that it was unbearable to stand outside in the cold.  Good thing we were able to order drinks while waiting. 

I was pretty excited about trying this place but was not blown away.  For app, we had the Insalata Caprese which included fresh mozzarella, roma tomatoes, onions, basil and we added prosciutto.  Good & fresh but nothing out of the ordinary. 

For the main dish, the boy and I split the Gnocchi Bolognese.  Once again, it was good but nothing special.  

Was it worth the wait?  Not in my opinion.  Would I go back?  Probably not.   Overall it was an average experience.
author: Nho C.

description:
The ambience and the service right off the bat was so amazing! The lady was so helpful and gave her genuine opinion on the best tasting things on the menu. Her judgement was correct!

We ordered the pesto tortellini, which was so rich and simply decadent. We finished off with the chocolate mousse?? but it was pure and rich as well and we left so content after this sitting. The bread as well they offered was warm and good quality.
author: Gunter L.

description: I like this place. The food is good & a great price, the staff is super friendly so the service is great, and it's got a cute little neighborhood vibe. The gnocchi is definitely the most delicious thing on the menu - so good!
author: Gillian M.

description: It was hot as balls in the resto, but the food (save the caprese salad - tomatoes with zero flavor) was pretty tasty. I had the gnocchi Bolognese, which was pretty good. Not really looking to re-visit, though.
author: Holly R.

description: Veal Piccata. Sooooo gooood! This place is really nice. great things come in small packages. Waiting for a seat is gonna be expected as the wait (up to 30min) is well worth it. The service is great, they are so nice and work real hard. The portion sizes are real generous. Ill definitely make my way back when i come back to the bay area.
author: Ray P.

description:
Fantastic!  We took my cousin and her husband (who are from out of town) there just last night.  The place was bustling!  The service was excellent.  The hostess was very friendly and on top of things.  Our waitress was super nice and more than efficient.

The food was excellent.  We all enjoyed our dishes immensely.  We will definitely go back.
author: Scott B.

description: You feel like you are in tucked away in a cozy Upper Eastside  eatery that only you and a few friends know about.....yes you have to give your name and wait but generally you enjoy the wait at a sidewalk table surrounded by Edwardian flats while you sip a glass of wine. Once inside, the place always exudes a calm energy and diners look content and engaged in both their food and conversation. I would recommend Linguine and clams, Pasta carbonara and pasta in vodka sauce. Just clean, honest food that comes out piping hot...and if you like Italian reds..they have a nice Primativo.!!
author: Carl K.

description: Nob hill cafe is a small upper class restaurant in nob hill. There food is delicious, there dining is small but very sheik, reminds me of Europe. I get takeout most the time because I live down the street. Most the people there are kind and outgoing, but I have had 2 occasions were the staff has been very snobby and short; even at take out. There very busy so plan to wait at least 20min for a table but its in a very nice neighborhood.
author: Dara S.

description: This is a small restaurant, and we arrived at 8:30 with 9 people and were told the wait ould be an hour. Don't know what changed but they got us in all at one table in 15 minutes. We had a great time, the service was good as if we had been only two or 3 people. Had the gnocchi bolonese, the gnocchi were good, but the sauce was wonderful. Carbonara was very good too. Just be aware there could be a wait (we were lucky, thanks to the staff!)
author: Kirk H.

description:
We had a pleasant enough evening with our longtime friends here last  Tuesday. We arrived exactly at 5:00 p.m. just as it opened, and while I parked the car nearby the lady in charge refused to seat the couple until I arrived -- mind you our couple sharing the table were 83 and 69, and my wife is 71.  They stood amongst the empty table until I arrived, and only then would they seat us.  Hmmmmm? 
I went to this place when it was a small dinner over 55 years ago when it was a slimmed down beanery for the neighborhood.  It is upscale now, and Italian, but looking at the chefs, who were lined up in the open kitchen with a counter as you enter, not one appeared to be Italian.  Oh well, the food was good but not great. I had the veal piccata and it was a huge piece of not tender veal -- not pounded thin, and a little tough.  Hmmm.  The service was excellent though, and the waitress took all of our orders by memory -- good trick.  The noise level was great though and it was difficult to hear across the table with the din.  The price for two was over $120 with the house wine -- which was nothing special.  So I would actually give this a lower grade but the ambiance redeems it.
author: Bill L.

description: super lunch. Fast friendly service. Good food. Pizza was perfect and the caesar salad was awesome! The perfect amount of 'fishy' flavor. Garlicy and light! Loved it. Can see if it was busy may be a little on the slow side, especially if you were already impatient! A good little lunch find.
author: Graham Y.

description: My favorite restaurant in all time when I lived in the city. There's always a wait, but we would grab a tall can or a bottle of wine from the corner store and drink it at grace cathedral park while waiting. So quissential sf- a total local spot - I miss it. Linguine and clams and the margherita pizza.
author: Megan R.

description: I'm a kind of bias writing this review as I have almost become a part of this cafe. This cafe is one of the best here in San Francisco. The food is delicious, the service is friendly and the location is just perfect - almost secret.
author: Toke K.

description: Had the Gnocchi Bolognese, pretty pricey think it was 17$.  Service is good but honestly I have no clue why this place is still around.  Food is underwhelming at best.  Definitely not worth a return visit unless you live close by, have money to blow and too lazy to go elsewhere.
author: Teck L.

description: Had a really delicious mixed greens roasted beet salad then a custom, choose your topping, pizza. Service was very friendly. Returned the next for lunch and yummy pasta. I definitely recommend.
author: Shannon C.

description: This is a cozy neighborhood restaurant with a small menu of simple, well-done Italian dishes. I had the special, mushroom ravioli with Brie and Gorgonzola fondue sauce, and my husband had the spaghetti carbonara. Both were very good, as was the creme caramel for dessert. This is perfect for a satisfying, unpretentious Italian meal.  We did wait nearly an hour, so will make reservations next time we go back. But we'll definitely be back.
author: Stacy R.

description: We came here for dinner on a Tuesday night having read great reviews on Yelp and it was packed! That's always the sign of a great place to dine. We were seated promptly (there were 3 of us) and served quickly. The menu choice is pretty good with a selection of pizzas, pastas, appetizers and salads. We ordered an antipasti plate for 2, carpaccio, mixed green salad and a pepperoni and olive pizza for our 6 year old. Well, the carpaccio was amazing, melt in your mouth deliciousness! The salad was super fresh and the dressing tangy and tasty and not overpowering. The pizza was tasty if not a little salty and the crust was just the right texture. Our server Eamon (Irish gentleman) was just lovely and as we are from Scotland it was so nice to hear a familiar neighbourly accent!! I would definitely recommend this place and will come here again next time we're in SF.
author: Joanne B.

description:
We came across Nob Hill Café on a Yelp search for an Italian dinner.  Every bit of food that came to our table was delicious!  They brought out a bread basket first, which included some really lovely, soft rosemary bread.  Among our group, the entrees were: baked lasagna, linguine pesto, eggplant parmesan and white clam pasta.  Each entrée was thoroughly enjoyed.  The marinara sauce had a wonderful flavor and the pasta was perfectly al dente.  We each ordered off the menu, but there were about 3 specials that evening, all of which sounded delicious.

The space is small, so if you're at prime meal time, be prepared to wait.  However, the size makes for a cozy and quaint atmosphere.  The food was reasonably priced... OK, in California terms, I would call it inexpensive.  :-)

If you're driving, trying to find a parking spot can be a nightmare.  I'm sure San Franciscans are aware of this, but if you're a tourist and you're going for dinner on a weekend, prepare yourself to drive around for at least 30 minutes (unless you're lucky), or just shell out for a spot in a nearby parking garage.  The food is really lovely though, so I'd say it's worth it!
author: Cara B.

description:
Adorable neighborhood spot in nob hill.  Waiter was very good and told us around for 25 years which i highly appreciate in SF.

Service - great.  Ambiance - cozy, def an older crowd so good spot if your folks are in town. Food - had the chicken Parmesan and most of the menu looked pretty standard.  Great if you are avoiding the foodie menus of SF.  In short, it was chicken on top of penne with a tomato sauce and baked with cheese.  Good place if you want something cozy and basic. 

Great wine - starter bread basket always good and eggplant salad was good, but eggplant could have been warmed.
author: Sarah G.

description:
I've eaten here 4 times in 4 days. Everything I've had has been good to great. Very, very happy with this find.

Gnocchi is fabulous. Linguine w/clams, good. Vegetable soup, superb. Calamari salad, really good. Salad w/beets & gorgonzola, terrific.
author: Sdtjm S.

description:
Very nice place. Its small and we were there on a Tuesday night. I can't imagine how busy it is on the weekend. The menu is short but there are plenty of options. The caprese salad was good but not memorable. The tiramisu was better than most, very light and fresh. But the highlight for me was the eggplant Parmesan. It wasn't fried eggplant covered in cheese. It was eggplant over penne covered in sauce and cheese and baked in a crock. It was a nice twist, and the best I've ever had.

It is a small place, and the tables are right on top of each other. There is not a lot of room to spread out. But the service was nice and helped to make up for that.
author: Jamie F.

description:
My fiance and I come here often and have had a good experience every time. Having said I know the italian server Cathy M is talking about, I think we had him once and yes his service was not good. He looked liked he hated what he was doing and more so because he was having to serve people that he considered not as superior as himself!

We like the server Olena, she is a dark haired woman and she always serves everyone with a big smile.

My fiance always gets the Chicken breast in red sauce and loves it!

Food wise there is very little variety and also the tables are small and crammed but some how we have always end up having a good time here so the 4 stars!
author: Mandy K.

description: This place had great service & great ambience.  Otherwise I would have given it one star.  The food was awful.  We ordered the caprese salad and the pasta with tomato, garlic & basil. The caprese salad was ok.  The pasta was really lacking. I read a previous review that said it was very Americanized Italian food ..and I completely agree.  The pasta was overcooked,  they used jarred garlic rather than fresh garlic, the tomatoes were mushy & the sauce lacked flavor.  The foccacia was decent but and little sweet for my taste. I would go to North Beach for pasta instead.
author: Jacki C.

description: Everything was amazing! Fettuccini Al Pesto was to delicious! As well as the garlic bread. Wait time is usually around 20 mins but service is fast! Definitely worth the wait!
author: Tatiana T.

description: Great local place.  good pizza, great calzone, good brunch menu.  our server was was a cut above; she asked if our teen and tween eaters if the wanted the basil aka green stuff on their pizzas.  (they both said no.)  The calzone was vegetarian with spinach, roasted onions, mushrooms and half cloves of garlic and both feta and mozzarella cheese.  the crust was a perfectly baked envelope complete with a good sized bowl of  seasoned tomato sauce for dipping.  our brunch eater chose from a selection of several different omelettes and other brunch dishes.  The omelette was served with well seasoned potatoes and a muffin. our two pizza eaters enjoyed their generously sized pizzas.  if you are in the nob hill neighborhood--near Grace Cathedral, the cable car museum, and California and Mason/Powell cable car, its worth a look.
author: Erica B.

description: The carpaccio at Nob Hill was really great. I had the gnocchi bolognese as a main that was very tasty. While my boyfriend ordered the linguini vongole that was under seasoned and did not look as good as it potentially could. Our suggestion for the vongole would be to leave the pipis in their shells for presentation purposes. Atmosphere and service was good
author: Kirsty L.

description:
I miss Nob Hill and taking walks in the neighborhood, although the hills really make a relaxing stroll not-so-relaxing.  One of the places I would go uphill for is Nob Hill Cafe.  I've been there mostly for a weekend brunch or lunch, and have never been disappointed.  I recommend the omelet with andouille sausage and the sweet potato gnocchi.  The sweet potato gnocchi is not available all the time, but when it becomes a special for the day, grab it, indulge it, order some wine, and refuse to leave.

1 star off: few tables, meaning long waits
author: Ally W.

description: I've been here brunch and love the ambiance as well efficient service. It's a great date place; Conveniently located next to the hills of Nob Hill, Grace Cathedral and Hunting Park to engage in conversation and walks
author: Ulysses D.

description: Very large, very good pasta dishes!  Very reasonably priced as well.  I really enjoyed the food here and will come back at in.  I recommend this restaurant if you are looking for some nice comfort food size dishes of excellent tasting pastas.
author: Jim S.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE my Nob Hill Cafe.  This is one of the very few outlets on Nob Hill - the place oozes neighborhood and visitors alike.  I go weekly and always enjoy the staff and food.  Daily specials are good - specifically the pizzas - but they whip up a mean lasagna and spicy penne pasta.

It's also one of the few places I can find a good primativo by the glass...
author: Jimmie L.

description: I've been looking for a local place to start going to and everyone has recommended this place.  Went there for lunch and ordered the pear salad to start with fresh tasting. Then I had a margarita pizza which was pretty tasty and my friend had the pesto pasta special. I will definitely put this on my local hangout
author: Lisa B.

description:
The Nob Hill Cafe is a San Francisco tradition, especially for the well-heeled local Nob Hill residents living in multi-million dollar condos just up the Hill. 

It serves good Italian food, and most of its clients are regulars. For instance, the iconic San Francisco twins, now probably near their 80s, are seen here on a regular basis, dressed in their identical full suits, hats, blond wigs and Birkenstock sandals, circa 1960's. They go out every night to the same 5 or 6 places on the same day of the week, every week. But they like the Nob Hill Cafe so much, they come here twice a week, the only restaurant they do, on Tuesdays and Fridays.

The regulars are treated with a lot of love and attention, made to feel home, and that is why they keep coming back! 

I actually didn't eat in the restaurant, but instead, high atop the 19th floor penthouse near Clay and Jones, and enjoyed their wonderful Gnocchi pasta with friends, while overlooking the multi-million dollar view of the bay from 3 picture windows, north, east and south of Nob Hill.

All of us were to have Gnocchi, but at the last minute we changed into individualt orders, which the restaurant handled well, and everyone loved their dishes. Well constructed, perfectly cooked despite delivery, and without being overdone in cooking or flavors.

This is one place you should try at least once, just to see how the old money and the newbie wannabes of San Francisco likes to spend  their meal money.
author: Wanugee N.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  So cute inside, so comfy, and the food is all fresh and delicious.
