description: This is a good little place to eat if you're on the hill, don't want to walk too far, and would like to dine somewhere sophisticated, yet much more laid back than the fancy hotel restaurants.
author: P H I L H.

description: I went here a couple of weeks ago with some old college buddies, and we had an absolutely fabulous time.  We were greeted warmly by the hostess, and had about a 15-minute wait (totally reasonable), and got a nice little corner table in the side part of the restaurant, near the lovely upholstered windows.  We shared a couple of bottles of Pinot, some pesto garlic bread and basil/mozzarella as appetizers, and then each had some tasty entrees.  My friend's butternut squash gnocchi was particularly sinful.  Our waitress was sweet and helpful and didn't rush as at all, which I always appreciate.  The atmosphere was pleasant and intimate and good for all sorts of patrons - dates, old friends, families, etc.  It's a really nice little Nob Hill spot - not overly fancy, just good old-fashioned tasty Italian food and easygoing atmosphere.
author: Anna G.

description: We walked up here on a whim and had dinner on a Wednesday night. There wasn't a wait and everyone was friendly. The vodka sauce penne was wonderful. This restaurant is incredibly reasonably priced.
author: Carrie B.

description: Divine food. Great chef! Everything I've had here leaves me in a dreamlike food coma state. Cannot go wrong with the carpaccio cipriani and bruschetta. Their pasta is made to perfection!
author: Judy L.

description: Although this place doesn't take any reservations it is well worth the wait. This place is a neighborhood restaurant that   serves some home style Italian classics. Get the Polenta as and App and the Eggplant Parm  as an entree. The Sole that came with penne pasta was incredible as well.  I want to come back and try some their basic pastas and pizzas - 5 stars - for me!
author: Christian S.

description:
Went here for the first time last night --I've gotten 3 or 4 recommendations as a great neighborhood gem. 
I went with two really hungry people--so I got try most of the menu.
The bruschetta was delicious--as was the penne vodka and the veal.  The pizza had a perfect chewy crust with a blackened bottom just how I like it.
The chocolate ganache for dessert was simple and divine.  Will definitely come back!
author: Amy C.

description: Freshest Italian food in the city. You can see them preparing it as you enter the door. I still like Pane e Vino a little better bc of the wider variety there, but this place is a very close second. You do pay for it so be prepared.
author: Ahsan M.

description:
i live near this place and i have suffered through its meals a half dozen times, but i just can't bring myself to go back again. 

i had high hopes, because of location, but no such luck. the guests i have brought here from out of town also have been so unimpressed, they never mention it when we discuss where to go on the next visit. service is mediocre at best and the food bland. on one visit my guest had to practically tackle the waiter to get him to come back to our table to place an order, and then again to get the bill. not exactly a place to bring someone you want to impress. more like a place to bring someone who is starving from the walk up the hill and can't go another minute.

i guess some refer to this place as "predictable". that's no compliment on its own in my book. mcdonalds is predictable. 

i want good food with good smell, taste, texture, etc.. i have had some of the best food in my life in italy. i do not want my food to smell like the rancid oil-soaked rubber mats that these people spray onto the sidewalk and into the storm drains every night. nasty.

on a positive note, great place to meet rich white tourists.
author: Mulberry S.

description: Great spot - Cozy and romantic, with delicious food.  Extensive wine list, too.  Not good for big groups, and they don't take reservations, but they'll usually bring you a glass of wine or a beer for you to enjoy at one of their few outdoor tables while you wait to be seated inside.
author: Katie K.

description:
Most everthing being said so far is true...you have to wait a while unless you come early, can be crowded.  The employees are awesome, and ...

The big bowl of Pesto Pasta cannot be beat...anywhere.
author: Rod P.

description: We loved this little cafe!  It's tucked away in Nob Hill, but worth the hunt.  The atmosphere was very quaint.  We sat at a table right by the open kitchen and watched the chefs work.  It was the quietest kitchen, with everyone working in sync.  We started with the caprese salad, and it was large enough for us to split.  The tomatoes and mozzarella were very fresh.  I had the special of the evening, farfalle pasta with lobster sauce and calimari, prawns, and smoked salmon.  The sauce was a little rich for my taste, but still very good.  My husband had linguine with a garlic olive oil sauce.  He ate every bite!  We really enjoyed our dinner here.  The service was very good and our waitress was attentive without being overbearing.  She also get our water glasses full, which is a big deal for my husband!  Overall, we would definitely eat here again for the homestyle Italian food and friendly atmosphere.
author: Lauren H.

description: Pretty unoriginal Italian food.  Service was lacking.  Big portions, but nothing you won't find at a tourist trap in North Beach.
author: Simon N.

description: A brilliant gem.  Nob Hill Cafe truly is an incredible restaurant, in fact  I almost don't want you to go there because then I'll have to wait longer for a table next time I go.  If I could eat here every week I would.  The good thing about waiting for a table is that it allows time to buy a bottle of vino at the corner store and enjoy it in the styrofoam cups they keep near the door (take your own opener, you don't want to push it.)  This is a quaint, cozy, fairly casual restaurant that serves up delicious Italian dishes, yummy appetizers and classic desserts.  It's the best that Nob Hill has to offer...great spot to take a date!
author: MJ P.

description: I had the linguine alla vongole, which lacked flavor and gusto.  Wondering if it was just my dish, I tasted my friends' lasagne al forno and gnocchi bolognese only to be disappointed again.  I love the location and atmosphere, but that's nothing if the food's drab.
author: M A N I K.

description: Friendly service, great food, intimate ambiance, reasonable prices.  Gnocchi me.
author: ellyk E.

description:
Truly an outstanding little nugget this place is. I used to go infrequently and always thought it was pretty good. It's been a few years since I've been and tonight I thought I'd try it again, and was I glad I did.
It's small and cozy and there is almost always a wait, but the best places do have waits, it's a fact of life, even in the recession.
Once you get a table the service isn't spectacular, but it's sufficient. The food though, can be outstanding, even to the very picky.
We started with the beet salad. The wife loved it, and I thought it was pretty good. On to the main course, which was served at the same time for both of us, a nice touch. I had the filet of sole and she had a pizza. My soul has never known better sole, really. It was exploding in lemony, capery, creamy, hot bliss. Utterly fantastic. The sides of green beans and pasta were equally delish. The wife absolutely loved her pie, which is not an easy rating to obtain outside of NYC for her, so I am slightly over the moon about this fact. I only hope it lasts. 
I'll be coming back soon. It's two blocks from my abode so there is no excuse. Good times, great food and you can even see the lipstick twins in there (I swear they were in there every time I went in there years ago and sure enough they were in there again tonight - do they eat every meal there or what?). A must try for any Nob Hill gourmand (or wannabe gourmand).
author: Matt H.

description:
Solid neighborhood restaurant. The food is good but not anything special. Their brunches are not as good as lunch/dinner menus. 

I like the outdoor seating and convenient location and they do takeout.
author: Shirley A.

description: I don't often write reviews but I feel compelled to rant a bit here. I wanted so badly to love this little place. It looks charming/adorable, has a fabulous location and lovely-sounding menu. I had not been in many years (cannot remember why but probably because the food never was memorable). I decided to take two women friends here who had never been.  They don't take reservations but we arrived early (6:00 p.m.) and many tables were open.  The waitress was courteous and the menu sounded good. We ordered. The waitress wrote down the order of both of my friends wrong which resulted in a delay (after she had already brought my meal), to correct and bring their food. OK. We overlooked it nicely and did not make any deal of it.  We buy a bottle of wine, three nice dinners and my friend ordered a cappucino after dinner. No sooner had she barely finished the cappucino when the hostess literally came to our table and asked if we could hurry up and leave as suddenly a crowd was brewing outside and it was an hour wait for them (is that our fault???).  We were shocked actually.  None of us have ever been asked to leave before we were ready.  I truly felt she asked us as we are three middle-aged women--perhaps she felt we would "empathize" with her dilemma of the growing crowd outside (who, had arrived at peak dinner hour, unlike us). We noticed she did not ask the couple (with a man) at the table across from us to hurry up and they had been there before us. Really left us all with a bad taste. Additionally, we kept smelling a bad toxic smell of burning plastic in the kitchen. Then we smelled what smelled like propane--which was nauseating.  I was glad to leave but truly annoyed at the service. I will not come back. Food was mediocre which I was willing to overlook (petrale  basically just soaked in butter and cream but not much flavor), had the service been great as I do love the look of the place but now I remember why I only return about once every decade to that place--takes me that long to forget why I did not go back again!!!!
author: Christine J.

description: This is the kind of place where I could see myself around a table with 10 of my closest friends a few days before I get married.  I discovered it when I was in college, and have never stopped going back. The food is always amazing, and it's the coziest place I've ever been into in my life. Althouhg, one time I got really drunk with two of my best friends, and apparently, me and one friend were so loud, and obnoxious, that our other friend was shamed to be seen with us. We'd had like a bottle of wine each, before getitng there for dinner. I dont' recommend showing up in that state.
author: Srinivas R.

description: Great food, fantastic service, quiet street. What more could you ask for? Had a long Saturday lunch there at one of their outside tables. The waitress was extremely friendly and attentive and the food was excellent. Had the prawn and avocado omelette (egg white substition available) and an expresso. It was delicous. Highly recommend.
author: Maren P.

description: Check out the Olsen Twins in 70 years!!  Yup, the infamous local aged twins swing by ever so often.  Their adorable matching outfits add a certain "oomph" to this tiny yet unique cafe.  My buddy's place is a block away, so we usually eat here few times a week.  It's never tiresome, because I strongly believe this is one of the best Italian restaurants in SF.  The bruchetta comes on bread slices the size of my face, it really is a full course meal.  Pastas are always yummy and there's always a good variety of them.  I could never come here without getting some wine, and they've got a great selection here too.  Best seat in the house are the bay window ones, then you can people watch as you eat.  But not so great if you're on a date, then you'll catch your date checking out other hot Nob Hill chicks walking their dogs...for sure not a fun experience.  Not that I would know ;)
author: Wendy H.

description: Good find on accident. Prices very good. Bread was excellent. They had a high chair for my little girl and the people who were eating there were very friendly. I am going back someday when I'm in the area. Afterwords, my family walked to Grace Cathedral and walked on the labyrinth. I've never done that before. We also walked inside the Fairmont. It was a fun night. One of my favorite nights in San Francisco.
author: Sharon B.

description: Consistently good Italian food two blocks away from home is a bit of a dangerous thing. The wine list matches the dishes well to make for delectable pairings. Gnocchi here is unlike anything you've ever had, I promise! Also, the specials menu keeps things fresh if the regular menu gets boring. I even like that its a tiny space. Nob Hill Cafe is quaint and VERY Nob Hill. That's about the only thing I don't like, it gets a little stuffy...
author: Virginia J.

description: I hate the phrase "comfort food", but this place really is Italian comfort food.  It's neighborhoody and small and is a nice place to have locally.  We get take out often and I'm pretty much a 1 trick pony getting the gnocchi with meat sauce.  I will get the lasagna once in a while, but I like the gnocchi.  To be honest, this is not comparable to most of my 4* reviews, but if you are in for something low key and relatively cheap (by the not-so-cheap standards of SF), this is a decent place.  I didn't used to like it, but its a comfortable nob hill/russian hill neighborhood spot.
author: Tim S.

description: Have been here a few times. It is just OK. Today I went to brunch there. The food was once again - just OK. If you have a choice, pick some where else for brunch. Sooo many better places to go. I live close by but still am disappointed every time I leave here. Not sure what all the hype is about in the reviews. I must be eating something different every time I get here. Weak wine list for being so close to wine country - shame really.
author: Doreen D.

description: Excellent food, good service, low-key neighborhood atmosphere. I had the artichoke soup which was outstanding and gnocci with meat sauce which was equally delicious.  Taramiso wasn't to my liking but it tasted very authentic.  Capaccucine was perfect.  My son had a cheese pizza that was dynamite. The place is not cheap but very reasonable and great value for food of this quality.  I'm definitely going back!  Strongly recommend!!!
author: Eric S.

description: The food is good but not great. A little salty. The location service and cafe atmosphere were a winner. Went at 6 and was seated right away. The wines by the glass could stand to be a little cheaper. However, will certainly go back because it is reliable and close!
author: Megan S.

description: Wonderful restaurant- consistently good. Pesto sauce is great, but the absolute best thing is a special that comes up every couple weeks- chicken penne with limoncello cream and snap peas. I count my lucky stars every time I see it on the specials menu.
author: Noelle Q.

description: Great neighborhood place. I love the Nob Hill Cafe because it is close by. Don't bother going here if you are on a diet though! You get sucked in to all the fatterning yummy dishes.  Very charming neighborhood spot.
author: Anna S.

description: I really enjoyed this place. Nice ambiance, pretty good service, warm and cozy. The bread was really good, and the eggplant salad was great. A good place to come for a quiet and unpretentious meal.
author: Dana L.

description: Brunch here is pretty good, but there's a long wait. The dinner here is ok. My girlfriend's pasta wasn't very al dente... it was kinda mushy.
author: Steve C.

description: A fun place and cozy place to eat tuck away in Nob Hill.  Good date place too
author: George M.

description: Good little neighborhood restaurant and great food portion....decent prices. Lovely appetizers!
author: Yan M.

description: It smelled so good and looked like a great place. The chicken parm was so heavy! Simple piece of chicken in a skillet, a little pasta with sauce, and a crap load of parmesan cheese cheese on top!!! The wine selection was engh, not great. I can't believe that there was such a line. I saw some great looking dishes so I will give it another try, maybe for brunch. It would be a nice place to have some vino outside after work if they had a little better selection.
author: Bryan M.

description: I love Nob Hill Cafe because it reminds me of when I lived in the neighborhood and wanted great food in a cozy atmosphere, but didn't want to go far. There's something spectacular about memories and hearty meals that beats crowds any day.
author: Gina G.

description: ok, so it's not a secret, and some "Gracecopalians" consider it a restaraunt of last resort.  I still think it's great.  Food very good  Service good.  The dinner specials are especially good.  Breakfast is good too.  Also, if you live nearby you can order takeout and avoid the dinky dinning room
author: Alec S.

description: Love this place! It's Nob Hill's best kept secret. The food is amazing but it's a small niche little restaurant... so cute. When we had our baby, we ordered from here every night!
author: J S.

description: I've never had a disappointing meal here, though I've never been wowed by anything either.  The prices aren't bad, but the parking is.  If I didn't live a few steps away and had to deal with parking on Nob Hill I'd give it one less star.
author: Helen C.

description: Came here after the Shecky's shopping event.   Within walking distance of the event.  Liked it because it was close by.  Food was decent and the serving sizes were hearty.
author: Julie G.

description: This is an all time neighborhood fav.  My best friend use to live down the block.  I think they have the best veal picatta in the city.  It is always a surprise what the meal shall come w/ depending on the season.   Love the pesto and great wine.  If you are a true city dweller you have to love the sly move on their end to keep up 2 different over hangs to throw non-locals off.  Makes me smile every time.  Ahhh nob hill, how i love thou.  It is great for dates or parents.  My parents make the pilgrimage every time they are in town.  A city must!
author: Nicole F.

description: Consistently good Italian food in a cute setting.  Mostly friendly and competent staff.  Stop in for dinner if you're in the neighborhood.  If you really must drive there's garage parking across from Grace Cathedral.  I think it's call "Masonic" garage.  No freaky ass tourists here either- A big plus.  Mostly locals.  Have dinner and then maybe walk over to the Mark Hopkins hotel for a drink.  A few too many tables jammed in the small space though...The kitchen here has only let me down once here with an overly salty lasagna.
author: Spidermonkey J.

description: I've eaten at Nob Hill Cafe more times than I can count, and I still never know if it's going to be a three- or five-star experience. A couple of those waitresses are GRUFF! All in all, it's a good spot to grab a bite, especially if it's sunny and you can nab a table outside. Note that they do not take reservations, but the wait is never very long.
author: Christina S.

description: Best lasagna I have ever had (sorry mom, I am hoping you don't know how to use the Internet yet!).  Small place, no reservations... but man, worth all the wait if you love great food.  Excellent food, Excellent Service, Amazing prices (for what you get).  It's casual, not pretentious, but in a cute area.
author: Angela B.

description: I love to come this place.  The brunh menu on Saturday and Sunday is awesome.  Dinner is great also.  The food is always fresh.  The price is reasonable.
author: Anna S.

description: I love this place!! It is really cramped, so I agree w/Sarah H it's good for couples only. The food is really basic, but everything is really good. It's well priced and I have frequently seen The Twins dining there (they put them in the window so everyone can gawk at them).
author: Carson H.

description: Haven't had the food but the DESSERTS are DELICIOUS!! Especially the Chocolate Ganache! Had it for 1st time today...
author: v v.

description:
The girl and I are in SF for awhile and she is an avid Yelper and I'm a avid hater of all things chain and touristy. So, it was nice to find a local restaurant where most people seemed local and the food was great.

We started by sharing a caesar salad which was pretty basic. The dressing seemed house made and just a tad too much anchovy paste for my liking but not enough to not enjoy. For our entrees, I had the special which was crab and artichoke ravioli with a lobster bisque cream sauce. Holy crap, was that ever good. The girl had lasagna which she really enjoyed. I had a bite but my review is not fair because compared to my ravioli everything else was just ok. 

A great little place (little being the key word here) and as other reviewers have mentioned, plan on waiting. That's really the only complaint I had. Oh and we were seated right near the constantly opening door which let a blast of that cold SF summer night straight up my back. But any complaints I might have had went straight out the door every time I put a bite of that ravioli into my mouth.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
not only does this place take no reservations, but when you're placed on a wait list, which can often exceed one hour, the restaurant refuses to write down your cell phone number in order to call you when your table is ready.  and, to make matters worse, there are no bars within a couple of blocks.  so in essence, you show up to this restaurant with no reservation, and you are forced to literally stand on the windy sidewalk for more than an hour.  and worse still, they will not seat you unless your entire party is present.  

in our case, we were told that the wait would be more than an hour, so we went to a bar a few blocks away at the huntington hotel.  55 minutes later, two members of our party returned to the restaurant, and our table was ready shortly thereafter.  however, even though the remaining 4 members of our party were only minutes away, our table was given away and we were told we had to wait another half hour for a table.  this was preposterous.

the food was mediocre - pretty standard if not lackluster fare italian, but overpriced.  we finished our meal close to closing time.  we knew the restaurant wanted to close because they started cleaning all around us using lysol, the stench of which singed our nostrils. 

 in a town like san francisco, there are plenty of options for excellent italian food in an intimate setting with a wait staff that appreciates your presence.  

steer clear of this place.
author: josh w.

description:
This was my second time eating at this restaurant. I'm not sure if I'll return again. First off, the waiter with an Irish accent was a bit abrupt and not very personable. The bread was soft, fresh and warm.
We ordered the caprese salad with so-called buffalo mozarella and I was not impressed. Not enough olive oil or balsamic vinegar and the mozarella tasted like mozarella and not fine, tender and sweet like what buffalo mozarella is supposed to be. When we asked the waiter he sort of brushed it off without any concern that we were concerned.
Then we ordered the calamari entree described as sauteed with garlic and wine....well, I tell you all I tasted was biting lemon flavor.
I expected calamari pieces but instead was served 'chopped up and formed into a rectangular shape'....it also was tastless inside and kinda rubbery. It had some extreme lemony batter on the outside devoid of any hints of garlic or wine. 
We also ordered pizza with artichoke hearts but it tasted like a glob of cheese with hardly any tomato sauce. 
Needless to say I won't be going back for a long time and probably won't tell any friends to go. Yes, it is romantic and quaint but the food seems to be lacking something....
I love garlic and wine in cooking and have not tasted any of these elements in the so-called 'Italian' food.
author: Josey E.

description: Can be very busy and has good service. I had chicken parmagina it was very tasty and classic italian. We took the cable cars up and visited the cable car museum, then we walked to the restaurant. Not good for large parties, we had seven people we had to split into two parties.
author: lesly l.

description: Very consistent food and a warm, casual atmosphere make this a wonderful Nob Hill staple. Take a date or a friend who's visiting from out of town, or just grab a mimosa and people watch on a Sunday morning. I always see the Twins here at their regular table by the window, so this place is doing something right.
author: Jason B.

description: I love this place.  It is quaint and cozy.  The vibe is wonderful.  The pasta and bread are also fantastic.  Go on Tuesday and Friday nights and see Marion and Vivian Brown, the best twins that I have ever seen!
author: Joanna S.

description: One of my favorite places to go in the City.  They don't take reservations but it is well worth the wait.  On a Fri. or Sat. night you might even get a glimpse of the San Francisco twins.  Great food, unpretentious environment, low prices for the quality of food, impeccable service and a decent wine list if you go by the bottle.
author: Katie P.

description:
I'm a sucker for cute places like neighborhood restaurants and cafes.  I am also a sucker for white Christmas lights when its not Christmas.  Wow, Nob Hill Cafe is 2 for 2 already.

I think this is one of those "if you live in Nob Hill, you gotta go" type places.  I fit the description so I went!  No reservations, the place is teeny so they make you wait outside...kind of odd.  Some choose to drink a glass of wine while they wait, so sometimes when I'm walking by at night, I see a group of well dressed people huddling around each other for warmth and sipping on some red wine.  Weird.  Is it even legal to be drinking alcohol on the sidewalk?? HMMMM this ain't Vegas!

ok anyway, I went a couple of months ago and can not remember what I ate so it must've not been that memorable.  What I do remember was the ambiance: quaint yet refined.  Our waitress was also quite friendly.  Perfect for a date, totally not perfect for a party of 9 with 2 little kids squeezed into the middle of the restaurant.
author: Vivian L.

description: If you're looking for a great Italian restaurant with a neighborhood feel this is the spot! The food here is amazing!
author: Summer C.

description: A great neighborhood restaurant. Meals under $25 a person, but arrive before 7 p.m. to avoid a wait on most days.
author: Vivien C.

description: Our first stop when we got to San Francisco, and it ended up being our last stop before we went home. GREAT pizza, the gnocchi are like lovely little clouds and the service impeccable. Not touriste at all, perfect for a late lunch or dinner.
author: Jud V.

description: This place is adorable! It's so quaint and a great spot to recommend for out of towners wanting to avoid a tourist trap. Sometimes you have to wait  to get seated, but on a nice night you can get a glass of wine and sit at the outside tables. The pastas and pizza are all great.
author: Ginny S.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the city. The environment is cozy and intimate and the food is excellent (Italian style). I love to go with a small group or one other person, get a bottle of wine, relax and talk. Dress can range from casual to dressy and the dishes are cheap! This is a great low maintenance spot in a charming neighborhood.
author: Courtney R.

description: Been going here for years and its always wonderful.  Great neighborhood spot... hard to park and they dont take reservations, so keep that in mind.  Pasta comes in a big bowl and I love the pesto!
author: Mary S.

description: Great, consistent, reasonably priced food in the neighborhood.  Portions are quite large too.  I usually get the gnocchi bolognese.  I don't like heavy cream sauces, which is how I usually see gnocchi on other menus.  So since I love gnocchi and love bolognese sauce, it's perfect!  Boyfriend likes their pizzas.  They don't take reservations, but it's worth the wait and you can order a glass of wine while you wait.  On Friday nights, you can usually catch the San Francisco "twins" dining in the window with their matching suits and pillbox hats.
author: Chibi Q.

description: Good food in a nice location with horrible parking.  Well, not horrible in that it is hard to find, its easy to find, but expensive...just add $10 or so to the dinner total.  The veal piccata was good, as was the melanzane (eggplant) salad.  The side of steamed snap peas w/butter was done perfectly.  The only slight disappointment was the side of penne alfredo (or at least it seemed like a vague-ly alfredo-ish sauce).  Service was good and the bread was fresh and warm as well.  We went early, so got in easily, but i "pity the fools" (sorry Mr. T) who came late, as they got to sit outside drinking their wine on the totally un-heated sidewalk area (it would seem so easy to put some heaters there, but...)
author: Mike B.

description: Love, Love, Love the spaghetti carbonara; it's so yummy and rich but most likely pretty fatty but you can't have it all.  Really cute place-nice ambiance and cool to see the Original Doublemint twin ladies.  Been here a few times and I've never had an unpleasant experiece.  Oh yeah, the pizza is really good too.  Minus one star for the usually long wait.
author: Francis M.

description: We ate here twice while we were here, both times for lunch. I would say after four entrees, the Marguerita pizza was the best. It is enough for two and it is awesome. The past is very good. We do not recommend the Caesar salad. Service was Great.
author: Dr. Kelli H.

description: Decent Italian food in a quaint, neighborhood setting.  I had the pasta carbonara, which was good, if not traditional (it was really creamy, like an alfredo).  My husband had the lasagna, which he felt was too cheesy.  The wine we had (the Primitivo) was pretty awful.  What makes this place likable is that it is pretty predictable and low-key, and if you're like me, sometimes that sounds good on a weeknight when you just want a bowl of pasta and a cheap glass of wine.
author: Michelle A.

description: Sadly this is one of the worst customer service stories I have had in a long, long time. We had a party of 6 but one person was 10 minutes behind the group. We asked to be seated and the answer was, "We don't seat people unless the ENTIRE party is here!" Now this was at 5:30 pm and there was 1 single table with people at it, the ENTIRE place was EMPTY. The waitress and hostess was condescending and rude. Now the 6th person was in a taxi and was going to be there in 10 minutes and I do understand that if it they were full or busy that it could be a problem. But honestly...does that make sense to you??? Too bad because we left and had a dinner at a nice restaurant down the street (and spent $500 on the meal).  Can't speak for the food since we didn't eat, but if the customer service is any indication it can't be that good!
author: Tom S.

description:
So unbelievable overpriced for something not exceptional.
The wait was also INSANE!!!

The joint is crazy small, which is part of the cause of the wait, but also the service is SLOW.
author: M J.

description: Amazing food and service in such an adorable, family-owned restaurant. Everything we had was delicious, in particular, you must try their daily specials. The service was wonderful and the hostess couldn't have been sweeter. :-)
author: Kate W.

description: When I lived a block from this restaurant, I came here once a week and ordered the same thing every time: ensalada mixta and penne arribiata with chicken. Of course everybody else I came with ordered everything from the pizza to the pesto--all big hits. The famous San Francisco twins come here every so often, too. Since parking is rough, it's a fantastic neighborhood spot that can be whatever you want it to be--casual or romantic.
author: sarah s.

description: If I wouldn't gain 500 pounds by eating here, even after the hike up the hills, I would go everyday.  The pesto tortellini is great.
author: Liz E.

description:
one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  it's a cute neighborhood restaurant- great for dinner with your sig. other, brunch with your friends, or just desert & coffee by yourself.  everything on the menu is delicioso!  oh, they have celebrity appearances by the nob hill twins on friday nights.  they are so lovely!

Overall Rating: 4 stars (yummy food, convenient location)
author: E S.

description: Cozy and romantic place.  Went there on one of the few hottest days we get in the year and had drinks while we sat outside (they don't take reservations, but the wait doesn't seem so bad since you can order drinks while you wait).  The San Francisco twins were even there.  The service was great and the food was tasty.  We had the caprese salad and bruschetta, and then an eggplant dish and pizza.  All were quite good.  I would definitely go back.
author: seta a.

description: The food was delicious. The noise level the best. We could actually hear our own conversation without yelling.  They ran a little late with our reservation (they don't seem to rush people out of their place to accomodate the next reservation) but  made up for it by buying us a small pizza. Then one main course was late so they took the charge off the bill.  Good business practice because we will be back for their service as well as the food. JG
author: Jackie G.

description: I have been traveling to Italy for my work annually for the past 6 years so I know my  cucina italiana very well and I have to say that this place has the best, most authentic gnocchi I have found in San Francisco. There is always a wait to get in but just relax and have a glass of wine while you prepare for an awesome meal.
author: Nicole K.

description: We went to Nob Hill Cafe before a show at the Masonic Auditorium (2 blocks away) and loved it.  This is a great little neighborhood gem of a restaurant.  Small.  Very casual.  Very good food.  Everyone in our group of four were very pleased with their order.
author: Jim J.

description: What can I say that others have not?  We were staying at the Fairmont and it was only a few blocks away.  Yeah we could have gone somewhere more trendy, but this place blew us away with the friendly atmosphere and pretty damn good food.  In fact it was so good we went there for dinner twice..  I would recommend the Caesar salad with two thumbs up. Nice and garlicy anchovy taste.. The pizzas are great as are the pastas.. The calamari entree is wonderful but a shock to those that have never had a calamari steak.   Prices are cheap for Nob Hill,  and the service ranged from uber friendly to great.  Hats off -  this place made me want to open my own restaurant again.
author: james b.

description: I've eaten here once and wasn't enthused. Its italian and expensive. I ate a late lunch of just fettucini with Alfredo sauce and some meat. That alone cost me around 20 bucks. Yet just the basics just wasn't worth it to me. I've eaten many placed and I just don't care to eat here again. I see how it could be romantic and cozy as it it small. I just don't think the food is up to par.
author: Justin T.

description: I've had the gnocchi and tortellini with creamy pesto and both were excellent. It's a great value but gets pretty crowded. Be prepared to wait, and enjoy some of the house red while you do. It's delicious!
author: Cameron E.

description: Compared to many restaurants in San Francisco, the food served at the Nob Hill café is not stellar.  The friendly service and the setting easily make up for what is missing in the food.
author: Michael P.

description: Best lasagna I have had in the city! A bit of a wait, but nice to sit outside in their European table top setting and enjoy a glass of wine while you wait!
author: Kathryn E.

description: They have breakfast on a pizza. Need I say more? Sunday mornings can be quite a wait, but it is worth it. The food is always consistent- very good for the price and location - but I wouldn't say divine. This is also a great place to go as a single diner or as a couple; the intimate atmosphere makes it ideal for smaller parties but less so for larger ones. I like it- I really like it.
author: Andrew S.

description: A very pleasant neighborhood restaurant with affordable prices. The wine list is not very extensive, but you get what you pay for. I highly recommend the dessert, so try to save room if you can. The pizzas are authentically thin and the service is quick and friendly.
author: Alexander M.

description:
I love having a well-respected local restaurant so close. This is confirmed by the weekly visit by the famous San Francisco twins - of course seated on display in the window where they will wave graciously at those who whisper and point at them.  
The menu doesn't change, but it's nice to have things in life that don't - we can always enjoy cozy warmth of the open kitchen, a bottle of Five Brothers wine, Tortellini alfredo and an apetizer of Melon & proscuitto. 
Great about this place is that it impresses without being pretentious.  
Four stars only because of one disgruntled waitor; I suspect that he feels that his austere air is striking.  Its okay, we are not bothered by your bristlyness!
(If you cannot bear waiting for a table you might run into trouble, but they will always get you in under half an hour & try walking a half block to Huntington Park for a stroll around the lit fountain or to Mason & Sacramento street where at that corner you will have great views of the bay & the bay bridge)
author: Katie H.

description:
i would give this place a 3.5, but you know, not an option.

my friend took me here a few months ago, and it was very good. there was no wait, we just walked in (it was an early evening on a  weekday, around 5ish) though a mad stream of people came in later into our meal. the place itself is cute, low-key and comfortable. 

we shared the lasagna and the spaghetti carbonara; if i were to base this review off just the carbonara i'd give it 5 stars, but that lasagna really brought things down.

the lasagna was way too salty; the sauce was overseasoned by the fistfuls, and the noodle layers were kind of hard on the edges, though palatable on the inside. the rest of it was just forgettable, marred by the overwhelming sauce. disappointing.

the spaghetti carbonara though, was terrific--i loved it. fresh made pasta, cooked perfectly, and the sauce was really delicious; subtle, rich, savory. i've had carbonaras that were too heavy-handed with the butter and egg, were grossly overindulgent with the cream, or would overkill with the garlic--but Nob Hill did ithis dish On Point. i would come here and get the spaghetti carbonara every time (assuming it's consistently good). 

service was ok, not overly friendly or attentive but not ignoring you either; it's a laid back, casual spot, so you don't expect to have the waitpersons on you at every turn. 

overall very enjoyable, great carbonara, casual cozy atmosphere and affordable prices. BAD lasagna. GO for the Carbonara, if nothing else!
author: L C.

description: My favorite place to come and cozy up with a glass of wine and salad on a rainy day. This place is fantastic!
author: J Leigh W.

description: This is a charming, cozy restaurant with consistently good food. I've had the lasagna and pizza--I recommend both. There's usually a wait but if it's a nice night out you can sit outside with a glass of wine, which makes the wait less painful.
author: Andrea S.

description: A little neighborhood place just around the corner from where I live.  I can understand why many people would love it.  Given the convenience, it is regrettable I am not a big fan.  Too long to wait for a table, too small, too many dishes with cream sauces, service too slow (at least the time I was there).  My wife and I frequently walk past to see if the Doublemint Twins are sitting in the window seat with matching outfits.  They often are.  It always makes my wife smile when she sees them.  It is good to see the wife smile.
author: Roy C.

description: This place is great for a lazy weekend lunch. Penne w/ vodka sauce, the baked eggplant with ziti, pesto with pine nuts and bruschetta are all faaaantastic. too bad theyre not open at 330 am. damn it!
author: Anthony P.

description:
cozy lil joint in the quaint neighborhood of nob hill. 

simple & delicious.
author: tiff f.

description:
I've only been here for breakfast/brunch, but have never been disappointed. The food, coffee, everything is incredibly fresh and delicious. My boyfriend and I eat here most weekends that we are both in town and tend to get the same things: he's a huge fan of their prawn and avocado omelette and I get an omelette with cheese, onions, and pancetta. The portions are large and come with an excellent side of roasted potatoes. 

Aside from good food, the service is amazing. All of the servers are polite, fast, and attentive without being annoying. The only thing I would change is that they don't open up until 11:00 am, and I'm usually hungry long before then!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Going to keep it short and sweet, as there are already a ton of reviews for this place. Liked the ambiance. Friendly waitress. Calzone was very tasty. Pasta with garlic tomato sauce was boring and bland.
author: rachel s.

description: Nevermind the Golden Gate...when I visit San Fran...Nob Hill Cafe is one of the first spots I visit.  There is always a wait...but I would wait 3 hours to eat at this italian eatery.  The staff is extremely friendly and effecient.  The food is out of this world.  Love the atmosphere...very cozy...perfect for those chilly San Fran nights.  My oldest son wants to move to SF just so we could eat at Nob Hill Cafe whenever we wanted!
author: Lindsey K.

description: when i first walked thru the door i saw the scowl on her face. i didnt know untill later that was our waitress. food was ok but the waitress twice within 2 minutes picked up the check b4 i could address it. i think she wanted us to leave so she could seat another guest.made us feel like we were being given the bum rush.
author: Lee M.

description: I love the Nob Hill Cafe!  I love creamy sauces, and Nob Hill completely satisfies my desires when hungry for a pesto cream, or a spicy tomato cream or an alfredo pasta!  They also have a good wine list that won't break the bank.  When I went to NHC for the first time, I was exposed to the famous SF twins sitting in one of the window seats.  This time around, my husband and I were seated in that very window seat and just as I was worrying that the twins might show up and find us sitting in their seats, my fears were actualized!!  They came, all dressed up and ready to sit in their seats, but found us, some shabbily dressed commoners sitting in their special spot!  I could tell they were less than thrilled as they sipped their wine right next to us and seemed ready to hook and lasso us right out of those seats.  But, they were kind enough to let us eat and run.  Anyhow, my creamy pesto tortellini was awesome and the salad was fresh as could be.  My husband was not too keen on the carpaccio, stating that it was too wet and the mustard that came on top was not spicy dijon, but just a mild mustard.  Other than that, I always enjoy the comfy, cozy, delicious, affordable, Nob Hill Cafe!  It's a great date spot and one to sit back, sip some wine and watch the people walk by (oh and the fancy identical duo when their seats haven't been usurped by some boring non twins)
author: Maral P.

description: Good, friendly service.  Although the pizza crust wasn't as crunchy as I'd like, it was a delicious pizza with the freshest ingredients.  The Caesar Salad was fresh, tasty and well-dressed.  the bread was sweet and delicious.  This is definitely a neighborhood gem!
author: M R.

description: Best eggplant parm I've ever had.  The eggplant wasn't breaded and it was perfectly cooked.  Loved the cheese.  Cozy, small space.  No nonsense.
author: Carole C.

description: Yes, the Nob Hill Cafe is cozy and charming.  An intimate setting with decent priced eats which have decent flavor.  But what i really love about the Nob HIll Cafe is that the creepy Nob Hill twins will occasional dine here.  And on one such occasion I happened to be sitting next to them.  During their meal they got into a ridiculous argument about something so petty such as, "No, John's apartment was on the left side of the building."  " No it was on the right!"  They were literally yelling at each other.  I was afraid they were going to get into a fist fight and wigs would be flying left and right.  Just when i saw the claws coming out, the owner of the Nob Hill Cafe came over to the twins to ask if a customer could take his picture with them.  And with that the twins transformed into the sweetest, most charming little bffs.  I was completely entertained and full of tasty pasta.  Ahhh, charming Nob Hill.
author: Alexis M.

description: I was in the Nob Hill area with two companions around dinner time last Friday night. With limited options, we decided to try the Nob Hill Cafe. When we put our name in, the wait was about 35 minutes. It seemed like a lot of patrons were waiting outside for the limited seating inside. The wait was quite a bit longer than we were told, and the wine we ordered while we waited wasn't the best, but it was worth it. When I finally sat down, I looked up and saw, to my absolute surprise, the famous San Francisco twins!! Unfortunately for my Yelp review, this happened to be the highlight of my NH Cafe experience. They were seated at the table directly in front of me, so I had a hard time staying focused on my food and conversation. (For good reason: they were wearing matching leopard print cowboy hats and jackets and drinking more hard alcohol than any pair of 93 year old women should.) Our waiter told us that the twins dine at NHC every Tuesday and Friday evening around 8:30. I'm not saying that it wouldn't be worth it to go here outside of these times, but it just might give your meal that true San Francisco flavor.
author: Kate G.

description: Had a great low-key dinner here with the bf recently.  We had heard good things and I know lots of good Yelp reviews don't lie, so we eagerly cabbed it over.  It's a tiny little place that doesn't accept reservations and it's in BFNH so when we saw the wait, we really didn't have a choice but to do just that.  We sat outside and froze our arses off because they didn't have any heaters!  The hostess tried to keep our minds off the chill with bringing us glasses of wine, but that really didn't help bc I had to take my arms out of my mummy-like pose to drink it.  Once we got inside, however, the close quarters and the heat from the kitchen warmed me right up.  We started off with a eggplant, tomato & mozzarella salad with the good intentions of eating healthy.  The menu looked good but the specials looked better, so I had the porcini gnocchi (of course) and the bf had the something-italian-and-unpronounceable-but-sounded-great.  My dish was too-die-for... I literally thought I'd close an artery the sauce was so rich, but soooooo good and the gnocchi just melted in my mouth!  The bf's dish was a bit on the lighter side, jam packed with prawns & calamari in a pink cream sauce.  With all the fabulous fare and the cozy warmth, it didn't take long for the food coma to set in.  Luckily, taxis usually buzz down the street so we just hopped in one and we took our full-tummies home for the night.
author: Tara G.

description: Had a horrible time last night for dinner....definitely disappointed....so our Pinot Grigio was warm, apologies from our waitress w/ a long drawn out story about some refrigerator breakdown (don't' care just bring us a chilled glass)....then the beet salad special arrived...yummy--however my friend didn't like beets and left them on his plate--for me to rescue--however before I could scoop in a get them from his plate the waitress cleared his plate--vulture style...WTF...then the bread basket gone...she was clearing the table fast food style to make room for our main entrees...why the rush, there was no wait and one empty table...hummm...different vibe from my previous visits..so my friends special of the night arrives to the table--we were blown away by the visual beauty and the aroma...but then the taste! ouch!! amazing seafood and lobster bisque cream sauces however the peppercorn topping was out of control and everywhere...it was a search and rescue to pick them off....then my chicken parm arrived...visually amazing...but horrible....even the table next to me was eying my dish up...but when I showed them the real deal of the dry chicken w/ 1/2 of it not covered w/ cheese nor marina...they were grossed out....super bad...tasted like unseasoned chicken...blah...well they comped us for the chicken and gave dessert...but dessert was brought to the table next to us b/c of chef error...and then another table also complained....it was an off night last night, however with so many yummy places in the hood, I will go else where...
author: Trish t.

description: This has always been one of my favorite restaurants.  I used to live nearby so I was able to come by a lot more frequently.  Unfortunately parking in this neighborhood can be a bear.  I still love the place though.  I like the bolognese with the gnocci, but that vodka marinara is also quite good.
author: Cindy W. T.

description: very cozy place for dinner. quiet enough for good conversations but lively as this place was packed the night i went.  tired and cranky from dealing with the afternoon rush hour traffic in the city.. and with the horrible parking situation in nob hill (yeah there are a few garages nearby but scored a free spot luckily)... this place was worth going to. good italian food that was refreshing considering all the mediocre tourist traps i've tried in north beach.  finally, i've got a good italian place to come back to. had the insalata caprese (yum!) and linguine with clams (tasty!!). and the espresso i had as my 'dessert' hit the spot!
author: ally o.

description: very good pizza, good veal, good experience altogether.  only set back is no reservations, so often a decent sized wait if you don't get there too early.
author: Greg M.

description:
this restaurant is successful because of the business they get from the many hotels within a four block radius. 

the food is so-so, and the service is lacking in many respects. i live around the corner, and am always surprised that there is a line for this place. 

the best thing about nob hill cafe, is the ambiance. it's a really cut little restaurant and relatively inexpensive. 

if you live in the neighborhood, try venticello, owned by the same people. it is a much better restaurant in every regard.
author: cassandra v.

description: Massive breakfast burrito! Lots of chorizo, but needed a little more egg and cheese. Great service from a charming young lady. It wasn't a 5 star burrito, but it was very good. A solid 4
author: J J.

description: they tried. we had the carpaccio for appetizer which was very good. my husband had the gnocchi and i had the angel hair pasta. both were tasty, but not anything that really separated itself from other good italian restaurants. though our waitress was apologetic, my husband had to sit through dinner getting blasted by the draft of the entrance door to the back of his head while experiencing oven heat on one side of his face every time someone ordered the pizza. the place is small, so i guess next time we'll definately make reservations. the dessert was forgettable. the place is cute and i wouldn't mind going there again, but it didn't leave a lasting impression.
author: Charlene C.

description: I have been to Very frew restaurant in my neighborhood because when I think about dining out, I want to be away from the hood.  Nob hill cafe is one of few I decided to go and it didn't fail me.  In fact they have very good pasta dishes and you won't get out of there hungry.
author: Su Kyeong K.

description: hell yes! great pasta dishes. saw a review about this on "check please." they never take reservations and parking is a biznatch. delicous appetizer too, eggplant and feta something. our waitress was nice too. definitely will go back again!
author: Anita C.

description: I've passed by this place a couple of times but never had the chance to eat here until last night. Since I was staying in the area with the bf, we decided to have dinner here. It's a very small, neighborhood restaurant, and definitely popular with the neighborhood crowd and the tourists who don't want to spend and arm and a leg at the hotel restaurants. We got there just before the rush and didn't have to wait for a table. I ordered the veal picatta and my bf ordered the spaghetti carbonara. The veal was great, very tender and well cooked. The only thing I didn't like was they put way too many capers which made it taste too salty but I scraped it off and it was better. It came with sugar snap peas which were sooo crisp and good and some penne with alfredo sauce....yum. the bf enjoyed the carbonara, and said he can probably eat it everyday if he could. Our waitress was very nice and accomodating even though she was super busy helping other guests. Totally recommended!
author: Pippi L.

description: I've been here several times given I used to live so close.  Their food is delicious and I loved how fast they were for pick-up.  The only bad part was the price; $20 for pasta seems a little steep sometimes.
author: Melissa S.

description: I dont see what the fuss is all about. The attitude of the staff here stinks. I decided to stop by with my wife for an afternoon drink, possibly snack. We waited for at least 30 minutes, during which time we were not even offered a glass of water. The waiters seemed totally unconcerned and uncaring that we had been waiting for so long. I reached out to a waiter for a menu and to request placing an order twice. I was totally ignored. We left in disgust.!! The place was not even busy ! No matter how a good a reputation a place has for food or whatever, nohing can replace just decent service and a professional attitude towards customers. This place sucks ! I will not recommend this place to anyone. Bad attitude and bad service !!  Frankly giving them one star is being generous.
author: Michael B.

description: I stopped by for a late visit for some appetizers and dessert after eating an early dinner.  Salad was okay, bruschetta was tasty, and tiramisu was just okay.  Nothing stood out!  It's a place I would go if I was in the neighborhood but not go out of my way to visit.  Be prepared to wait even on a weekday!
author: sasaw A.

description: I love this neighborhood restaurant.  The food is consistently good, and the staff is very nice and helpful.  Parking is difficult, but it is in a easy location to get to.  Their wine list is generally small, but is well picked out to match the Italian fare.
author: Danian P.

description: I've really tried to give this place a chance , but it seems that it is always something when I go that I have just decided I will not eat there anymore. Cons.... Irish waiter who acts like he would rather be at the dentist then be waiting on you. Hostess who acts like she'd rather be at the gyno then seat you. Tables so close together that you can barely move your arms some time's. And the last one which caused me to write this review in the first place. I go there on a Wednesday night with my bf and a girlfriend of mine. We are waiting for my friends bf to get there. I understand the whole concept of not seating incomplete parties but if you ask for a table for 4 when there are only 3 of you there and they make you wait, that I don't get. Do they make tables for 3????? So we wait..... her boyfriend finally gets there and they tell us it's now an hour wait because we didn't have our complete party there and now there are guest in front of us. As the hostess said " well if your whole party would have came together this wouldn't have happened" . I wanted to punch her!!! So I ask to speak to the manager and the Irish waiter says "she's not here " and walks away from me. So I ask someone else. He says " we don't have one". Are these people kidding!!!! Needless to say we left and went somewhere else!!!!!!!!! These people are rude and act like they are doing you a favor. So many other choices in SF... Bye bye Nob Hill Cafe!!!
author: lisa v.

description: We live right across the street from this place and go here often. Always delicious. But ask for light on the garlic! Their specialty pizzas are awesome
author: brad m.

description: this place was rad. the food was great and it wasn't too expensive. everyone that worked there was nice and with dinner for two, wine and dessert, it was super reasonable. i would tell my grand kids to go here when i grow up.
author: Mike L.

description: A very enjoyable experience.  Came here on a random Tuesday evening at around 7:30, but still had to wait for about 45 min.  However, the wait was not too bad.  The hostess offered to take our drink orders while we had to wait.  She was very attentive and apologetic that we had to wait so long for our table.  When we were finally seated our orders were taken promptly.  The food was a variety of warm Italian comfort food.  At the end of our delicious meal when we were about to order dessert they brought out an order tiramisu and strawberry gelato as an apology for our long wait.  So unexpected but very appreciated by all of us.  Definitely go back for the good food and great service.
author: Doris K.

description: Ok maybe this is not fair-  We flew in from Detroit this day- and it was late ( past 8 pm ) though we did have to wait a half hour-  Still, overall the place was just ok-  My wife had the pesto pasta which was good, and I stayed traditional with Chicken Parm which was so hot for so long I could barely eat it-  and while the sauce was quite good the chicken was amazingly bland- So for us, the place was just ok
author: kevin e.

description: We went there when we were visiting San Fran and we ended up eating there almost every night!  The food is excellent (you have to try the gnocchi-- literally the best I have ever had) and affordable.  The waiters are very friendly, too.  It reminded me of a Boston North End Italian restaurant.  Be prepared to wait, though-- everyone else in San Francisco seems to know this is the place to eat!
author: C S.

description: Great local restaurant....food is reasonably priced and DELICIOUS, atmosphere is cozy and the service is great.  I highly recommend stopping by (preferably on the earlier side so you don't have to wait outside).
author: Marie N.

description: Love this place. Food is plain and simply...kinda like comfort food and the service is wonderful. The waitress was full of personality and made our night.
author: Danielle S.

description: Neighborhood feel and location were great especially when you are pretending to live in grand style on Nob Hill in a hotel that someone else is paying for!  The Irish hostess was charming, our waitress a little less so.  Two out of three of us started with the huge bowl of ribollita, which was really a thick minestrone-type soup sans the bread that the original recipe requires.  I added my own from the overflowing bread basket and was perfectly content, especially when it was all topped by a generous sprinkling of parmesan cheese and EVOO (well, let's just pretend it was, shall we?) My other table-mate had an interesting interpretation of an Insalata Caprese, which despite that fact that it was not what he expected and was dressed overgenerously with oil and balsamic, he seemed to enjoy.  Two of us had pizza:  one margherita and one gorgonzola and something, which were both good.  Our third ordered the calamari, which turned out to be a huge rubbery and tasteless calamari steak served bad Italian restaurant-style with a side of fettucine is some sort of alfredo like sauce and with a green vegetable.  Let's just say our companion pouted, eventually the dish was sent back and I shared by generous pizza with him.  I might go back if I could get up the hill, either on foot, bus or cablecar, because it was quaint and it was nice to walk past the cathedral after dinner and hear the cable car cables rumble below our feet, and the big white bowls of pasta I saw go by our table looked appetizing.
author: Mia C.

description: I used to live a couple blocks from here when I first moved to the city a few years ago so I'm slightly biased with my nostalgia.  Cozy setting with the restaurant being split into two rooms - the kitchen side, and the bar side.  Definitely try to sit on the bar side because its quieter and has better lighting.  There is an outside patio to grab a glass of wine and wait.  Because there's no parking and its located on top of Russian Hill, you can get seated within a reasonable amount of time.  I go with the linguini and clams which is fantastic.  And the pizza is good too.
author: Eric G.

description: The food is good, the waiters are friendly. There was a wait and the place is a little cramped but the tierramisu made up for it.
author: ghgghh f.

description: This place deserves 4.5 stars for being a nice Italian Cafe. I'm giving 5 stars, because the overall average with this place is just over 4 stars.  Since I started coming here last October, I have enjoyed their pizza, calzones, petrale sole, lasagna, oso bucco,  and tortellini bolognese.  Their pizza is better than any pizza from the local pizza joint.  If you get a pizza with onion, sausage, and mushroom, you actually taste the onion, sausage, and mushroom.  The atmosphere is nice and the price is lower than right, which translates to a very good value.  The only slight drawback to this place is that they do not take reservations and if you show up at 7:30, you will probably have to wait a while...  Still, the place is highly recommended.
author: Darren V.

description: For all the people coming here for the first time, there are 2 doors--choose the one on the left!  I tried to go in the wrong way, as did at least 5 other people after me.  Once inside the correct door and seated next to the wrong door (with a perfect view of others' failed attempts to enter), we were greeted with "hello, would you like bottled or tap?"--hmmm....not the most elegant way to get the meal started.  That being said, the rest of the evening was great.  As the meal progressed, I realized the waitress was not being rude, just very casual/informal and friendly.  The caesar salad was average and was missing the croutons, but the tortellini romano and the sole were both delicious--the chef definitely knows how to use butter (yum!).  At the suggestion of the waitress we got the chocolate ganache and the strawberry gelato white chocolate cheesecake--omg--super-yummy!  If you can sit by the window, this place also offers some great people-watching opportunities....would go again just for that.
author: colette m.

description: We had a friend in from out of town staying at the Mark Hopkins so we wanted to have dinner in walking distance from her hotel.  I called Nob Hill Cafe and they do not take reservations but estimated a 20 minute wait which we were okay with.  We arrived at 7PM and put in our name.  It was raining outside and there is no inside area to wait for a table, so we parked under the awning outside at their second entrance, about 6 feet from the front door.  After 25 minutes we checked in with the host and were told we were next up behind a party of 5.  Another 20 minutes later we checked in again.  We were told they had called our names and we did not respond so they gave our table away.  We told them we had been waiting about 6 feet from the front door under their own awning (with other people)!  We asked if they had another table for us and we were told no- no apology, nothing.  I am 7 months pregnant and by the time we sat down we had been waiting a very uncomfortable 1 hour and 15 minutes standing in the rain.  Talk about poor host service!  Fortunately, once we were seated the food was great and the server we had did a great job.  All in all I would not go back because of the poor service we received being seated for a table.  There are way too many other San Francisco restaurants nearby that will provide stellar hospitality.
author: Karen W.

description: I've been to this cafe 5 times now, and this is the best food in San Francisco - great service (yes, with the Irish accented waiter - he was terrific) and I also met the famous "Brown Twins" there...  aside from that, the food is wonderful.  The other night the special was Fruita de Mare (mixed seafood) in a lobster bisque sauce over linguini... OMG! fabulous!  The white clam sauce is light and very flavorful, the eggplant parm is out of this world good and the calamari steak sauteed in a piccata sauce (white wine, butter, lemon and capers) is the best!  The bruschetta is great, and just a plain green dinner salad is special with a light lemony house dressing. The service has been consistantly great and the bread is reason enough to go there - foccatia and regular Italian bread, served warm.  The prices are very reasonable, and the portions not too large, and definitely not too small.  I'm going back there again tonight!  What a find!!!
author: Mariellen B.

description: great food and wine. the wait staff is very nice and saw the famous san francisco twins sitting in their spot next to the window...
author: marcie d.
